Covering the group’s stylistic tendencies, influences, and most important protagonists, this introductory book explores the Expressionist panorama of moods, ideas, and emotions and their abiding quest for deep authenticity.

title: Surrealism
description:
With Salvador Dalí as its figurehead, the great ship of Surrealism traversed the turbulent seas of the early 20th century with sails billowing with dreams and desires. Inspired by the psychoanalytical practice of Sigmund Freud, the Surrealists championed the unconscious as the domain of truth, uninhibited by the standards or expectations of society.

With techniques ranging from hypnotism to nocturnal walks to automatic writing, the likes of André Breton, Max Ernst, Brassaï, and Meret Oppenheim produced paintings, drawings, texts, and films in which they sought to excavate their most intimate and primal instincts. The results abound with sexual fantasies, with mysterious, menacing creatures, and with the juxtaposition of seemingly contradictory objects or ideas.

This book introduces the origins and the sensational legacy of the Surrealist movement, one of the most profound and enduring influences on film, theater, literature, art, and thought.

Featured artists: Hans Arp, André Breton, Giorgio de Chirico, Salvador Dalí, Max Ernst, Alberto Giacometti, Paul Klee, René Magritte, André Masson, Matta, Joan Miró, Pablo Picasso, Meret Oppenheim, Yves Tanguy

title: Kandinsky
author: Hajo Duchting
description:
Over the course of his artistic career, Wassily Kandinsky (1866-1944) transformed not only his own style, but the course of art history. From early figurative and landscape painting, he went on to pioneer a spiritual, emotive, rhythmic use of color and line and is today credited with creating the first purely abstract work.

As much a teacher and theorist as he was a practicing artist, Kandinsky's interests in music, theater, poetry, philosophy, ethnology, myth, and the occult, were all essential components to his painting and engraving. He was involved with both the influential Blaue Reiter and Bauhaus groups and left a legacy not only of dazzling visual work, but also of highly influential treatises such as Concerning the Spiritual in Art. Key tenets included the connections between painting, music and mystical experience, and the purification of art away from material realism and towards an emotional expression, condensed in particular by color.

This book presents key Kandinsky works to introduce his repertoire of vivid colors, forms, and feelings. Tracing the artist's radical stylistic development, it shows how one painter's progression paved the way for generations of abstract expression to come.

title: Pop Art
author: Klaus Honnef
description:
Peaking in the 1960s, Pop Art began as a revolt against mainstream approaches to art and culture and evolved into a wholesale interrogation of modern society, consumer culture, the role of the artist, and of what constituted an artwork.

Focusing on issues of materialism, celebrity, and media, Pop Art drew on mass-market sources, from advertising imagery to comic books, from Hollywood's most famous faces to the packaging of consumer products, the latter epitomized by Andy Warhol's Campbell's soup cans. As well as challenging the establishment with the elevation of such popular, banal, and kitschy images, Pop Art also deployed methods of mass-production, reducing the role of the individual artist with mechanized techniques such as screen printing.

With featured artists including Andy Warhol, Allen Jones, Ed Ruscha, Robert Indiana, Jasper Johns, Robert Rauschenberg, and Roy Lichtenstein, this book introduces the full reach and influence of a defining modernist movement.

title: Munch
description:
A hairless, ghostly figure on a bridge. The sky orange-red above him. His hands raised to his ears, his mouth wide in a haunting wail. In painting The Scream, Edvard Munch (1863–1944) created Mona Lisa for our times. The shriek of his iconic figure reverberates around the world, its echo resounding in the work of Andy Warhol, Jasper Johns, Martin Kippenberger, Marlene Dumas, and Tracey Emin.

This introductory book surveys Munch’s staggering capacity for psychodrama in The Scream and beyond. With rich illustration, it looks at the lurid, dark, and deeply modern visions that made up the artist’s response to relationships and emotions. These compelling images, regarded by the artist himself as a means of “free confession,” remain as magnetic today as they were on the brink of modernism.

title: Rockwell
description:
An extraordinarily prolific artist, Norman Rockwell (1894–1978) produced some 4,000 paintings in his lifetime, not including a prodigious quantity of commissioned editorial, commercial, and advertising work. His death in 1978 was regarded the loss of a national icon, an artist who, like no other, celebrated the American Dream.

Shunning experimentation and avant-garde techniques in favor of effective composition and relatable subject matter, Rockwell created wholesome, homely paintings with accessible and aspirational appeal. Neat, quaint, and typically jovial, his subjects included classrooms, prom scenes, and Thanksgiving feasts, while his most long-standing projects were covers for The Saturday Evening Post magazine and calendars and covers for the Boys’ Life publication of the Boy Scouts of America. Imbued with optimism and patriotism, the work foregrounds classic professions such as doctor and teacher, as much as the conservative stalwarts of military, family, and faith.

Hailed by President Gerald Ford as a “beloved part of the American tradition,” Rockwell’s works reveal as much about his own talents as they do about the story of 20th-century America. This fresh artist introduction from TASCHEN brings together key paintings and illustrations from his celebratory and sunny portfolio, as well as some more unusual works tackling the underside of the United States, to understand an integrally American artist, and the values and ideals that shaped his success.

title: Goya
description:
From court portraits for the Spanish royals to horrific scenes of conflict and suffering, Francisco José de Goya y Lucientes (1746–1828) made a mark as one of Spain’s most revered and controversial artists. A master of form and light, his influence reverberates down the centuries, inspiring and fascinating artists from the Romantic Eugène Delacroix to Britart enfants terribles, the Chapman brothers.

Born in Fuendetodos, Spain, in 1746, Goya was apprenticed to the Spanish royal family in 1774, where he produced etchings and tapestry cartoons for grand palaces and royal residences across the country. He was also patronized by the aristocracy, painting commissioned portraits of the rich and powerful with his increasingly fluid and expressive style. Later, after a bout of illness, the artist moved towards darker etchings and drawings, introducing a nightmarish realm of witches, ghosts, and fantastical creatures.

It was, however, with his horrific depictions of conflict that Goya achieved enduring impact. Executed between 1810 and 1820, The Disasters of War was inspired by atrocities committed during the Spanish struggle for independence from the French and penetrated the very heart of human cruelty and sadism. The bleak tones, agitated brushstrokes, and aggressive use of Baroque-like light and dark contrasts recalled Velázquez and Rembrandt, but Goya’s subject matter was unprecedented in its brutality and honesty.

In this introductory book from TASCHEN Basic Art 2.0 we set out to explore the full arc of Goya’s remarkable career, from elegant court painter to deathly seer of suffering and grotesquerie. Along the way, we encounter such famed portraits as Don Manuel Osorio Manrique de Zúñiga, the dazzling Naked Maja, and The 3rd of May 1808 in Madrid, one of the most heart-stopping images of war in the history of art.

title: Giger
description:
Swiss artist HR Giger (1940–2014) is most famous for his creation of the space monster in Ridley Scott’s 1979 horror sci-fi film Alien, which earned him an Oscar. In retrospect, this was just one of the most popular expressions of Giger’s biomechanical arsenal of creatures, which consistently merged hybrids of human and machine into images of haunting power and dark psychedelia.

The visions drew on demons of the past, harking back as far as Giger’s earliest childhood fears as well as evoking mythologies for the future. Above all, they gave expression to the collective fears and fantasies of his age: fear of the atom, of pollution and wasted resources, and of a future in which our bodies depend on machines for survival.

From surrealist dream landscapes created with a spray gun and stencils to album cover designs, from guillotine-like sculptures to self-designed bars, Giger personally guides us through his multi-faceted universe in this definitive introduction to a master of horror. Detailed reproductions and designs and a foreword by Timothy Leary complement Giger’s intimate autobiographical texts.

About the series

Born back in 1985, the Basic Art Series has evolved into the best-selling art book collection ever published. Each book in TASCHEN’s Basic Art series features:

a detailed chronological summary of the life and oeuvre of the artist, covering his or her cultural and historical importance

a concise biography

approximately 100 illustrations with explanatory captions

title: Duchamp
author: Janis Mink
description:
When is a urinal no longer a urinal? When Marcel Duchamp (1887-1968) declared it to be art. The uproar that greeted the French artist's Fountain (1917), a porcelain urinal installed in a gallery, sent shock waves through the art world establishment that reverberate right through to today.

This essential introduction distills all the daring and the scandal of Duchamp's practice into one essential overview not only of a pioneering creative but also of a critical moment in Western culture. From his groundbreaking blend of abstraction, Cubism, and Futurism in Nude Descending a Staircase (1912) to his forays into the now-iconic "readymades" such as Bicycle Wheel (1913) and Bottle Rack (1914) we explore how Duchamp consistently challenged the notion of what art is and, in so doing, opened up a world of conceptual possibilities beyond the "retinal" experience.

title: Toulouse-Lautrec
author: Matthias Arnold
description:
In our imaginings of Paris, painter and graphic artist Henri de Toulouse-Lautrec (1864–1901) has no small role to play. In his prints, posters, paintings, and drawings, the artist immortalized the city’s Belle Époque nightlife and put the northern neighborhood of Montmartre on the global map of creative-hedonist hotspots.

The son of old French nobility, Toulouse-Lautrec seems to have been drawn early on to visions of a demimonde, centering his attention on the dance halls, cabarets, and brothels of Montmartre and adopting famed dancers and singers as his subjects, most notably Jane Avril. His works include both lively performance scenes and quiet, tender “after-hours” portraits such as The Sofa and In Bed. Stylistically, he mastered both bold graphics, as celebrated in his promotional posters of Jane Avril, and a loose yet evocative sketchwork.

Though he died aged just 36, due to complications from alcoholism and syphilis, Toulouse-Lautrec’s cultural influence was immense. This introductory book takes a walk through his world of singers, dancers, musicians, and prostitutes to reveal an artist of great humanity, striking figurative skill, and a pronounced sense for the energy and stories of a city.

title: Manet
author: Gilles Neret
description:
Lampooned during his lifetime for his style as much as his subject matter, French painter Édouard Manet (1832–1883) is now considered a crucial figure in the history of art, bridging the transition from Realism to Impressionism.

Manet’s work combined a painterly technique with strikingly modern images of contemporary life, centered on the urban Paris experience. He recorded the city’s parks, bars, and cabarets, often delighting in the frisson of underground or provocative content. The Paris salon rejected his Déjeuner sur l’herbe with its juxtaposition of fully dressed men and a nude woman, while the steady gaze and unabashed pose of the prostitute Olympia, a very modern reworking of Titian’s Venus of Urbino, caused a society scandal.

This richly illustrated book introduces Manet’s work and his uniquely influential combination of Realism, Impressionism, and reworked Old Masters that would become paradigms of a brave new world for generations of modernists to come.

About the series

Born back in 1985, the Basic Art Series has evolved into the best-selling art book collection ever published. Each book in TASCHEN’s Basic Art series features:

a detailed chronological summary of the life and oeuvre of the artist, covering his or her cultural and historical importance

a concise biography

approximately 100 illustrations with explanatory captions

title: Van Eyck
description:
Often imitated but never equaled, Jan van Eyck (c. 1390-1441) left an indelible impression on Renaissance art and paved the way for future realist painters. With its unprecedented precision and masterful use of color, Arnolfini Double Portrait, depicting the wedding of a young couple, is testament to the mastery of the Flemish painter and leader of the Early Netherlandish school. Van Eyck painted both secular and religious subject matter, emphasizing a naturalism and realism that moved seamlessly between 15th-century everyday life and poetic, heavenly settings. Working with oil paint, he innovated the medium, allowing for great intensity and depth of color.

Trace the artist’s impressive oeuvre in this hardcover survey of his work, including altarpieces, religious figures, and commissioned portraits. Featuring enlarged details and close analyses of masterpieces like the Ghent Altarpiece, this publication also offers a chronology of van Eyck’s production, including the output of his workshop which continued even after his death.

title: Mucha
author: Tomoko Sato
description:
With his instantly recognizable decorative style, Czech artist and Art Nouveau master Alphonse Mucha (1860-1939) defined the look of the fin-de-siecle. In evocative shades of peach, gold, ochre, and olive, his seductive compositions of patterns, flowers, and beautiful women became paradigms of the Belle Epoque years.

Mucha's work permeated illustration, posters, postcards, and the advertising designs of his day. His striking posters of star actress Sarah Bernhardt were particularly famous. Alongside this delicate decorative work, Mucha also harbored strongly felt political ideas. With his monumental cycle The Slav Epic, he expressed his staunch support for Pan-Slavism, promoting the political independence of the Czech and Slavic nations from the Austro-Hungarian Empire.

Compiled in association with the Mucha Foundation, this book presents key works and introduces the full reach of Mucha's oeuvre from patterned decoration to his book illustrations, posters, photographs and monumental paintings.

title: Rodin
description:
While anchoring his practice in the traditions of antiquity and the Renaissance, Auguste Rodin (1840–1917) paved the way for modern sculpture. From a very early stage, he was interested in movement, the expression of the body, chance effects, and the incomplete fragment. It was these elements that gave shape, and the impression of life, to such famous works as The Kiss and The Thinker.

Produced in collaboration with the Musée Rodin, this TASCHEN Basic Art introduction examines the formative years of Rodin’s training as well as the key stages of his subsequent career. It retraces the genesis of his sculptures and monuments from both a historical and an aesthetic point of view and illuminates the links between his different works. The reader gains access to the artist’s ideas, as well as to the real material processes in his studio—the modeling in clay, the passage from plaster to bronze or to marble, enlargement, the creation of assemblages, and his deeply sensual erotic drawings.

An inexhaustible source of inspiration for subsequent generations of artists, Rodin’s work incorporated innovation and transgression, but above all an unrivaled passion for working in front of the living model and for capturing the truth of human experience and forms. With rich illustration and texts from François Blanchetière, this book invites us to discover—and rediscover—this priceless legacy.

title: Caravaggio
author: Gilles Neret
description:
Michelangelo Merisi da Caravaggio (1571–1610) was always a name to be reckoned with. Notorious bad boy of the Italian Baroque, the artist was at once celebrated and controversial, violent in temper, precise in technique, a creative master, and a man on the run.

Though famed for his dramatic use of color, light, and shadow, it was above all Caravaggio’s boundary-breaking naturalism which scorched his name into the annals of art history. From the dirtied soles of feet to the sexualized languor of bare flesh, the artist allowed even sacred and biblical scenes to unfold with a startling, often visceral humanity. This vivid pictorial world was accompanied by an equally intense personal biography, scored by gambling, debts, drunken brawls, and even a murder charge.

This book brings together more than 50 of Caravaggio’s most famous and revolutionary works to explore how and why this artist is now considered the most important painter of the early Baroque period and one of the defining influences of art history, without whom Ribera, Vermeer, Rembrandt, Delacroix, Courbet, and Manet could never have painted the way they did.

title: Ensor
description:
An Expressionist before the term was coined, James Ensor (1860–1949) was the classic insider-outsider enigma. He knew all the right art-world figures but loathed most of them. His style lurched from the Gothic fantastical to the Christian visionary. He was a cosmopolitan trailblazer of modernism, but lived reclusively in an attic room in the resort town of Ostend.

For all his elusiveness, Ensor influenced generations of artists through his vivid often gruesome paintings, prints, and drawings. He is cited in particular for his use of dark satire and allegory, his innovative lighting, and for his interest in carnival and performance, showcased in The Entry of Christ into Brussels in 1889 as well as in his repertoire of self-portraits in which he employs masking, travesty, and role-playing to adopt such varied guises as Christ on the Cross and a gender-bending dandy.

This introduction to Ensor explores the richness and variety of his imagery through key examples of his macabre, maverick oeuvre.

title: Morris
author: Charlotte & Peter Fiell
description:
William Morris (1834–1896) was one of the greatest creative figures of the 19th century. As a visionary designer, as well as a manufacturer, writer, artist, and socialist activist, he pioneered the Arts and Crafts movement of the Victorian era, and left an extraordinary influence on architecture, textile, and interior design.

This richly illustrated book offers a suitably beautiful introduction to Morris’s colorful life and all aspects of his design work, including interiors, tiles, embroidery, tapestries, carpets, and calligraphy. Though best known in his lifetime as a poet and author, it is these exquisite designs that secured Morris’s posthumous reputation. As page after page dazzles with their beautiful patterns and forms, we explore the pioneering craftsmanship and natural motifs that inspired them, as well as Morris’s remarkable cultural legacy, through British textiles, Bauhaus, and even modern environmentalism.

title: Holbein
author: Norbert Wolf
description:
Religion, Renaissance, and Reformation—these three ideologies shaped the world of 16th-century portraitist Hans Holbein the Younger (1497/98–1543), a pivotal figure of the Northern Renaissance, whose skills took him to Switzerland, Belgium, Italy, and England, and garnered patrons and subjects as prestigious as Henry VIII, Thomas More, Anne of Cleves, and Reformation advocate Thomas Cromwell.

This book brings together key Holbein paintings to explore his illustrious and international career as well as the courtly drama and radical religious change that informed his work. With rich illustration, we survey the masterful draftsmanship and almost supernatural ability to control details, from the textures of luxurious clothing to the ornament of a room, that secured Holbein’s place as one of the greatest portraitists in Western art history.

His probing eye was matched with a draftsman. Along the way, we see how he combined meticulous mimesis with an inspired amalgam of regional painterly traits, from Flemish-style realism to late medieval German composition and Italian formal grandeur.

During his time in England, Holbein became official court painter to Henry VIII, producing both reformist propaganda and royalist paintings to bolster Henry’s status as monarch and as the new Supreme Head of the Church following the English Reformation. His portrait of Henry from 1537 is regarded not only as a portraiture pinnacle but also as an iconic record of this transformative monarch and the Tudor dynasty. Through this turbulent period, Holbein also produced anticlerical woodcuts, and sketched and painted Lutheran merchants, visiting ambassadors, and Henry’s notorious succession of wives.

title: Rousseau
description:
Henri Rousseau (1844–1910) was a clerk in the Paris customs service who dreamed of becoming a famous artist. At the age 49, he decided to give it a try. At first, Rousseau’s bright, bold paintings of jungles and exotic flora and fauna were dismissed as childish and simplistic, but his unique and tenacious style soon won acclaim. After 1886, he exhibited regularly at Paris’s prestigious Salon des Indépendants, and in 1908 he received a legendary banquet of honor, hosted by Picasso.

Although best known for his tropical scenes, Rousseau, in fact, never left France, relying on books and magazines for inspiration, as well as trips to natural history museums and anecdotes from returning military acquaintances. Working in oil on canvas, he tended toward a vibrant palette, vivid rendering, as well as a certain lush, languid sensuality as seen in the nude in the jungle composition The Dream.

Today, “Rousseau’s myth" is well established in art history, garnering comparison with such other post-Impressionist masters as Cézanne, Matisse, and Gauguin. In this dependable TASCHEN introduction, we explore the makings of this late-blooming artist and his legacy as an unlikely hero of modernism.

title: The Computer. A History from the 17th Century to Today
author: Jens Müller
description:
The story of the evolution of machines in computer history is full of the disruptive innovations that have led to today’s world. From the early beginnings of computing to the bulky mainframe to the personal computer era, we now live in an almost entirely digital age.

The Computer explores steps from the first ideas of a calculating machine in the 19th century and early experiments with autonomous driving in the 1920s to oversized office computers in the 1950s to laptops and wearables of today. Jens Müller delivers a visual understanding of the emergence of the Information Age that hasn’t been shown before. Tracing the stories of tech visionaries, pioneers, and entrepreneurs, the book combines compelling visuals, historical documents, and in-depth explanations to reveal significant events in computer history. Encompassing the invention of machines, coding, and software development, as well as technology's influence on today's political landscape.

This survey presents creations from Ada Lovelace, Charles Babbage, Alan Turing, Grace Hopper, Bill Gates, and Steve Jobs. Showcasing forgotten gadgets and prototypes connecting iconic products such as the Apple Macintosh and the Sony Play Station. As well as remembering milestones in software development, videogaming, and the web. Infographics explain wireless communication and other fundamental technical concepts, while the history of corporations such as IBM, Apple, Microsoft, Atari, Amazon, and Google is retraced through rare photographs and advertising campaigns.

A fascinating read, this book acknowledges the computer’s stupendous power and social impact. For techies and everyone interested in culture, economics, politics, and science, it illustrates how we got here today and helps us ask better questions about where we will be tomorrow.

title: The Alps 1900. A Portrait in Color
description:
“Nothing compares to the Alps” wrote the great French historian Jules Michelet in 1868. At the very heart of Europe, the gigantic Alpine mountain range includes some of the most grandiose natural sites in the world, such as Mont Blanc, the Jungfrau, the Matterhorn, and their glaciers. Tourism began in the late 1800s and grew tremendously over the next centuries, especially with the rise of winter sports. This book offers a charming tour of a bygone era, when the first mountain trains and cog railways were carrying men in lederhosen and women in long dresses to the foot of the glacier, when local guides accompanied tourists riding on mules; a time when the first alpinists were considered mad, and skiers were a curiosity.

Through photochromes, photographs, and color postcards of the 19th and 20th centuries, through travel posters and tourist brochures, we cross passes such as the Mont-Cenis, Simplon, Brenner, and St. Gotthard; climb Mont Blanc, the Eiger, the Wetterhorn, and the Dolomites; marvel at crystal-clear lakes in Switzerland, Italy, Bavaria, and Slovenia; explore Tyrol, the Via Mala, and the Engadin; and spend the winter season at grand hotels in Gstaad, Grindelwald, Davos, St. Moritz, and Cortina. This is a journey dotted with literary quotes by travel writers that evokes these happy days of pristine snow and untouched slopes.

title: The Package Design Book. Volume 2
author: Julius Wiedemann
description: Package design is one of the most dynamic and fast-evolving fields of design today. Featuring over 600 creations from more than 35 countries, this compact edition celebrates extraordinary work from the global packaging design community. Showcasing the winners of the Pentawards from the past decade, the world’s leading packaging design competition.

title: Small Stories of Great Artists
author: Laurence Anholt
description:
It’s been thirty years since Laurence Anholt began his beloved series about great artists and the real children who knew them. Since then, these classic tales of Vincent van Gogh, Frida Kahlo, Pablo Picasso, Leonardo da Vinci, and many other geniuses of Western art have provided a springboard into a lifetime’s love of art, selling millions of copies around the world. The stories have been adapted in many forms including ballet, opera, Braille editions for blind and partially sighted children, and a full-scale stage musical in Korea.

Alongside Anholt’s dazzling watercolor illustrations, this anniversary edition includes dozens of high-quality reproductions of the artists’ work, child-friendly biographies of the artists, and interactive questions for young readers. Each story is closely based on historical events and extensive research. In many cases, Anholt visited the artists’ homes and studios, walking in their footsteps and interviewing their relatives. He was granted private access to Monet’s house in Giverny and became close friends with Sylvette David (now Lydia Corbett), Picasso’s famous Girl with a Ponytail.

In order to make the artists and their worlds accessible to young readers, Anholt employs a unique device in which the events are seen through the eyes of a child protagonist who actually knew the artist. In this way, readers are able to “piggyback” through the story, and artists who might otherwise be inaccessible become humanized. On a subconscious level, the reader absorbs many inspirational themes such as kindness, self-esteem, perseverance, creativity, and courage.

Perhaps it is Anholt’s gentle storytelling or his handcrafted illustrations. Perhaps it is his love for children and passion for his subject. One way or another, a whole generation of readers have found a lifelong love of art through his stories. And now they are passing that precious gift to their own children. The gift of art is golden.This volume features the following artists and their stories: Van Gogh and the Sunflowers, Frida Kahlo and the Bravest Girl in the World, Cézanne and the Apple Boy, Picasso and the Girl with a Ponytail, The Magical Garden of Claude Monet, Tell Us a Story, Papa Chagall, Degas and the Little Dancer, Leonardo and the Flying Boy.

title: Max Ernst
description:
With unparalleled artistic originality Max Ernst (1891–1976) transformed everything he touched. By pushing the boundaries and breaking loose from the confined view of the culture of his time, he became one of the most important figures of Dadaism and Surrealism. Driven by the counter-reaction to the horrors of World War I, he became a pioneer of the Dada movement. The closing of the famed Dada exhibit in Cologne for ‘obscenity’ led Ernst to spend the rest of his life in Paris, where he came in contact with the Surrealists.

Above all, Ernst stands out for his varied style and technique, having produced an oeuvre that reaches from paintings, drawings, and sculpture, across texts and stage settings to collage novels and the development of his own ‘frottage’ technique. During World War II, Ernst, like many of his colleagues, became an ‘undesirable foreigner’ and was forced to emigrate; however, he returned to France after the war. Continuing a career that spanned decades, in 1954 he received the Grand Prize for Painting at the Biennial in Venice.

This book is a journey through magic, vividness, and fantasy. It is a gateway into the intricate mind and world of Max Ernst.

title: Яблоневый дворик
author: Даути Луиза
description: This poignant Russian novel delves into the lives intertwined with an old apple orchard, a symbol of enduring memory and the passage of time. Through the eyes of its characters, the story explores themes of love, loss, and the quiet resilience of the human spirit against the backdrop of changing seasons and societal shifts. It's a beautifully crafted narrative that evokes a sense of nostalgia and the bittersweet beauty of life's cycles, inviting readers to reflect on their own connections to place and the echoes of the past.

title: Мы
author: Замятин Евгений
description: Yevgeny Zamyatin's dystopian masterpiece, 'We,' plunges readers into the totalitarian world of the One State, where individuality is suppressed, and citizens live under the constant surveillance of the Benefactor. The narrative unfolds through the diary entries of D-503, a brilliant mathematician who initially embraces the rigid order and logic of his society. However, his encounter with I-330, a rebellious woman, sparks a profound internal conflict, awakening forbidden emotions and a yearning for freedom. As D-503 grapples with his newfound desires and the oppressive reality of the One State, the novel explores themes of conformity, rebellion, and the inherent human need for self-expression. 'We' is a chilling precursor to later dystopian works, offering a powerful critique of authoritarianism and the dangers of a society devoid of individual thought.

title: Добровольный узник
author: Фэруэдер Джек
description: This Russian novel, 'The Voluntary Prisoner,' plunges into the psychological depths of a man who chooses self-imposed isolation. The protagonist, driven by a complex mix of disillusionment, philosophical inquiry, and a desire to escape societal pressures, retreats from the world. As he navigates the confines of his chosen solitude, the narrative explores themes of freedom, responsibility, the nature of happiness, and the human need for connection. Readers are invited to ponder whether true liberation can be found in detachment or if it lies in engagement with the world, however flawed.

title: Твои деньги. Как их тратить, копить и инвестировать
author: Биккари Сесиль
description: This practical guide offers essential advice on managing personal finances, from everyday spending habits to long-term investment strategies. It demystifies complex financial concepts, providing clear, actionable steps for readers to take control of their money, build wealth, and achieve financial independence. Whether you're looking to budget better, save for a major purchase, or grow your investments, this book equips you with the knowledge and tools to make informed financial decisions and secure your future.

title: Гравити Фолз. Графический роман. Вып. 4
author: Хирш Алекс. Ренцетти Роб
description: The adventure continues in the fourth volume of the Gravity Falls graphic novel series. Dipper and Mabel's summer in the enigmatic town of Gravity Falls grows even stranger as they face new monsters, decipher more cryptic clues, and delve deeper into the town's hidden history. This volume delivers more of the witty dialogue, intricate puzzles, and endearing character moments that made the original show a phenomenon. A must-read for fans eager to explore untold stories and further unravel the mysteries surrounding Grunkle Stan and the Journal.

title: iPhuck 10
author: Victor Pelevin
description:
Порфирий Петрович - литературно-полицейский алгоритм. Он расследует преступления и одновременно пишет об этом детективные романы, зарабатывая средства для Полицейского Управления.
Маруха Чо - искусствовед с большими деньгами и баба с яйцами по официальному гендеру. Ее специальность - так называемый 'гипс', искусство первой четверти XXI века. Ей нужен помощник для анализа рынка. Им становится взятый в аренду Порфирий.
'iPhuck 10' - самый дорогой любовный гаджет на рынке и одновременно самый знаменитый из 244 детективов Порфирия Петровича. Это настоящий шедевр алгоритмической полицейской прозы конца века - энциклопедический роман о будущем любви, искусства и всего остального.

title: Гравити Фолз. Легенда о живогрызе = The Legend of the Gobblewonker
description: Embark on an exciting adventure with Dipper and Mabel Pines in 'Gravity Falls: The Legend of the Gobblewonker,' a graphic novel that adapts one of the series' most iconic early episodes. Convinced there's a monster in the lake, the twins, along with their Grunkle Stan, set out to prove its existence and win a cash prize. This charming story perfectly captures the show's blend of cryptid hunting, sibling dynamics, and Stan's schemes, all while exploring themes of belief, skepticism, and the bonds of family. It's a delightful read for fans and newcomers alike.

title: Гравити Фолз. Графический роман. Вып. 5
author: Хирш А. Ренцетти Р.
description: Continue your journey into the mysterious town of Gravity Falls with 'Gravity Falls: Graphic Novel. Vol. 5,' a collection of thrilling comic adaptations from the beloved animated series. This volume brings to life more of Dipper and Mabel's bizarre encounters with supernatural creatures, hidden secrets, and the eccentric residents of Gravity Falls. Perfect for fans who want to relive their favorite episodes or discover new layers to the show's intricate mythology, this graphic novel captures the humor, heart, and suspense that made Gravity Falls a cultural phenomenon, making it an essential addition to any fan's collection.

title: Гравити Фолз. Странногеддон. Графический роман
author: Хирш А. Ренцетти Р.
description: Experience the thrilling conclusion to the beloved animated series in 'Gravity Falls: Weirdmageddon,' a graphic novel adaptation that brings the epic final arc to life. Join Dipper and Mabel Pines as they face their greatest challenge yet: the chaotic, reality-bending invasion led by the demonic Bill Cipher. This visually stunning adaptation captures the show's signature blend of humor, mystery, and heart, as the residents of Gravity Falls unite to save their town and the world. A must-read for fans, it perfectly encapsulates the series' themes of family, growing up, and confronting the unknown.

title: Синяя кровь
author: Болдаччи Дэвид
description: Dive into the opulent and treacherous world of 'Blue Blood,' where ancient secrets, powerful families, and supernatural forces collide. This enthralling tale unravels the mysteries surrounding a hidden society of aristocratic vampires living among us, their lives intertwined with human history and destiny. As a young protagonist uncovers their existence, they are drawn into a dangerous game of power, love, and betrayal. With its rich mythology, intricate plot, and compelling characters, 'Blue Blood' offers a thrilling blend of fantasy, romance, and suspense that will keep you captivated until the very last page.

title: Почему мужчины хотят секса, а женщины любви
author: Пиз Аллан и Барбара
description: This provocative and insightful book explores the fundamental differences in how men and women approach relationships, intimacy, and emotional connection. Drawing on evolutionary psychology, sociology, and personal anecdotes, it unpacks the distinct desires and motivations that often shape romantic interactions. The author delves into the biological and cultural factors influencing these patterns, aiming to foster greater understanding and empathy between genders. Readers will gain a deeper appreciation for the complexities of male and female perspectives, offering valuable insights for improving communication and building more fulfilling relationships.

title: Стихотворения
author: Высоцкий Владимир
description: This collection, simply titled 'Poems,' represents a compilation of lyrical works by a Russian poet (as the title is generic, a specific author is not implied). Such collections typically showcase the poet's diverse range of themes, styles, and emotional landscapes. Readers can expect to encounter verses exploring love, nature, existential reflections, social commentary, and personal experiences, all rendered with the characteristic musicality and depth often found in Russian poetry. The poems might span various periods of the poet's career, offering insights into their artistic evolution and the cultural context of their time. A collection of 'Poems' serves as a window into the poet's soul, inviting readers to engage with their unique voice and perspective on the world, often revealing universal truths through deeply personal expression.

title: Молочник
author: Бернс Анна
description: No official English translation

title: KGBT+
author: Victor Pelevin
description:
"Вбойщик KGBT+ (автор классических стримов «Катастрофа», «Летитбизм» и других) известен всей планете как титан перформанса и духа. Если вы не слышали его имени, значит, эпоха green power для вас еще не наступила и завоевавшее планету искусство B2B (brain-to-brain streaming) каким-то чудом обошло вас стороной.
Но эта книга — не просто очередное жизнеописание звезды шоу-биза. Это учебник успеха. Великий вбойщик дает множество мемо-советов нацеленному на победу молодому исполнителю. KGBT+ подробно рассказывает историю создания своих шедевров и комментирует сложные факты своей биографии, включая убийства, покушения и почти вековую отсидку в баночной тюрьме, а также опровергает многочисленные слухи о своей личной жизни. Настоящее издание впервые включает повесть «Дом Бахии» о прошлой (предположительно) жизни легендарного вбойщика в Японии и Бирме.
Книга не только подарит вам несколько интересных вечеров, но и познакомит с аутентичными древними психотехниками, применение которых позволит пережить нашу великую эпоху с минимальным вредом для здоровья и психики."

title: 13 карт. Фанфики. Избранное
author: Нечитайло Федор
description: This collection, '13 Cards. Fanfiction. Selected Works,' compiles a curated selection of fan-created stories based on the popular Russian webcomic and animated series '13 Cards.' The original series features a protagonist, Fedor, and his thirteen alter egos, each representing a playing card suit and number, who embody different aspects of his personality. This fanfiction anthology delves deeper into the characters, relationships, and unexplored plotlines of the '13 Cards' universe. Readers can expect a diverse range of narratives, from romantic pairings and alternate universes to character studies and new adventures, all crafted by dedicated fans of the original work.

title: Евгений Онегин.
author: Пушкин Александр
description: Alexander Pushkin's 'Eugene Onegin' is a seminal work of Russian literature, a novel in verse that masterfully blends social commentary, psychological depth, and lyrical beauty. The story centers on the titular character, a jaded and cynical dandy who, after inheriting an estate, retreats to the countryside. There, he encounters Tatyana Larina, a passionate and imaginative young woman who falls deeply in love with him. Onegin, however, rejects her affections, only to later regret his decision when circumstances change. The narrative explores themes of unrequited love, societal expectations, the disillusionment of the Romantic hero, and the complexities of human relationships. Pushkin's innovative use of verse and his vivid portrayal of 19th-century Russian society make 'Eugene Onegin' an enduring classic, celebrated for its wit, elegance, and profound insights into the human heart.

title: Путешествие в Элевсин.
author: Пелевин Виктор
description: This philosophical and poetic work, 'Journey to Eleusis,' by Vyacheslav Ivanov, delves into the mystical and spiritual significance of the ancient Eleusinian Mysteries. Ivanov, a prominent figure of the Russian Symbolist movement, explores themes of death, rebirth, and the search for divine truth through a rich tapestry of classical mythology, religious symbolism, and profound introspection. The book is not a literal travelogue but a metaphorical exploration of the soul's journey towards enlightenment and communion with the sacred. It reflects Ivanov's deep engagement with ancient Greek culture and his belief in the transformative power of myth and ritual. 'Journey to Eleusis' offers a challenging yet rewarding read for those interested in Symbolist literature, classical studies, and the perennial questions of human existence and spiritual awakening.

title: iPhuck 10
author: Victor Pelevin
description: Порфирий Петрович — литературно-полицейский алгоритм. Он расследует преступления и одновременно пишет об этом детективные романы, зарабатывая средства для Полицейского Управления.Маруха Чо — искусствовед с большими деньгами и баба с яйцами по официальному гендеру. author: Пушкин Александр
description: This collection, simply titled 'Poems,' represents a compilation of lyrical works by a Russian poet (as the title is generic, a specific author is not implied). Such collections typically showcase the poet's diverse range of themes, styles, and emotional landscapes. Readers can expect to encounter verses exploring love, nature, existential reflections, social commentary, and personal experiences, all rendered with the characteristic musicality and depth often found in Russian poetry. The poems might span various periods of the poet's career, offering insights into their artistic evolution and the cultural context of their time. A collection of 'Poems' serves as a window into the poet's soul, inviting readers to engage with their unique voice and perspective on the world, often revealing universal truths through deeply personal expression.

title: Empire V
author: Victor Pelevin
description: Миром правят вампиры.Не вечно молодые романтичные юноши и девушки с бессонными глазами и кровавыми губами, а вполне обыкновенные мужчины и женщины со следами жизненного цинизма на лице. Им одним открыт секрет «гламура» и «дискурса». И они — настоящая мировая элита, вербующая в свои ряды прохожих одним легким укусом.Выбор может пасть на каждого...В июле 2023 года состоялась премьера фильма «Ампир V», мы наконец смогли увидеть, как выглядел Рама. Написанный почти десять лет тому назад, роман не утрачивает актуальность и сегодня.

author: Stephen King
description:
Этот роман безоговорочно признают лучшей книгой Стивена Кинга и миллионы фанатов писателя, и серьезные литературные критики.
…Убийство президента Кеннеди стало самым трагическим событием американской истории ХХ века.
Тайна его до сих пор не раскрыта.
Но что, если случится чудо? Если появится возможность отправиться в прошлое и предотвратить катастрофу?
Это предстоит выяснить обычному учителю из маленького городка Джейку Эппингу, получившему доступ к временному порталу.
Его цель - спасти Кеннеди. Но какова будет цена спасения?

author: George Orwell
description:
Своеобразный антипод второй великой антиутопии XX века - 'О дивный новый мир' Олдоса Хаксли. Что, в сущности, страшнее: доведенное до абсурда 'общество потребления' - или доведенное до абсолюта 'общество идеи'?
По Оруэллу, нет и не может быть ничего ужаснее тотальной несвободы...

title: Маус
author: Шпигельман Арт
description: Art Spiegelman's groundbreaking graphic novel, 'Maus,' is a powerful and harrowing account of the Holocaust, told through the eyes of his father, Vladek Spiegelman, a Polish Jew and Holocaust survivor. The narrative ingeniously depicts Jews as mice, Germans as cats, and Poles as pigs, using this allegorical framework to explore themes of trauma, memory, intergenerational impact, and survival. It's a deeply personal and unflinching exploration of one of history's darkest chapters, offering a unique and unforgettable perspective on human resilience and the enduring scars of genocide. A Pulitzer Prize winner, 'Maus' is a vital work of literature.

title: Волк с Уолл-стрит
author: Белфорт Джордан
description: Jordan Belfort's memoir, 'The Wolf of Wall Street,' chronicles his meteoric rise and spectacular fall as a stockbroker in the late 1980s and 1990s. From humble beginnings, Belfort built Stratton Oakmont, a brokerage firm that engaged in widespread fraud and corruption, making him a multi-millionaire. The book vividly depicts a world of excess, debauchery, and unchecked greed, where lavish parties, drug use, and illegal financial schemes were commonplace. Belfort's candid and often shocking account offers an inside look at the dark side of Wall Street, ultimately leading to his indictment and imprisonment. It's a cautionary tale about ambition, morality, and the allure of illicit wealth.

title: Библия декора интерьера тканью
description: This comprehensive guide, 'The Bible of Interior Fabric Decor,' is an essential resource for anyone looking to transform their living spaces with textiles. It delves into the art and science of using fabrics to enhance interior design, covering everything from selecting the right materials and patterns to mastering various drapery styles, upholstery techniques, and decorative accents. Filled with inspiring ideas, practical tips, and detailed instructions, this book empowers readers to create harmonious, stylish, and personalized environments, making it an indispensable tool for both amateur decorators and seasoned professionals.

title: Двенадцать месяцев
author: Маршак Самуил
description: A beloved Russian fairy tale, 'The Twelve Months' tells the enchanting story of a kindhearted stepdaughter sent into a winter forest by her cruel stepmother to find snowdrops in the dead of December. Miraculously, she stumbles upon a magical gathering of the Twelve Months, personified as old men around a bonfire. Moved by her plight and good nature, they grant her wish, bringing forth spring for a brief moment. This timeless tale explores themes of kindness, perseverance, and the triumph of good over evil, reminding readers of the power of compassion and the cyclical beauty of nature. A heartwarming story for all ages.

title: Властелин колец
author: Толкин Джон Рональд Руэл
description: Embark on an unparalleled epic journey into Middle-earth with J.R.R. Tolkien's 'The Lord of the Rings.' This foundational work of high fantasy follows the hobbit Frodo Baggins as he undertakes a perilous quest to destroy the One Ring, a powerful artifact forged by the Dark Lord Sauron. Accompanied by a diverse fellowship of companions, Frodo must brave ancient evils, treacherous landscapes, and the corrupting influence of the Ring itself. A timeless tale of good versus evil, courage, friendship, and sacrifice, 'The Lord of the Rings' has shaped the landscape of fantasy literature and continues to enchant readers with its richly imagined world and unforgettable characters.

author: Stephen King
description: Убийство президента Кеннеди стало самым трагическим событием американской истории ХХ века. Тайна его до сих пор не раскрыта. Но что, если случится чудо? Если появится возможность отправиться в прошлое и предотвратить катастрофу? Это предстоит выяснить обычному учителю из маленького городка Джейку Эппингу, получившему доступ к временному порталу. Его цель - спасти Кеннеди. Но какова будет цена спасения?

title: Введение в психоанализ
author: Фрейд Зигмунд
description: This foundational text provides an accessible yet comprehensive introduction to the principles and practices of psychoanalysis. It explores key concepts such as the unconscious, dreams, defense mechanisms, and the development of personality, as pioneered by Sigmund Freud. Ideal for students and curious readers alike, the book demystifies complex psychological theories, offering a clear understanding of how psychoanalysis seeks to uncover the hidden forces that shape human behavior and mental life.

author: George Orwell
description:
Своеобразный антипод второй великой антиутопии XX века - 'О дивный новый мир' Олдоса Хаксли. Что, в сущности, страшнее: доведенное до абсурда 'общество потребления' - или доведенное до абсолюта 'общество идеи'?
По Оруэллу, нет и не может быть ничего ужаснее тотальной несвободы...

title: Сильмариллион
author: Толкин Джон Рональд Руэл
description: Journey to the dawn of time in J.R.R. Tolkien's 'The Silmarillion,' a foundational epic that unveils the creation myth and ancient history of Middle-earth. This majestic work chronicles the struggles of the Valar and Elves against the dark lord Morgoth, detailing the forging of the Silmarils, jewels of immense power, and the tragic fates of those who sought to possess them. Rich with intricate genealogies, languages, and mythologies, 'The Silmarillion' provides the deep lore that underpins 'The Hobbit' and 'The Lord of the Rings,' offering an unparalleled dive into Tolkien's unparalleled world-building.

author: George Orwell
description:
Своеобразный антипод второй великой антиутопии XX века - 'О дивный новый мир' Олдоса Хаксли. Что, в сущности, страшнее: доведенное до абсурда 'общество потребления' - или доведенное до абсолюта 'общество идеи'?
По Оруэллу, нет и не может быть ничего ужаснее тотальной несвободы...

title: Лето второго шанса
author: Мэтсон Морган
description: Narine Abgaryan's 'A Summer of Second Chances' is a heartwarming and poignant novel that transports readers to a small, picturesque Armenian village, where life unfolds with its unique blend of humor, tragedy, and enduring hope. The story follows a cast of unforgettable characters as they navigate personal challenges, rekindle old flames, and discover the transformative power of community. Abgaryan's lyrical prose and deep understanding of human nature create a captivating narrative that celebrates resilience, the beauty of everyday life, and the possibility of new beginnings, even in the most unexpected places.

title: Человек в системе
author: Веллер М. И.
description: This Russian novel, 'Man in the System,' explores the profound impact of bureaucratic and societal structures on the individual. It follows a protagonist navigating a complex and often oppressive system, highlighting themes of conformity, resistance, and the search for personal identity within a rigid framework. The narrative delves into the psychological toll of living under constant scrutiny and the struggle to maintain one's humanity in the face of dehumanizing forces. Through a series of poignant encounters and internal monologues, the book critiques the mechanisms of power and examines the subtle ways in which individuals are shaped, and sometimes broken, by the systems they inhabit. It's a thought-provoking exploration of freedom and constraint.

title: S.N.U.F.F.
author: Victor Pelevin
description: Антиутопия, научная фантастика, постмодернизм… Или ужасающий реализм? 'S.N.U.F.F.' - десятый роман Виктора Пелевина, мастера удивительной прозы. Это многослойное, саркастическое и совсем недоброе повествование о том, куда и к чему движется род людской. Кажется, будто у Пелевина есть возможность время от времени заглядывать одним глазком в будущее - настолько мощен его писательский гений.

title: Луис Мариано, или Глоток свободы
author: Гавальда Анна
description: This captivating narrative, 'Louis Mariano, or A Sip of Freedom,' transports readers into a world where the pursuit of liberty is both a dream and a dangerous reality. Through the eyes of its protagonist, Louis Mariano, the story explores the profound human desire for self-determination and the sacrifices made in its name. It's a tale of courage, resilience, and the intoxicating taste of freedom, even if only a fleeting sip. A compelling exploration of personal and political liberation that resonates deeply with the human spirit.

title: Я и Оно
author: Фрейд З.
description: Martin Buber's seminal philosophical work explores the nature of human relationships and existence through the concepts of 'I-Thou' and 'I-It'. The 'I-Thou' relationship signifies a direct, reciprocal, and authentic encounter with another being, recognizing their wholeness and uniqueness. In contrast, the 'I-It' relationship treats others as objects to be used or experienced. Buber argues that true human flourishing and spiritual fulfillment arise from 'I-Thou' encounters, emphasizing dialogue, presence, and mutual respect. This profound text challenges readers to re-evaluate their interactions and embrace a more meaningful way of relating to the world and others.

author: Stephen King
description: ...Убийство президента Кеннеди стало самым трагическим событием американской истории ХХ века. Тайна его до сих пор не раскрыта. Но что, если случится чудо? title: iPhuck 10
author: Victor Pelevin
description: Порфирий Петрович – литературно-полицейский алгоритм. Он расследует преступления и одновременно пишет об этом детективные романы, зарабатывая средства для Полицейского Управления.Маруха Чо – искусствовед с большими деньгами и баба с яйцами по официальному гендеру. Ее специальность – так называемый "гипс", искусство первой четверти XXI века. Ей нужен помощник для анализа рынка. Им становится взятый в аренду Порфирий."iPhuck 10" – самый дорогой любовный гаджет на рынке и одновременно самый знаменитый из 244 детективов Порфирия Петровича. Это настоящий шедевр алгоритмической полицейской прозы конца века – энциклопедический роман о будущем любви, искусства и всего остального.

title: VREMENA GODA
author: Boris Akunin
description: В романе "VREMENA GODA", действие которого перемещается из юности в старость и из современности в прошлое, рассказывается о том, как добиваться исполнения желаний и расплачиваться за это; как жить любовью и как жить без любви; как избавиться от страхов и видеть без помощи зрения. Это история необыкновенной женщины, которая прожила на свете больше ста лет и стала всем, чем хотела стать

title: Loputyn. Cotton Tales. Том 1. Иллюзии
author: Чоффи Джессика
description: Dive into the whimsical and often melancholic world of Loputyn's 'Cotton Tales,' a graphic novel that explores the delicate balance between dreams and reality. This first volume, 'Illusions,' introduces readers to a cast of charmingly drawn characters navigating surreal landscapes and introspective narratives. Through its unique art style and poignant storytelling, the book delves into themes of imagination, escapism, and the subtle beauty found in everyday moments, inviting readers to ponder the nature of perception and the stories we tell ourselves.

title: Loputyn. Cotton Tales. Том 2. Реальность
author: Чоффи Джессика
description: Continuing the enchanting journey from 'Illusions,' 'Cotton Tales. Vol 2: Reality' by Loputyn delves deeper into the tangible world, contrasting it with the dreamlike states explored previously. This volume further develops the unique visual language and introspective themes, as characters confront the complexities of their existence and the often-harsh truths of reality. With its distinctive art and evocative storytelling, the book offers a thoughtful meditation on growth, acceptance, and the interplay between our inner worlds and the external environment, making it a compelling read for fans of artistic graphic novels.

title: The Wind-Up Bird Chronicle
author: Haruki Murakami
description:
Enter the surreal and enchanting world of Haruki Murakami 

Toru Okada's cat has disappeared. 
His wife is growing more distant every day. 
Then there are the increasingly explicit telephone calls he has recently been receiving. 
As this compelling story unfolds, the tidy suburban realities of Okada's vague and blameless life, spent cooking, reading, listening to jazz and opera and drinking beer at the kitchen table, are turned inside out. He embarks on a bizarre journey, guided by a succession of characters, each with a tale to tell. 

'Mesmerising, surreal, this really is the work of a true original' The Times 

Part of the VINTAGE JAPANESE CLASSICS series - five masterpieces of Japanese fiction in gorgeous new gift editions.

title: А зори здесь тихие...
author: Васильев Борис
description: Boris Vasilyev's poignant novella, 'The Dawns Here Are Quiet,' tells the heartbreaking story of five young female anti-aircraft gunners and their commanding officer, Sergeant Major Vaskov, during World War II. Stationed in a remote Karelian forest, their peaceful existence is shattered when they discover a group of German paratroopers. What follows is a desperate and heroic struggle for survival against overwhelming odds, as each woman faces her own fears and makes the ultimate sacrifice. This powerful and deeply moving narrative is a testament to the courage and resilience of ordinary people in extraordinary circumstances, highlighting the devastating human cost of war and the quiet heroism of those often overlooked by history.

title: Последняя любовь гипнотизера
author: Мориарти Лиана
description: Unravel the mesmerizing secrets of 'The Hypnotist's Last Love,' a psychological thriller that delves into the dark corners of memory, manipulation, and obsession. When a renowned hypnotist falls for a mysterious woman, their passionate affair quickly spirals into a dangerous game of control and deception. As past traumas resurface and identities blur, the line between reality and illusion becomes terrifyingly thin. This novel is a masterclass in suspense, keeping readers on the edge of their seats as they try to piece together the truth behind a love that could be both salvation and ultimate destruction. Prepare for twists that will challenge everything you thought you knew.

title: S.N.U.F.F.
author: Victor Pelevin
description: Дамилола Карпов — боевой пилот и видеохудожник. Он живёт в гигантском офшаре Бизантиум, нависшем над просторами Оркланда, словно чёрное солнце, и его дистанционно управляемая видеокамера, оснащённая пушками и ракетами, наводит ужас на орков в дни священных войн и мирных промежутков между ними. А Грым простой орк, едва успевший окончить школу, он живёт в грязи и свинстве оркской столицы Славы и многого не понимает в устройстве миропорядка. Но их судьбы таинственным образом связаны войной и любовью, двумя составляющими снафов, объединивших кино и новости в единую жертву, которую люди приносят Маниту...

title: Гарри Поттер. Путешествие в историю волшебства
author: Харрисон Д.
description: Embark on an enchanting journey through the history of magic with this captivating companion to the Harry Potter universe. Inspired by the British Library exhibition, this book delves into the fascinating folklore, myths, and magical traditions that underpin J.K. Rowling's beloved series. Discover ancient spells, mythical creatures, and the real-world inspirations behind Hogwarts and its curriculum. Richly illustrated with artifacts, manuscripts, and original artwork, it offers a unique perspective on the magical world, inviting fans to explore the origins of their favorite stories and deepen their appreciation for the intricate tapestry of wizardry.

title: В глубине ноября
author: Янссон Туве
description: Delve into the melancholic beauty of 'In the Depths of November,' a poignant exploration of human emotions set against the backdrop of a fading autumn. This evocative narrative weaves together themes of loss, memory, and the quiet resilience of the human spirit. As the days grow shorter and the world turns inward, characters grapple with their pasts and uncertain futures, finding solace and despair in equal measure. A deeply atmospheric and introspective read that resonates long after the final page.

title: Братья Карамазовы
author: Достоевский Федор
description: Fyodor Dostoevsky's 'The Brothers Karamazov' is a monumental philosophical novel that delves into profound questions of faith, doubt, morality, and the nature of good and evil. The story revolves around the parricide of the depraved Fyodor Pavlovich Karamazov and the subsequent impact on his three sons: the intellectual Ivan, the passionate Dmitri, and the devout Alyosha, along with his illegitimate son, Smerdyakov. Through their intertwined fates and intense philosophical debates, Dostoevsky explores the complexities of human psychology, the struggle between free will and determinism, and the search for spiritual truth in a world grappling with nihilism. The novel is a powerful exploration of sin, redemption, and the human condition, offering a rich tapestry of characters and ideas that continue to resonate with readers worldwide.

title: Лес теней
author: Тилье Франк
description: No official English translation

title: Колесо Времени. Книга 5. Огни небес
author: Джордан Роберт
description: In 'The Fires of Heaven,' the fifth installment of Robert Jordan's epic 'The Wheel of Time' series, the world teeters on the brink of chaos. Rand al'Thor, the Dragon Reborn, grapples with the immense power and responsibility of his destiny, facing both internal struggles and external threats from the Forsaken and the Shadow. As alliances shift and betrayals loom, Egwene al'Vere and Nynaeve al'Meara continue their perilous journey to master the One Power, while Mat Cauthon finds himself drawn into unexpected adventures. This volume is a whirlwind of political intrigue, magical battles, and character development, propelling the grand narrative towards its inevitable confrontation with the Dark One.

title: Русские поэты XVIII века
description: This collection, 'Russian Poets of the XVIII Century,' compiles the seminal works of the most influential poets from Russia's Age of Enlightenment. It showcases the foundational figures who laid the groundwork for modern Russian literature, including Mikhail Lomonosov, Gavrila Derzhavin, and Alexander Sumarokov. The anthology highlights the transition from classical and baroque styles to more distinctly Russian forms, exploring themes of patriotism, philosophy, nature, and the human condition. Readers will discover the elegance, wit, and intellectual vigor that characterized 18th-century Russian poetry, providing crucial insight into the cultural and literary developments of this transformative period in Russian history.

title: Торжество незначительности
author: Кундера Милан
description: Milan Kundera's final novel, 'The Celebration of Insignificance,' is a philosophical and humorous exploration of modern life, aging, and the human condition. Set in contemporary Paris, the narrative intertwines the lives of several characters who grapple with existential questions, the nature of power, and the search for meaning in a world increasingly devoid of grand narratives. Through witty dialogues and absurd situations, Kundera playfully dissects themes of memory, identity, and the illusion of importance. The book is a poignant and thought-provoking meditation on the small, often overlooked moments that define our existence, inviting readers to find joy and profundity in the seemingly insignificant.

title: Naruto. Наруто. Книга 11. В Поисках Саскэ!!!
author: Кисимото Масаси
description: Volume 11 of the iconic Naruto manga series plunges deeper into the emotional and action-packed world of ninja. Naruto Uzumaki and his teammates are on a desperate mission to find Sasuke Uchiha, who has defected from Konoha to seek power with Orochimaru. This volume is a pivotal point, highlighting themes of friendship, betrayal, and the relentless pursuit of strength. Readers will witness intense battles, difficult choices, and the unwavering determination of Naruto to bring his friend back, no matter the cost.

title: Русская литература для всех. От Блока до Бродского. Классное чтение!
author: Сухих Игорь
description: This anthology, 'Russian Literature for Everyone. From Blok to Brodsky. Classic Reading!', offers a comprehensive and accessible journey through the rich landscape of 20th-century Russian poetry and prose. It features a curated selection of works from iconic authors such as Alexander Blok, Anna Akhmatova, Boris Pasternak, Marina Tsvetaeva, and Joseph Brodsky, among others. The collection aims to introduce readers to the diverse voices and profound themes that shaped Russian literature during a tumultuous yet creatively vibrant period. It provides an excellent entry point for those seeking to explore the depth, beauty, and intellectual power of these literary giants, making classic Russian reading enjoyable and understandable for a broad audience.

title: В то время я гостила на земле...․
author: Ахматова Анна
description: Anna Akhmatova's 'At That Time I Was Visiting the Earth...' is a profound collection of poetry that encapsulates the tumultuous history of 20th-century Russia through the lens of personal experience. Akhmatova, one of the most significant figures of the Silver Age of Russian poetry, explores themes of love, loss, memory, and the enduring spirit in the face of political repression and personal tragedy. Her verses are renowned for their lyrical beauty, psychological depth, and stark honesty. This collection offers a poignant and powerful testament to human resilience, providing readers with an intimate glimpse into the soul of a poet who bore witness to immense suffering and yet continued to create art of enduring power and beauty.

title: Опасный двойник. Комиксы
description: This Russian comic book, titled 'Dangerous Double. Comics,' likely plunges readers into a world of intrigue and mistaken identity. While specific plot details are unavailable without an official English translation, the title suggests a narrative centered around a character encountering a doppelganger or a dangerous look-alike, leading to thrilling complications and potentially perilous situations. Comics often explore themes of heroism, villainy, and the struggle between good and evil, and this title hints at a suspenseful story with action-packed sequences typical of the genre. It promises an engaging visual narrative for Russian-speaking comic fans.

title: Новая миссия героев. Комиксы.
description: This vibrant comic book collection embarks on a fresh adventure with a team of diverse heroes as they face an unprecedented challenge that threatens their world. Filled with dynamic artwork and engaging storytelling, 'A New Mission for Heroes' explores themes of teamwork, courage, and the enduring fight against injustice. Each hero brings unique abilities and personalities to the forefront, creating a compelling narrative that will appeal to readers of all ages who enjoy action, fantasy, and tales of heroism. Join them as they unite to overcome adversity and embark on their most critical mission yet.

title: Секрет железной брони. Комиксы
description: Translating to 'The Secret of the Iron Armor. Comics,' this title suggests an action-packed graphic novel. It likely plunges readers into a world of mystery and adventure, where a powerful, perhaps ancient, iron armor holds a significant secret. The narrative could involve a hero or a team uncovering this secret, battling formidable foes, and facing moral dilemmas. Expect dynamic artwork, thrilling plot twists, and a focus on themes of power, responsibility, and the consequences of wielding extraordinary artifacts, all within the engaging format of a comic book series.

title: The Gold-Bug and Other Tales
author: Edgar Allan Poe
description:
Recognized today as the undisputed master of the American Gothic horror story, Edgar Allan Poe (1809-1949) revealed his genius in tales of death, terror, evil, and perversity. Highly skilled in achieving a calculated psychological effect, Poe created chilling fictional nightmares permeated by mysterious forces, grotesque creatures, and improbable hallucinations.
Poe's immense powers as a storyteller are at their peak in this anthology containing nine of his best-known short stories. Among them are 'The Murders in the Rue Morgue,' a gripping 19th-century detective story that provided a model for future mystery writers; 'The Fall of the House of Usher' and 'The Masque of the Red Death,' pervaded with eerie thoughts, impulses, and fears; 'The Tell-Tale Heart' and 'The Cask of Amontillado,' masterpieces of wickedness and crime; 'The Pit and the Pendulum,' with its agonizing specter of imminent and horrifying death; and 'The Gold-Bug,' a fascinating detective story that combines romance and adventure in an absorbing tale of buried treasure.
Mystery lovers and horror story enthusiasts will find this inexpensive collection, by one of the great masters of the form, an exciting addition to their personal libraries.

title: Dubliners
author: James Joyce
description: Dubliners, a collection of fifteen short stories,first published in 1914, form a naturalistic depictionof Irish middle class life in and around Dublin in the early years of the 20th century. This book was created using print-on-demand technology.

title: The Memoirs of Sherlock Holmes
author: Arthur Conan Doyle
description: The Memoirs of Sherlock Holmes is a collection of Sherlock Holmes stories, originally published in 1894. This book was created using print-on-demand technology.

title: Romeo and Juliet
author: William Shakespeare
description: Romeo and Juliet, continuing the tradition of tragic romances stretching back to antiquity, tells the story of two young star-crossed lovers whose deaths ultimately reconcile their feuding families. It was among Shakespeare's most popular plays during his lifetime and, along with Hamlet, is one of his most frequently performed plays. Today, the title characters are regarded as archetypal young lovers. This book was created using print-on-demand technology.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: Francis Scott Fitzgerald
description: The Great Gatsby (1925) follows a cast of characters living in the fictional town of West Egg on prosperous Long Island in the summer of 1922. The story primarily concerns the young and mysterious millionaire Jay Gatsby and his quixotic passion and obsession for the beautiful former debutante Daisy Buchanan and explores themes of decadence, idealism, resistance to change, social upheaval, and excess. This book was created using print-on-demand technology.

title: The Hound of the Baskervilles
author: Arthur Conan Doyle
description: The Hound of the Basketyilles is the third of the crime novels featuring Sherlock Holmes, first published in 1901-1902. It tells the story of an attempted murder inspired by the legend of a fearsome, diabolical hound of supernatural origin. Sherlock Holmes and his companion Dr. Watson investigate the case.

title: The Invisible Man
author: Herbert Wells
description: The Invisible Man is a science fiction novella originally published in 1897. The Invisible Man of the title is Griffin, a scientist who has devoted himself to research into optics and invents a way to change a body's refractive index to that of air, thus becoming invisible, be successfully carries out this procedure on himself, but fails in his attempt to reverse it.

title: King Lear
author: William Shakespeare
description: King Lear depicts the gradual descent into madness of the title character, an ageing British monarch. He intends to divide his monarchy among his three daughters, challenging them to to prove which of them loves him best. While two elder daughters play along, his youngest refuses to say anything. Her behavior enrages Lear and he banishes her forever, bringing tragic consequences for all.

title: Leaves of Grass
author: Walt Whitman
description: Leaves of grass - a poetry collection, with poems loosely connected. With one exception, the poems do not rhyme or follow standard rules for meter and line length. This book is notable for its discussion of delight in sensual pleasures during a time when such candid displays were considered immoral.

title: Tender Is the Night
author: Francis Scott Fitzgerald
description: Tender Is the Night (1934), tells the story of the rise and fall of Dick Diver, a promising young psychoanalyst, and his wife, Nicole, who is also one of his patients. The early 1930s, when Fitzgerald worked on the book, were the darkest years of his life, and the novel's bleakness reflects the author's own experiences.

title: Empire V
author: Victor Pelevin
description:
Юноша становится вампиром, сверхчеловеком, одним из представителей расы, выведшей людей для прокорма как скот. В новой жизни ему предстоит изучить самые важные науки для понимания современного общества: гламур и дискурс, познакомиться с реальным положением вещей в мире.
Актуальный сюжет узнаваемой любовной линией между Рамой и Герой (Степой и Мюс, Петром и Анкой). И все это погружено в чисто пелевинский коктейль из кастанедовщины, теософии, буддизма и мухоморов. Возможно ли такое, вообще, подделать?

title: S.N.U.F.F.
author: Victor Pelevin
description:
Роман о глубочайших тайнах женского сердца и высших секретах летного мастерства.
От автора романов 'Generation P', 'Числа,', 'Омон Ра', 'Чапаев и Пустота' и др. - одного из самых известных писателей России - Виктора Пелевина! Роман S.N.U.F.F., по отзывам знатоков его творчества, самое смелое произведение, в котором автор не просто вплетает вампиров, лис, и красных комдивов в существующие социокультурные реалии, а моделирует целый мир, самобытный от начала и до конца. Но самое ужасное, что весь этот гротеск - очень узнаваем и понятен.

title: V.
author: Thomas Pynchon
description:
Роман «V.» был написан в 1963 году, когда его автору было всего двадцать пять лет. Однако мысль, что это дебют, «проба пера», при прочтении даже не приходит в голову — настолько парадоксально и мастерски написана эта книга.
На что она похожа? Несмотря на множество литературных ассоциаций, она не похожа ни на одно из существующих в мировой литературе произведений.
«V.» скорее вызывает ассоциации с джазовыми композициями или с живописью Босха, его «густонаселенными» картинами, в которых все на первый взгляд хаотично, но из этого хаоса можно извлечь множество смысловых пластов — надо только внимательно и вдумчиво вглядеться.

title: S.N.U.F.F.
author: Victor Pelevin
description: Роман о глубочайших тайнах женского сердца и высших секретах летного мастерства.

title: Empire V
author: Victor Pelevin
description:
Миром правят вампиры.
Не вечно молодые, романтичные юноши и девушки с бессонными глазами и кровавыми губами, а вполне обыкновенные мужчины и женщины со следами жизненного цинизма на лице. Им одним открыт секрет 'гламура' и 'дискурса'. И они - настоящая мировая элита, вербующая в свои ряды прохожих одним легким укусом.
Выбор может пасть на каждого...

title: Empire V
author: Victor Pelevin
description:
Повесть о настоящем сверхчеловеке.
Миром правят вампиры. Не вечно молодые, романтичные юноши и девушки с бессонными глазами и кровавыми губами, а вполне обыкновенные мужчины и женщины со следами жизненного цинизма на лице. Им одним открыт секрет "гламура" и "дискурса". И они - настоящая мировая элита, вербующая в свои ряды прохожих одним легким укусом. Выбор может пасть на каждого.

title: Best humorous stories
description: Чтение оригинальных произведений - простой и действенный способ погрузиться в языковую среду и совершенствоваться в иностранном языке. Серия 'Бестселлер на все времена' - это возможность улучшить свой английский, читая лучшие произведения англоязычных авторов, любимые миллионами читателей. Для лучшего понимания текста в книгу включены краткий словарь и комментарии, поясняющие языковые и лингвострановедческие вопросы, исторические и культурные реалии описываемой эпохи. Что такое английский юмор? Это тонкая игра слов, великолепная ирония, занятные наблюдения, удачные пародии, невероятные сюжеты или удивительно смешные рассказы о повседневных событиях и явлениях. Великолепный язык и блистательные каламбуры не только поднимут настроение, но и помогут улучшить английский. Книга предназначена для тех, кто изучает английский язык на продолжающем или продвинутом уровне и стремится к его совершенствованию.

title: Sense and Sensibility
author: Jane Austen
description:
Чтение оригинальных произведений - простой и действенный способ погрузиться в языковую среду и совершенствоваться в иностранном языке. Серия 'Бестселлер на все времена' - это возможность улучшить свой английский, читая лучшие произведения англоязычных авторов, любимые миллионами читателей. Для лучшего понимания текста в книгу включены краткий словарь и комментарии, поясняющие языковые и лингвострановедческие вопросы, исторические и культурные реалии описываемой эпохи.
Сестры Элинор и Марианна очень разные: одна не забывает быть рассудительной, вторая отдает себя во власть эмоций. Но они обе стремятся к счастью и любви. Что у них получится?
Книга предназначена для тех, кто изучает английский язык на продолжающем или продвинутом уровне и стремится к его совершенствованию.

Элинор Дэшвуд верит, что даже от любви не стоит терять голову - ведь здравый смысл помогает добиться счастья. Ее сестра Марианна убеждена, что искренние чувства не нужно заглушать голосом рассудка. Обеим героиням предстоит проверить свои убеждения на практике, когда в дело вмешается любовь. Пройти весь путь к счастливому финалу вместе с сестрами Дэшвуд вам помогут небольшой словарь в конце книги и множество постраничных сносок-комментариев на русском языке – для тех, кто хочет лучше понимать прочитанное. Информация о трудных словах, нравах и реалиях описываемой эпохи, быте, традициях и мировоззрении персонажей, об истории, географии, культуре позволит лучше понять перипетии сюжета и чувства героев произведения.

title: Гравити Фолз. Графический роман. Вып. 2
description: Dive back into the mysterious world of Gravity Falls with this second volume of the graphic novel series. Join Dipper and Mabel Pines as they uncover more secrets, battle bizarre creatures, and navigate the strange occurrences of their summer vacation in Gravity Falls, Oregon.
