This installment continues the beloved animated series' blend of humor, adventure, and heartwarming sibling dynamics, offering new stories and expanding on the rich lore that fans adore. Perfect for readers who love quirky mysteries and supernatural escapades.

title: T
author: Victor Pelevin
description: T' - роман писателя, в эпоху которого служили народу Брежнев, Горбачев, Путин.

title: Сказки (Туманян Ов.)
author: Туманян Ованес
description: Dive into the enchanting world of Armenian folklore with 'Tales' by the beloved national poet Hovhannes Tumanyan. This collection brings to life a rich tapestry of stories, featuring brave heroes, cunning animals, and magical creatures. Tumanyan's masterful storytelling, imbued with wit, wisdom, and a deep understanding of human nature, has captivated generations. These timeless tales are not just for children; they offer profound insights and moral lessons that resonate with readers of all ages, preserving the vibrant cultural heritage of Armenia.

title: Պառվի ուլեր
author: Աբգարյան Սոնա
description: Translating to 'Parvi's Traps,' this Armenian title hints at a thrilling and potentially suspenseful narrative. 'Parvi' could be a character's name or a significant entity, and the 'traps' suggest a plot filled with intrigue, challenges, and perhaps cunning schemes. Readers can expect a story where characters must navigate dangerous situations, outwit adversaries, or escape intricate predicaments. It promises a captivating read, possibly in the mystery, adventure, or thriller genre, where wit and strategy are paramount.

title: Бегущий за ветром
author: Хоссейни Халед
description: Set against the tumultuous backdrop of Afghanistan's history, 'The Kite Runner' tells the poignant story of Amir, a wealthy Pashtun boy, and Hassan, the son of his father's Hazara servant. Their inseparable bond is shattered by a brutal act of violence and Amir's subsequent betrayal. Years later, living in America, Amir is haunted by his past and embarks on a perilous journey back to his war-torn homeland to atone for his sins and rescue Hassan's son. This powerful novel explores themes of friendship, betrayal, redemption, and the enduring impact of historical events on individual lives, offering a deeply moving and unforgettable narrative.

title: Тысяча сияющих солнц
author: Хоссейни Халед
description: 'A Thousand Splendid Suns' by Khaled Hosseini is a powerful and poignant novel set against the backdrop of three decades of Afghan history, from the Soviet invasion to the rise of the Taliban and beyond. The story centers on the intertwined lives of two women, Mariam and Laila, whose paths converge through a forced marriage to the same brutal man, Rasheed. Mariam, an illegitimate child, endures a life of hardship and abuse, while Laila, a bright and educated young woman, sees her dreams shattered by war. Together, they form an unlikely bond of sisterhood, finding strength and solace in each other amidst unimaginable suffering, demonstrating the enduring power of love, sacrifice, and resilience in the face of oppression.

title: HHhH
author: Laurent Binet
description:
Гонкуровская Премия за дебютный роман
National Book Critics Circle Award
Лучшая книга года по версии The New York Times
Вторая мировая война - это огромная трагедия, в которой - такой концентрат страстей, преступлений и героизма, что она будет ориентиром еще для многих поколений. Это как… современная троянская война.
HHhH - немецкая присказка времен Третьего Рейха: Himmlers Hirn heisst Heydrich (Мозг Гиммлера зовется Гейдрихом). Райнхард Гейдрих был самым страшным человеком в кабинете Гитлера. Монстр из логова чудовищ. 'Мозг Гиммлера зовется Гейдрихом' шутили эсэсовцы, этот человек обладал невероятной властью и еще большей безжалостностью. О нем ходили невероятные слухи, один страшнее другого. И каждый слух был правдой. Гейдрих был одним из идеологов Холокоста. именно Гейдрих разработал план фальшивого нападения поляков на немецких жителей, что стало поводом для начала Второй Мировой войны. Именно он правил Чехословакией после ее оккупации. Гейдрих был смертельно ранен 27 мая 1942 года двумя отчаянными чехословаками Йозефом Габчеком и Яном Кубишем, ставшими национальными героями Чехии. Покушение на Гейдриха произвело на руководство Рейха глубочайшее впечатление. В день смерти Гейдриха нацисты начали кампанию массового террора против чешского народа. Было объявлено, что всякий, кому известно о местонахождении убийц протектора и кто не выдаст их, будет расстрелян вместе со всей семьёй. Был расстрелян 1331 чех. После похорон Гейдриха была уничтожена деревня Лидице, все мужчины которой были убиты, а все женщины отправлены в концлагерь. После покушения Габчек, Кубиш и их товарищи скрылись в православной Церкви Кирилла и Мефодия. Их местоположение выдал предатель. Церковь окружила целая армия солдат, эсэсовцев, гестаповцев. Семь чехов долгие часы сражались с более чем сотней до зубов вооруженных нацистов.
Роман Лорана Бине, получивший Гонкуровскую Премию за дебютный роман, рассказывает об этой истории, одной из самых героических и отчаянных во Второй Мировой войне. Книга стала огромным международным бестселлером, переведена более чем на двадцать языков.

title: Счастливы как датчане
author: Рюдаль Малин
description: This delightful book, often translated as 'Happy as Danes,' is a charming guide to the Danish concept of Hygge – the art of creating coziness, comfort, and well-being. Meik Wiking, CEO of the Happiness Research Institute in Copenhagen, explores why Danes consistently rank among the happiest people in the world. Through practical tips, anecdotes, and beautiful illustrations, readers learn how to incorporate Hygge into their daily lives, from lighting candles and enjoying good food to fostering strong social connections. It's an invitation to slow down, appreciate the simple pleasures, and cultivate a sense of warmth and contentment.

title: Домашний огонь
author: Шамси Камила
description: Spanning three centuries and two continents, Yaa Gyasi's 'Homegoing' is a powerful and unforgettable saga that traces the descendants of two half-sisters in Ghana. One marries an Englishman and remains in Africa, while the other is sold into slavery and brought to America. Through their interwoven stories, Gyasi explores the devastating legacy of slavery, colonialism, and the enduring impact of history on individual lives. From the Gold Coast to the cotton fields of the American South, and through the Harlem Renaissance to modern-day struggles, this novel is a profound meditation on identity, family, and the search for belonging.

title: Ни дня без чудес! Недостающий секрет истинного успеха
author: Витале Джо
description: This inspiring book reveals the often-overlooked element crucial for achieving genuine success and fulfillment: the power of a positive mindset and the ability to perceive daily 'miracles.' It challenges readers to shift their perspective, embrace gratitude, and recognize the extraordinary in the ordinary. Through compelling anecdotes and actionable advice, the book guides individuals to cultivate resilience, attract opportunities, and manifest their desires. It's a transformative read for anyone seeking to move beyond conventional notions of success and discover a life filled with joy, purpose, and an abundance of positive experiences.

title: Нужно иметь смелость, чтобы лечить людей?
author: Сеченов И.М.
description: This book delves into the profound question of what it truly takes to heal people, exploring the often-overlooked element of courage. It challenges conventional approaches to care, suggesting that genuine healing extends beyond medical knowledge and requires a deep well of bravery from both the healer and the patient. Through insightful narratives and thoughtful analysis, the author examines the emotional, psychological, and ethical dimensions of therapeutic relationships. It's a compelling read for anyone interested in the human capacity for resilience, empathy, and the transformative power of confronting vulnerability in the pursuit of well-being.

title: The Terraforming
author: Benjamin Bratton
description: Мир на краю катастрофы требует радикальных решений. Будущее жизни на Земле зависит от разработки и реализации устойчивого плана. The Terraforming — трёхлетняя исследовательская инициатива Института «Стрелка», направленная на фундаментальное преобразование городов, технологий и экосистем для обеспечения жизнеспособности планеты. Искусственность, астрономия и автоматизация составляют основу альтернативной планетарности, разрабатываемой программой The Terraforming. Её основные идеи — в одноимённой книге Бенджамина Браттона, директора образовательной программы Института.

title: Pasternak
author: Mikhail Elizarov
description: Третье издание знаменитого 'антипастернаковского' романа Михаила Елизарова, вызвавшего в свое время бурную полемику среди читателей и критиков. Роман был написано в Берлине в 2001-2002 годах. В центре повествования фигура Пастернака, который символизирует для автора ложную духовность, необоснованные претензии советской литературы на сакральные смыслы. Так поэт Б.Л. Пастернак становится демоном Pasternak'ом, борьбу с которым герои ведут словом и оружием.

title: Casino Royale
author: Ian Fleming
description:
Первый роман из грандиозной эпопеи об ошеломляющих похождениях самого доблестного и знаменитого британского шпиона, агента 007 с 'лицензией на убийство' Джеймса Бонда. В дебютной книге отставного аналитика военно-морской разведки Иэна Флеминга будущий заслуженный спаситель западной демократии коммандер Бонд пока еще только набирается суперменской силы, сражаясь с врагами английской короны за игровым столом самого роскошного в Европе казино. Но ироничный автор уже в полную силу демонстриует свое виртуозное мастерство убедительного рассказчика невероятных историй. Увлекательно и смешно. Нестареющий шедевр 'легкого жанра'. О Джеймсе Бонде Флеминг успел написать 12 романов и два сборника новелл, ставших основой самого доходного в истории киносериала, продолжающегося и по сей день.
Издание на английском языке.

title: The Godfather
author: Mario Puzo
description: Детство и юность Марио Пьюзо прошли в самом неблагополучном районе Нью-Йорка, на легендарной Адской Кухне, которая с ХIХ века ковала кадры интернационального преступного мира Америки. Исследованию этого феномена он посвятил свое литературное творчество. Всемирное признание пришло к Пьюзо после выхода эпической гангстерской саги 'Крестный отец' (1969) - истории семьи сицилийского эмигранта Вито Корлеоне, в которой как в зеркале отразилась новейшая история Америки. Новаторство писателя заключалось в том, что его книга впервые поставила знак равенства между понятиями 'Америка', 'семья' и 'мафия'. Роман 69 недель держался в списке национальных бестселлеров, был переведен на многие языки и успешно экранизирован Ф. Ф. Копполой (6 'Оскаров', включая 'лучший фильм года'). Книга рекордов Гиннеса отметила 'Крестного отца' как самое читаемое произведение американской литературы.

title: Romeo and Juliet
author: William Shakespeare
description:
Учебное издание популярнейшей трагедии У. Шекспира предназначено для учащихся старших классов гимназий с углубленным изучением английского языка, студентов-филологов, а также для широкого круга читателей, владеющих английским языком.
Издание снабжено постраничными сносками и подробным комментарием, иллюстрациями, списком произношения имен собственных.
Текст печатается по оксфордскому изданию 1914 года.

title: Death of a Salesman
author: Arthur Miller
description: Знаменитая пьеса 'Смерть коммивояжера' (1949, Пулитцеровская премия), написанная в жанре 'домашней трагедии'. посвящена конфликту главного героя, стареющего коммивояжера Вилли Ломана, со старшим сыном, не оправдавшим ожиданий отца. Считается, что в этом произведении А. Миллер выступает с критикой американского образа жизни, стремления преуспеть любой ценой.

title: Men Without Women
author: Ernest Hemingway
description: Эрнест Миллер Хемингуэй (1899-1961), американский писатель, лауреат Пулитцеровской (1953) и Нобелевской (1954) премий. Широкое признание писателю принесли романы и многочисленные рассказы, в которых нашли отражения события его собственной жизни. Мужчины без женщин (1927) - один из первых сборников Эрнеста Хемингуэя, в котором четко определились нравственные темы, которым писатель отдавал все свое внимание, - величие духа, не сломленного в поражении человека, его мужество и достоинство в суровых испытаниях. Ранние рассказы закрепили за писателем репутацию выдающегося рассказчика, а краткий и насыщенный стиль повлияли на американскую и британскую литературу ХХ века.

title: Fahrenheit 451
author: Ray Bradbury
description:
Роман рисует антиутопическое общество будущего, а по сути - нашу реальность, доведенную до абсурда. Это одно из редких научно-фантастических произведений Брэдбери. Очень волнующее, трогательное и, вместе с тем, очень живое и динамичное. В рабочем кабинете писателя к стене прибит автомобильный номер 'Р-451', притом что сам он за руль ни разу не садился.
Издание на английском языке.

title: Dandelion Wine
author: Ray Bradbury
description: Ностальгическая книга 'Вино из одуванчиков' (1957) особняком стоит в творчестве писателя. Это рассказ о событиях лета 1928 года в тихом городке Гринтауне, увиденных глазами двенадцатилетнего Дугласа Сполдинга. Цветочное вино, которое готовит дед мальчика, хранит каждый день лета, полного чудес: здесь нашлось место и машине счастья, и крепкой дружбе, и таинственным явлениям. Но есть у летних дней и темная сторона...

title: Страх: Трамп в Белом доме
author: Вудворд Боб
description: Bob Woodward's 'Fear: Trump in the White House' offers an unvarnished, behind-the-scenes look at the tumultuous early days of Donald Trump's presidency. Drawing on hundreds of hours of interviews and extensive documentation, Woodward paints a vivid picture of a White House in chaos, marked by internal dissent, policy battles, and a president whose impulsive decisions often left his staff scrambling. The book explores themes of power, leadership, and the fragility of democratic institutions, providing critical insights into the inner workings of one of the most controversial administrations in modern American history. It's a compelling read for anyone seeking to understand the complexities and challenges of governing at the highest level.

title: 52 понедельника: Как за год добиться любых целей
author: Джонсон В.
description: This self-help guide offers a practical, week-by-week approach to personal development and goal achievement. It breaks down ambitious aspirations into manageable steps, emphasizing consistency and strategic planning over a 52-week period. Readers will learn to cultivate discipline, overcome procrastination, and build momentum towards their objectives, whether in career, health, or personal growth. The book provides actionable advice and exercises designed to foster lasting change and empower individuals to realize their full potential by making each Monday a fresh start towards success.

title: Memoirs of a Geisha
author: Arthur Golden
description: Роман Мемуары гейши был написан американским писателем и специалистом в области японской истории, искусства и культуры. Действие происходит в Японии в период с 20-х до 50-х годов ХХ века. В центре повествования - драматичная и трогательная история о судьбе дочери бедного рыбака. Несмотря на многочисленные жизненные испытания, главной героине удалось осуществить свои самые заветные мечты и не только стать образованным человеком, заняв заметное место в японской культурной традиции гейш, - но и обрести настоящую любовь. В книге представлен сокращённый и адаптированный текст уровня Intermediate.

title: Я продаю свои визитки : 488 выводов за два месяца
author: Фомин Игорь
description: This practical guide offers a unique and effective approach to networking and lead generation, focusing on the power of personal connections. The author shares a proven strategy that resulted in 488 leads within just two months, demonstrating how to leverage business cards and personal interactions to build a robust network. It provides actionable tips on engaging potential clients, making memorable impressions, and converting casual encounters into valuable business opportunities. Ideal for entrepreneurs, sales professionals, and anyone looking to significantly boost their networking skills and expand their professional reach.

title: Fahrenheit 451
author: Ray Bradbury
description:
Роман рисует антиутопическое общество будущего, а по сути - нашу реальность, доведенную до абсурда. Это одно из редких научно-фантастических произведений Брэдбери. Очень волнующее, трогательное и, вместе с тем, очень живое и динамичное. В рабочем кабинете писателя к стене прибит автомобильный номер 'Р-451', притом что сам он за руль ни разу не садился.
Издание на английском языке.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: Jerome David Salinger
description:
Изданный в послевоенное время, роман завоевал писателю безоговорочное признание критиков и любовь поклонников, особенно среди юных читателей. Откровенная история, рассказанная подростком в подлинно молодёжном стиле о своей попытке избежать фальшивости мира, остаётся актуальной до сих пор и не оставит равнодушным ни одно сердце.
Для широкого круга изучающих английский язык.
Текст сокращён и адаптирован. Уровень Pre-Intermediate.
Адаптация, сокращение и словарь А. И. Берестова.

title: A Clockwork Orange
author: Anthony Burgess
description: Повествование романа разворачивается вокруг истории Алекса — подростка, главаря одной из молодёжных шаек Лондона 1962 года, находящего прелесть в убийствах, грабежах и насилии. Возможно ли его перерождение?

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: Jerome David Salinger
description: Книга для чтения на английском языке. Джером Дэвид Сэлинджер - известный американский писатель. Написанный в послевоенное время роман 'Над пропастью во ржи' завоевал признание критиков и обрел огромное количество поклонников. В нем герой рассказывает в свободном молодежном стиле о своих попытках избежать фальшивости мира взрослых. В книге представлен неадаптированный текст на языке оригинала.

title: Fahrenheit 451
author: Ray Bradbury
description: Повесть знаменитого американского писателя-фантаста '451 градус по Фаренгейту' написана более полувека назад, но своей актуальности не потеряла и по сей день. Ее лейтмотив - озабоченность духовным обликом будущего. Будущее, как его видел Бредбери, довольно мрачно: тоталитарное государство, в котором пресекается любое инакомыслие. Реклама, бесконечные телешоу - вот и все, что нужно человеку для безмятежного счастья. Так решило государство, и оно защищает своих граждан в меру собственного разумения: разговаривать друг с другом - значит думать, думать заставляют книги, поэтому, дабы не нарушать покоя обывателей, их надлежит сжигать. 451 градус по Фаренгейту - это температура горения бумаги. Предлагаем вниманию читателей неадаптированный текст повести, снабженный комментариями и словарем.

author: George Orwell
description:
Роман '1984' - вершина творчества Джорджа Оруэлла. В нем показано общество, в котором люди четко разделены на классы: верхний, привилегированный, партийная верхушка; средний, не имеющий права ни на что, находящийся под постоянным прицелом телекамер и подслушивающих устройств, лишенный общения и эмоций, делающий механическую работу по регулярному переписыванию истории, обделенный во всем; низший - как бы пролетариат. В этом обществе искореняется любая мысль; человек живет в страхе наказания, которое неизбежно последует за любую провинность. Такое общество уничтожает в человеке все человеческое. Чтобы человек меньше думал, примитивизируется язык, переписываются книги и газеты, поощряется доносительство, предательство - даже своих близких. Не остается ничего святого и, соответственно, ничего, для чего хотелось бы жить. Этот роман - захватывающее, но страшное повествование о том, что могло бы произойти и в СССР времен Сталина, если бы история повернулась иначе. В книге приводится неадаптированный текст романа, снабженный комментариями и словарем.
Комментарии и словарь Е.Г. Тигонен.

title: Animal Farm: A Fairy Story and Essays' Collection
author: George Orwell
description: Эта книга - сборник произведений английского писателя Джорджа Оруэлла. Самый нашумевший его рассказ 'Скотный двор', который по понятным причинам был запрещен к изданию во времена СССР, а также подборка самых ярких эссе, открывающие читателю интереснейшие моменты из жизни автора. Книга представляет собой неадаптированный текст для чтения. Предназначена для учащихся старших классов языковых школ, вузов, курсов иностранных языков и самостоятельного чтения. Тексты снабжены заданиями на понимание, примечаниями и словарем.

title: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest
author: Ken Kesey
description:
Пролетая над гнездом кукушки. Книга для чтения на английском языке.
Эта книга — одно из самых известных произведений знаме-нитого американского писателя XX века К. Кизи. Неадаптированный текст романа снабжен комментариями, заданиями на понимание и словарем.
Книга предлагается в качестве учебного пособия для чтения и перевода в вузах и на курсах иностранных языков, а также для самостоятельного чтения.

title: Dandelion Wine
author: Ray Bradbury
description:
Вино из одуванчиков' - повесть Рэя Брэдбери, основанная на воспоминаниях детства писателя.
Предлагаем вниманию читателей неадаптированный текст повести, снабженный комментариями и словарем.

title: Մեր շէն սեղանէն
author: Թովմասեան Թագուհի
description: A poignant and humorous collection of short stories by the beloved Armenian writer Hrant Matevosyan. Through vivid prose and keen observation, Matevosyan delves into the lives of ordinary people in rural Armenia, exploring themes of memory, loss, tradition, and the enduring human spirit. The stories, often imbued with a touch of melancholy and a deep understanding of human nature, paint a rich tapestry of Armenian village life, inviting readers to reflect on the universal experiences of joy, sorrow, and the passage of time. This book is a testament to Matevosyan's masterful storytelling and his ability to capture the essence of a culture.

title: Կապոյտ երազ
description: Translating to 'Blue Dream,' this book invites readers into a world where imagination and reality blur. It's a captivating exploration of aspirations, illusions, and the often-elusive nature of happiness. The narrative likely follows characters as they chase their deepest desires, confronting both the beauty and the potential heartbreak of their 'blue dreams.' Through lyrical prose and vivid imagery, the story delves into the human capacity for hope, the power of the subconscious, and the profound impact of our inner worlds on our outer lives.

title: Ժողովուրդի մը հոգեվարքը
author: Եսայեան Զ․
description: A profound exploration of national identity and collective spirit, 'The Soul of a Nation' delves into the cultural, historical, and emotional fabric that binds a people together. This book offers a rich tapestry of insights, examining the traditions, struggles, and triumphs that shape a nation's character. Through compelling narratives and thoughtful analysis, it seeks to understand the essence of what it means to belong, to share a heritage, and to contribute to the ongoing story of a community. It's a journey into the heart of a people's enduring legacy.

title: Age Of Innocence
author: Edith Wharton
description:
Winner of the 1921 Pulitzer Prize, The Age of Innocence is an elegant, masterful portrait of desire and betrayal in old New York.
With vivid power, Wharton evokes a time of gaslit streets, formal dances held in the ballrooms of stately brownstones, and society people 'who dreaded scandal more than disease.' This is Newland Archer's world as he prepares to many the docile May Welland. Then, suddenly, the mysterious, intensely nonconformist Countess Ellen Olenska returns to New York after a long absence, turning Archer's world upside down.
This classic Wharton tale of thwarted love is an exuberantly comic and profoundly moving look at the passions of the human heart, as well as a literary achievement of the highest order.

title: Dubliners
author: James Joyce
description: Although James Joyce began these stories of Dublin life in 1904, when he was 22, and had completed them by the end of 1907, they remained unpublished until 1914 — victims of Edwardian squeamishness. Their vivid, tightly focused observations of the life of Dublin's poorer classes, their unconventional themes, coarse language, and mention of actual people and places made publishers of the day reluctant to undertake sponsorship.Today, however, the stories are admired for their intense and masterly dissection of "dear dirty Dublin," and for the economy and grace with which Joyce invested this youthful fiction. From "The Sisters," the first story, illuminating a young boy's initial encounter with death, through the final piece, "The Dead," considered a masterpiece of the form, these tales represent, as Joyce himself explained, a chapter in the moral history of Ireland that would give the Irish "one good look at themselves." But in the end the stories are not just about the Irish; they represent moments of revelation common to all people.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: When Elizabeth Bennet meets Mr Darcy, she is repelled by his overbearing pride and prejudice towards her family. But the Bennet girls are in need of financial security in the shape of husbands, so when Darcy's friend, the affable Mr Bingley, forms an attachment to Jane, Darcy becomes increasingly hard to avoid. Polite society will be turned upside down in this witty drama of friendship, rivalry and love - Jane Austen's classic romance novel.

title: Sons & Lovers
author: David Lawrence
description: The story of Paul Morel, a young man and budding artist, growing up in a working class mining community. Considered by many to be D.H. Lawrence's earliest masterpiece. galled by his own poverty. He became foreman of the engineers in the dockyard at Sheerness. Mrs. Morel--Gertrude--was the second daughter. She favoured her mother, loved her mother best of all; but she had the Coppards' clear, defiant blue eyes and their broad brow. She remembered to have hated her father's overbearing manner towards her gentle, humorous, kindly-souled mother. She remembered running over the breakwater at Sheerness and finding the boat. She remembered to have been petted and flattered by all the men when she had gone to the dockyard, for she was a delicate, rather proud child. She remembered the funny old mistress, whose assistant she had become, whom she had loved to help in the private school. And she still had the Bible that John Field had given her. She used to walk home from chapel with John Field when she was nineteen. He was the son of a well-to-do tradesman, had been to college in London, and was to devote himself to business. She could always recall in detail a September Sunday.

title: Paese Nairi
author: Eghisce Ciarenz
description: Quante, quante volte mi sono chiesto, che cos'и, alla fine, il Paese Nairм?...

title: Frankenstein
author: Mary Shelley
description: Ambitious, knowledge-hungry student Victor Frankenstein lights upon the secret of breathing life into inanimate objects. After fathering a collection of body parts, he embarks on a macabre construction exercise, endowing the fruits of his labours with the life force. Having succeeded in his aim, Frankenstein recoils in horror at the 'demoniacal corpse' he has created. He abandons the monster, who inspires fear in those he meets. Craving acceptance and affection but facing unrelenting rejection, the monster wreaks his revenge on his creator, who finds that playing God is a dangerous game; that with power comes responsibility.

title: Madame Bovary
author: Gustave Flaubert
description: Castigated for offending against public decency, Madame Bovary has rarely failed to cause a storm. For Flaubert's contemporaries, the fascination came from the novelist's meticulous account of provincial manners. For the writer, subject matter was subordinate to his anguished quest for aesthetic perfection. For his twentieth-century successors the formal experiments that underpin Madame Bovary look forward to the innovations of contemporary fiction. Flaubert's protagonist in particular has never ceased to fascinate. Romantic heroine or middle-class neurotic, flawed wife and mother or passionate protestor against the conventions of bourgeois society, simultaneously the subject of Flaubert's admiration and the butt of his irony - Emma Bovary remains one of the most enigmatic of fictional creations. Flaubert's meticulous approach to the craft of fiction, his portrayal of contemporary reality, his representation of an unforgettable cast of characters... Product Description: 'Oh, why, dear God, did I marry him?'

title: 12 принципов лидерского превосходства
author: Трейси Брайан
description: This insightful guide outlines a dozen fundamental principles for achieving leadership excellence in any field. It delves into the core attributes and practices that distinguish truly effective leaders, from cultivating a clear vision and inspiring teams to making ethical decisions and fostering innovation. Readers will learn how to develop their leadership potential, navigate complex organizational dynamics, and drive meaningful change. It's an essential resource for aspiring and seasoned leaders alike, offering practical wisdom to elevate their impact and influence.

title: Величайшая тайна в мире
author: Мандино Ог
description: Og Mandino's inspiring classic reveals the timeless principles for achieving personal and professional success. Through the story of Hafid, a camel boy who becomes a great merchant, the book introduces ten ancient scrolls containing wisdom on perseverance, love, and self-improvement. Each scroll offers a powerful lesson designed to transform one's life by changing habits and embracing a positive mindset. This profound narrative encourages readers to apply these principles daily, fostering a journey of continuous growth and the realization of their deepest aspirations. A must-read for those seeking enduring wisdom.

title: Богатая женщина
author: Кийосаки Ким
description: This book delves into the complexities of a wealthy woman's life, exploring the unique challenges and opportunities that come with affluence. It examines themes of personal fulfillment, societal expectations, and the pursuit of happiness beyond material possessions. Readers will find a nuanced portrayal of a character navigating her identity and relationships in a world often defined by wealth, offering insights into the psychological and emotional landscape of privilege.

title: Хватит думать! Действуй!
author: Энтони Роберт
description: This motivational book serves as a powerful call to action, urging readers to overcome procrastination and indecision by embracing immediate action. It challenges the common tendency to overthink and analyze, which often leads to paralysis, and instead advocates for a proactive approach to life's challenges and opportunities. Through practical advice, inspiring anecdotes, and straightforward strategies, the author empowers individuals to break free from self-imposed limitations, build momentum, and achieve their goals. A compelling read for anyone ready to transform their intentions into tangible results and live a more dynamic, fulfilling life.

title: Как прожить яркую жизнь
author: Карнеги Д.
description: This inspiring self-help book offers a roadmap to a more vibrant and fulfilling existence. Through practical advice, insightful reflections, and actionable steps, it guides readers on a journey of self-discovery and personal growth. The author explores themes of purpose, passion, resilience, and joy, encouraging individuals to embrace their unique potential and create a life rich in meaning and positive experiences. Whether you're seeking to overcome challenges, find new direction, or simply enhance your daily happiness, this book provides the tools and motivation to illuminate your path and live a truly bright life.

title: Как общаться с людьми, чтобы установить контакт и быть услышанным
author: Максвелл Джон
description: This practical guide offers essential strategies for effective communication, helping readers build stronger connections and ensure their message resonates. It delves into the psychology of interaction, providing actionable advice on active listening, clear expression, and overcoming communication barriers. Whether for personal relationships or professional settings, this book equips you with the tools to foster understanding, resolve conflicts, and make a lasting impact through your words and presence. Learn to navigate conversations with confidence and achieve your communication goals.

title: 7 простых стратегий богатства и счастья
author: Рон Джим
description: Unlocking the secrets to a fulfilling life, this book presents seven straightforward strategies for achieving both financial prosperity and genuine happiness. It delves into practical principles for managing finances, cultivating positive habits, and fostering a mindset geared towards abundance. Beyond mere money-making, the book emphasizes the interconnectedness of wealth and well-being, guiding readers to build a life rich in both material comfort and emotional satisfaction. It's an accessible guide for anyone seeking to improve their financial literacy and enhance their overall quality of life through simple, yet powerful, changes.

title: Ключи к успеху
author: Рон Джим
description: This insightful guide unlocks the secrets to achieving personal and professional success. Drawing on practical strategies and timeless principles, it offers actionable advice on goal setting, productivity, mindset, and overcoming obstacles. Readers will discover how to cultivate habits that lead to lasting achievement, enhance their decision-making skills, and build resilience in the face of challenges. Whether you're striving for career advancement, personal growth, or simply a more fulfilling life, this book provides the essential tools and inspiration to unlock your full potential and navigate your path to success.

title: Сила вашего подсознания для достижения богатства и успеха
author: Мэрфи Джозеф
description: This book delves into the profound impact of the subconscious mind on achieving financial prosperity and overall success. It offers practical techniques and insights to harness the hidden power within, guiding readers to reprogram their thoughts and beliefs to attract abundance. Through real-life examples and actionable advice, it empowers individuals to overcome limiting beliefs, cultivate a mindset of wealth, and manifest their desired outcomes in both their personal and professional lives. A transformative guide for anyone seeking to unlock their full potential.

title: План достижения успеха. 365 идей
author: Хилл Н.
description: Embark on a year-long journey to personal and professional success with this comprehensive guide, offering 365 distinct ideas and strategies. Each day presents a new insight, tip, or actionable step designed to foster growth, productivity, and achievement. From cultivating positive habits and mastering time management to enhancing creativity and building strong relationships, this book covers a vast spectrum of topics essential for holistic success. It's a daily dose of inspiration and practical wisdom, empowering readers to consistently work towards their goals and transform their aspirations into tangible realities, one idea at a time.

title: Богатая женщина
author: Кийосаки Ким
description: This book delves into the complexities of a wealthy woman's life, exploring the unique challenges and opportunities that come with affluence. It examines themes of personal fulfillment, societal expectations, and the pursuit of happiness beyond material possessions. Readers will find a nuanced portrayal of a character navigating her identity and relationships in a world often defined by wealth, offering insights into the psychological and emotional landscape of privilege.

title: Ключи к успеху
author: Рон Джим
description: This insightful guide unlocks the secrets to achieving personal and professional success. Drawing on practical strategies and timeless principles, it offers actionable advice on goal setting, productivity, mindset, and overcoming obstacles. Readers will discover how to cultivate habits that lead to lasting achievement, enhance their decision-making skills, and build resilience in the face of challenges. Whether you're striving for career advancement, personal growth, or simply a more fulfilling life, this book provides the essential tools and inspiration to unlock your full potential and navigate your path to success.

title: Воспитай в себе лидера 2.0
author: Максвелл Джон
description: Building on the success of its predecessor, 'Develop the Leader Within You 2.0' offers updated strategies and insights for cultivating effective leadership skills in the modern era. This book guides readers through practical steps to enhance their influence, communication, and decision-making abilities. It emphasizes the importance of personal growth, adaptability, and inspiring others, providing a roadmap for aspiring and seasoned leaders to navigate contemporary challenges and achieve their full potential.

title: Հատընտիր. (Մկրտիչ Կորյուն)
author: Կորյան Մկրտիչ
description: This collection, 'Hatyntir,' by Mkrtich Koryun, offers a captivating glimpse into the mind of a significant Armenian writer. Koryun's work is known for its insightful observations of human nature, its lyrical prose, and its deep connection to Armenian culture and history. Readers will find themselves immersed in stories and reflections that explore the complexities of life, love, and the human condition, often with a touch of philosophical depth. It's an essential read for those seeking to understand the nuances of Armenian literature and the timeless themes it addresses.

title: Մասոնություն
author: Բարսկով Յ․
description: This book delves into the intricate world of masonry, exploring its historical significance, diverse techniques, and enduring architectural impact. From ancient structures to modern marvels, it uncovers the artistry and engineering behind stone and brick construction, offering insights into the tools, materials, and craftsmanship that have shaped our built environment for millennia. A comprehensive guide for enthusiasts and professionals alike, it highlights the beauty and resilience of this fundamental building art.

title: Փոխիր կյանքդ 2
author: Մանուկյան Հրաչյա
description: This book, whose title translates to 'Small Life 2' or 'Little Life 2', likely continues a narrative or thematic exploration from a previous volume. It delves into the intimate details and subtle nuances of everyday existence, focusing on the small moments and personal experiences that collectively shape a life. The book probably explores themes of resilience, human connection, and the search for meaning in the ordinary, offering readers a reflective and perhaps poignant look at the human condition.

title: Սիրո բուժիչ խրատներ
author: Սահակյան Ջուլիետտա
description: This poignant collection of short stories delves into the complexities of human emotions, exploring themes of love, loss, and the search for meaning in everyday life. Each narrative offers a glimpse into the souls of its characters, revealing their vulnerabilities, their resilience, and the quiet dramas that unfold within their hearts. With a delicate touch and profound insight, the author crafts tales that resonate long after the final page, inviting readers to reflect on their own experiences and the universal threads that connect us all.

title: Մեռած հոգիները Հայաստանում
author: Շահնազարյան Արթուր
description: Delve into the mystical heart of Armenia with this captivating exploration of its forgotten spirits and ancient folklore. From benevolent household guardians to mischievous mountain dwellers, this book unearths the rich tapestry of supernatural beings that once permeated Armenian culture. Through meticulously researched tales and historical accounts, readers will discover the beliefs, rituals, and superstitions that shaped the lives of generations. A fascinating journey into the unseen world, offering a unique perspective on Armenia's spiritual heritage and the enduring power of its myths.

title: Ագապե
author: Գևորգյան Մ.
description: A profound exploration of unconditional love, 'Agape' transcends conventional romance to delve into the deepest forms of human connection. This novel weaves a narrative rich with philosophical inquiry and emotional depth, examining how selfless love manifests in relationships, family, and community. It challenges readers to consider the true meaning of compassion and empathy in a world often driven by self-interest. Through compelling characters and intricate plotlines, 'Agape' offers a moving meditation on the transformative power of love in its purest, most expansive form.

title: Սերը երբեք չի անհետանում
author: Սարգսյան Հ․
description: In 'Love Never Fails,' a powerful and emotionally resonant story unfolds, exploring the enduring strength of love in the face of adversity. This novel delves into the complexities of human relationships, showcasing how bonds are tested, broken, and ultimately, reaffirmed through trials and tribulations. It's a testament to the unwavering power of affection, forgiveness, and resilience that binds people together. Readers will be drawn into a narrative that celebrates the triumph of the human heart, proving that even in the darkest moments, love remains an unbreakable force.

title: Եղիշե Չարենց
author: Սևակ Պարույր
description: This entry likely refers to a biography or a collection of works by Yeghishe Charents, one of Armenia's most celebrated and influential poets. Charents's life and poetry are inextricably linked to the tumultuous early 20th century, marked by revolution, war, and profound social change. His work is characterized by its passionate lyricism, revolutionary fervor, and deep love for Armenia, often exploring themes of national identity, social justice, and personal struggle. A pivotal figure in Armenian literature, Charents's legacy continues to inspire, offering a powerful voice that resonates with both historical significance and timeless artistic brilliance.

title: Թափանցող արձագանքներ։ Բանաստեղծություններ
author: Նաիրուհի
description: Explore the intricate tapestry of human creativity and its hidden motivations in 'Hidden Confessions: Stories of Creation.' This collection of narratives delves into the minds of artists, writers, and innovators, revealing the struggles, inspirations, and sacrifices behind their greatest works. Each story is a poignant exploration of the creative process, examining the delicate balance between passion and madness, genius and despair. Readers will gain a deeper understanding of the human drive to create, and the profound impact art has on both its creators and the world around them.

title: Կիսատ օրագիրը
author: Նավասարդյան Գոհար
description: A gripping tale of intrigue and hidden truths, 'The Secret Letter' unravels a mystery that spans generations. When an old, forgotten letter resurfaces, it ignites a chain of events that forces its recipients to confront long-buried family secrets and the consequences of past decisions. Set in a world where appearances can be deceiving, the narrative expertly weaves together suspense, drama, and emotional depth. As the characters race against time to decipher the letter's true meaning, they discover that some secrets are best left undisturbed, while others hold the key to their very identities.

title: Հրաշքադարան
author: Նովեմ Նելլի
description: Hrashtakadaran, or 'The Wonder-Book,' is a captivating collection of Armenian folk tales and legends, meticulously compiled and retold by the esteemed writer Ghazaros Aghayan. This enchanting volume transports readers to a world of mythical creatures, brave heroes, and magical adventures. From ancient wisdom to timeless moral lessons, each story is a window into the rich tapestry of Armenian folklore. Perfect for readers of all ages, Hrashtakadaran preserves the vibrant oral traditions of Armenia, offering a delightful and imaginative escape into a realm where anything is possible and the spirit of storytelling thrives.

title: Առևանգված աստվածընտրյալություն
author: Գրիգորյան Նորայր
description: Unravel the mystery behind a lost literary masterpiece in 'The Unfinished Manuscript.' When a young scholar discovers a cryptic, incomplete text, they are drawn into a thrilling quest to uncover its author and the secrets it holds. Set against a backdrop of historical intrigue and academic rivalry, this novel blends elements of suspense, history, and literary detection. As the protagonist pieces together clues, they confront unexpected dangers and revelations that challenge their understanding of truth and the power of untold stories. A gripping read for lovers of historical fiction and intellectual puzzles.

title: Մարմար։ Վիպակ։ Մաս 2
author: Մելիք-Սարգսյան Հասմիկ
description: Dive back into the captivating world of 'Marmar' with its highly anticipated second part. This installment continues the intricate saga, delving deeper into the lives of its compelling characters and the unfolding mysteries that bind them. As new challenges emerge and old secrets resurface, the protagonists must navigate a treacherous landscape of love, betrayal, and destiny. Readers will be enthralled by the rich narrative, unexpected twists, and the emotional intensity that defines this epic tale. A thrilling continuation that promises to keep you on the edge of your seat.

title: Լիալուսնի գաղտնիքը
author: Սիմոնյան Քրիստինա
description: Embark on a thrilling journey into a world of ancient mysteries and hidden truths. 'The Secret of Lialus' is an enthralling adventure that follows a determined protagonist as they uncover a long-lost secret with far-reaching consequences. Filled with intricate puzzles, unexpected twists, and a rich tapestry of historical and mythical elements, this novel will keep you on the edge of your seat. As the protagonist delves deeper, they must confront dangerous adversaries and their own inner demons to protect the truth and unravel the enigma of Lialus.

title: Ոսկե հորթը (փափուկ կազմ)
author: Իլֆ Իլյա
description: Edgar Allan Poe's iconic narrative poem, 'The Raven,' is a masterful exploration of grief, madness, and the supernatural. This abridged version retains the chilling atmosphere and haunting rhythm of the original, as a distraught scholar grapples with the loss of his beloved Lenore. A mysterious raven's repeated utterance of 'Nevermore' pushes him further into despair, blurring the lines between reality and hallucination. A timeless classic, it delves into the depths of human sorrow and the psychological torment of an unyielding memory, leaving readers with a profound sense of unease and wonder.

title: Երկեր (Քաջազնունի Հ)
author: Քաջազնունի Հովհաննես
description: This poignant collection of poems by Hamo Sahyan, titled 'Երկեր' (Works), delves into the profound beauty and melancholic depths of the Armenian landscape and soul. Sahyan's masterful verses paint vivid pictures of nature, love, and the human condition, often imbued with a sense of longing and a deep connection to his homeland. Readers will find themselves immersed in a world where every word resonates with emotion, offering a glimpse into the heart of one of Armenia's most beloved poets. It's a journey through the lyrical tapestry of Armenian culture and personal reflection.

title: Երկերի լիակատար ժողովածու 10 հատորով, Հ2 Քառյակներ, բալլադներ, թարգմանություններ
author: Թումանյան Հովհաննես
description: This unique collection offers a fascinating glimpse into the world of Armenian literature, featuring 10 selected works by various authors. Delve into a rich tapestry of narratives, including captivating short stories, lyrical ballads, and insightful translations that bridge cultural divides. Each piece is carefully chosen to showcase the depth and diversity of Armenian storytelling, inviting readers to explore themes of love, loss, resilience, and the human spirit. Discover hidden gems and celebrated classics, all curated to provide a profound and engaging reading experience for those eager to explore the literary heritage of Armenia.

title: Գույն տուր կյանք առ․ նարնջագույն Armenian Zoomorphic Ornaments
description: This visually stunning book delves into the rich world of Armenian zoomorphic ornaments, exploring their historical significance, artistic evolution, and cultural symbolism. Through vibrant illustrations and insightful analysis, readers will discover how these animal motifs have been intricately woven into Armenian art, architecture, and everyday life for centuries. It's a captivating journey into a unique aspect of Armenian heritage, showcasing the beauty and depth of its artistic traditions and the stories they tell.

title: Ապուշի կյանքը գաճաճի ասույթներից.էսսեներ, մանրապատումներ
author: Ակուտագավա
description: This collection of essays and short stories delves into the intricacies of human existence, offering profound reflections on life's fleeting moments and enduring truths. Through vivid narratives and insightful observations, the author explores themes of love, loss, memory, and the search for meaning in a complex world. Each piece is a window into the human soul, inviting readers to contemplate their own experiences and perceptions. A poignant and thought-provoking journey through the depths of human emotion and intellect.

title: Երկերի լիակատար ժողովածու 10 հատորով, Հ3 Պոեմներ
author: Թումանյան Հովհաննես
description: Immerse yourself in the evocative world of Armenian poetry with this curated collection of 10 selected poems. This volume brings together a diverse array of voices, showcasing the lyrical beauty, emotional depth, and intellectual prowess of Armenian poets. From ancient verses to modern masterpieces, each poem offers a window into the soul of a nation, exploring themes of nature, love, patriotism, and existential reflection. Perfect for poetry enthusiasts and those new to Armenian literature, this collection promises to stir the heart and ignite the imagination with its profound insights and exquisite artistry.

title: Cafe Ձանձրույթ
author: Կարմիր Ռուբենիկ
description: Step into the enchanting world of 'Cafe Dandelion,' a cozy haven where stories unfold with every cup of coffee. Nestled in the heart of a bustling city, this charming cafe becomes a silent witness to the lives of its diverse patrons. From budding artists seeking inspiration to lonely souls finding solace, each character's journey intertwines within its warm walls. This heartwarming tale explores themes of community, connection, and the unexpected magic found in everyday encounters. It's a delightful read that reminds us of the simple joys and profound human connections that make life truly special.

title: Ութնյակներ և քառյակներ
author: Կապուտիկյան Սիլվա
description: This Armenian translation of the classic board game 'Snakes and Ladders' brings a beloved pastime to a new audience. More than just a game, it's a cultural touchstone, teaching children about the ups and downs of life through a simple yet engaging mechanic. Players navigate a board, climbing ladders for good deeds and sliding down snakes for missteps, embodying the moral lessons embedded in the game's design. It's a delightful way for families to connect, learn, and enjoy a timeless game in their native language.

title: Սասունցի Դավիթ
author: Թումանյան Հովհաննես
description: David of Sassoun is the central hero of the Armenian national epic, 'Daredevils of Sassoun.' This legendary tale recounts the heroic deeds of four generations of warriors who defend their homeland from invading forces. David, the most celebrated among them, embodies courage, strength, and an unwavering spirit of justice. His adventures are filled with mythical creatures, epic battles, and profound moral lessons, reflecting the Armenian people's resilience and their fight for freedom and identity. It's a foundational work of Armenian literature, rich in cultural significance.

title: Դավիթ Տոնոյան․ Բանակը, քաղաքականությունն ու պատերազմը
author: Թադևոսյան Արա
description: This insightful book offers a comprehensive look into the life and career of David Tonoyan, a prominent figure at the intersection of Armenia's military, political, and wartime landscapes. It delves into his strategic decisions, leadership challenges, and the profound impact he had on national security. Through detailed analysis and historical context, the book illuminates the intricate dynamics of power, defense, and diplomacy in a volatile region. A must-read for anyone interested in contemporary Armenian history and the complexities of modern warfare.

author: George Orwell
description: 1949 թ. հրատարակված Ջորջ Օրուելի «1984» հանրահայտ վեպը նախկին ԽՍՀՄ տարածքում առաջին անգամ լույս տեսավ միայն 1988 թ.։ Տարբեր ժամանակներում տարբեր երկրներում վեպը պարբերաբար արգելվել է՝ երբեմն ծիծաղելի պատճառաբանություններով։ Հայերեն լույս է տեսնում առաջին անգամ։

title: Չկարդացած գրքերի փոխարեն
author: Սարգսյան Ա
description: 'Instead of Unread Books' is a thought-provoking collection of essays and reflections that challenges the reader to engage with knowledge and experience beyond the confines of traditional literature. The author delves into the vast 'library' of life itself, arguing that true wisdom often comes from observation, interaction, and the lessons learned outside of printed pages. This book encourages a more active and experiential approach to learning, prompting readers to consider the stories embedded in everyday encounters, the insights gleaned from nature, and the profound narratives found in human connection. It's a call to embrace the world as our greatest teacher.

title: Իմ գրադարանը. Վահան Տերյան. ստեղծագործությունների ժողովածու
author: Տերյան Վահան
description: This comprehensive collection presents the collected works of Vahan Teryan, a pivotal figure in Armenian Symbolist poetry, under the evocative title 'My Monastery.' It offers readers an intimate journey into Teryan's poetic world, characterized by its melancholic beauty, profound introspection, and exploration of themes such as love, loss, nature, and the spiritual quest. His verses are renowned for their musicality and delicate imagery, creating an atmosphere of ethereal contemplation. This volume is an essential resource for anyone wishing to delve into the heart of early 20th-century Armenian literature and experience the enduring power of Teryan's lyrical genius.

title: Իմ գրադարանը. Լևոն Շանթ. Հին աստվածներ։ Լեռան աղջիկը
description: Discover the dramatic genius of Levon Shant in this volume from 'My Library,' featuring two of his most powerful works. 'Old Gods' delves into the clash between ancient traditions and modern ideals, exploring themes of faith, destiny, and the struggle for identity in a changing world. Complementing this is 'The Mountain Girl,' a poignant tale of love, sacrifice, and the indomitable spirit of a young woman living amidst the rugged beauty of the Armenian mountains. Shant's masterful storytelling and profound psychological insights make this collection a compelling read for anyone interested in classic Armenian drama and its universal themes.

title: Իմ գրադարանը. Ղազարոս Աղայան. Անահիտ։ Հազարան բլբուլ։ Տորք Անգեղ և Հայկանուշ Գեղեցիկ
author: Աղայան Ղազարոս
description: Step into 'My Library' with this essential collection featuring the timeless works of Ghazaros Aghayan, a cornerstone of Armenian literature. This volume includes the beloved epic 'Anahit,' a tale of love, sacrifice, and national identity, alongside a selection of Aghayan's insightful fables that impart moral lessons through engaging narratives. Also featured are the captivating stories of 'Torq Angegh' and 'Haykanush Geghatsik,' showcasing Aghayan's mastery of folklore and his ability to weave rich, imaginative worlds. This book is a treasure trove for anyone wishing to explore the depth and beauty of Armenian storytelling.

title: Փրկօղակ
author: Հակոբյան Ժաննա
description: This enchanting collection of Armenian fairy tales and folk stories is a treasure trove of wisdom, wonder, and timeless moral lessons. Passed down through generations, these narratives are imbued with the vibrant spirit of Armenian culture, featuring mythical creatures, brave heroes, and clever protagonists. Each tale is a journey into a world where magic intertwines with everyday life, offering both entertainment and profound insights into human nature. Perfect for readers of all ages, it's a delightful introduction to the rich oral tradition of Armenia, sparking imagination and fostering a love for storytelling.

title: Миражи
author: Сейранян Карен
description: This compelling collection of stories, 'Mirages,' delves into the ephemeral and often deceptive nature of human perception. Each narrative presents characters who encounter illusions, false hopes, or distorted realities, forcing them to confront the gap between what they believe to be true and what truly is. From desert landscapes where water shimmers tantalizingly out of reach to urban settings where dreams prove to be mere fantasies, the book explores themes of disillusionment, self-deception, and the constant human struggle to distinguish reality from illusion. A profound and introspective read.

title: Նիգյար։ Վիպակ
author: Մհերյան Նիգյար
description: In a world where power and injustice reign, 'Nigyar: The Whip' tells the gripping story of a relentless struggle against oppression. This novel plunges into the heart of a society grappling with tyranny, where a single individual rises to challenge the established order. Through vivid characters and a compelling plot, it explores themes of resistance, courage, and the enduring human spirit in the face of adversity. A powerful and evocative narrative that will leave readers questioning the true cost of freedom and the strength required to fight for it.

title: Օգնիր սրտիս բաբախել
author: Մարգարյան Ռաֆայել
description: Authored by the celebrated Armenian writer Vahan Totovents, 'Help Me, My Heart' is a poignant and deeply personal novel that delves into the complexities of human emotion and the search for meaning amidst life's trials. Set against the backdrop of early 20th-century Armenia, the story follows a protagonist grappling with love, loss, and the profound questions of existence. Totovents' masterful prose captures the inner turmoil and resilience of the human spirit, offering readers a powerful and introspective journey. This work is a testament to the enduring power of the heart and its capacity to navigate both joy and sorrow.

title: Ցուգցվանգ
author: Խառատյան Ներսես
description: This compelling Armenian novel explores the intricate dance between fate and free will, set against a backdrop of historical events and personal struggles. The narrative weaves together the lives of several characters, each facing their own challenges and making choices that ripple through time. It's a story of resilience, sacrifice, and the enduring human spirit in the face of adversity. Readers will be captivated by the rich cultural details and the profound questions the book raises about destiny and the power of individual agency.

title: Անանուն։ Պիես։ Արարողություն տասնվեց գործողությամբ
author: Ղազարյան Ալվինա
description: Dive into the enigmatic world of 'Anonymous: Ten Works of Art,' a captivating collection that explores the profound impact of art created without a known author. This book delves into the stories, theories, and cultural significance behind ten masterpieces whose creators remain a mystery. From ancient artifacts to modern marvels, each piece is meticulously examined, inviting readers to ponder the nature of artistic legacy, the power of anonymity, and the timeless beauty that transcends individual recognition. A must-read for art enthusiasts and those fascinated by the untold narratives of history.

title: Վիլ-Էվրար (Մարկ Արենի պատմությունը)
author: Մարկ Արեն
description: Dive into the enigmatic world of 'Vil-Evrar,' a captivating narrative that unravels the complex life and experiences of Mark Aren. This book is more than just a biography; it's a deep exploration of the forces that shape an individual, the choices made, and the legacy left behind. Through a series of compelling events and introspective moments, readers will gain insight into Aren's motivations, struggles, and triumphs. 'Vil-Evrar' offers a rich tapestry of human emotion, ambition, and the relentless pursuit of purpose, inviting readers to ponder the intricate dance between destiny and free will in one man's extraordinary journey.

title: Առաջնորդ առանց պաշտոնի
author: Շարմա Ռոբին
description: This insightful book challenges conventional notions of leadership, arguing that true influence and impact don't require a formal title or position. It explores the principles and practices that enable anyone, regardless of their role, to become a powerful and effective leader within their organization and life. Through compelling anecdotes and practical advice, the author demonstrates how to cultivate a leader's mindset, inspire others, drive innovation, and achieve extraordinary results by taking initiative and demonstrating ownership. It's a transformative read for anyone aspiring to make a significant difference and unlock their full leadership potential.

title: Բարի Գործերի քաղաքը
author: Մարկ Արեն
description: Step into 'The City of Good Deeds,' a heartwarming and inspiring tale that celebrates the profound impact of kindness and altruism. In a bustling metropolis where individual acts of generosity often go unnoticed, this book illuminates the interconnectedness of lives through a series of seemingly small, yet significant, good deeds. It's a charming narrative that reminds us that even the simplest gestures can create ripples of positive change, fostering hope and building a stronger, more compassionate community. A delightful read for anyone seeking a story that uplifts the spirit.

author: Mark Aren
description: Գիրքը Մարկ Արենի (Կարեն Մարգարյան) հայերեն թարգմանված յոթերորդ գիրքն է։ Նրանում հեղինակը պատկերում է Վլադիմիր Իշխանի օրոք Կիևյան Ռուսիայում քրիստոնեության ընդունումը։ Իշխանը, ամուսնանալով բյուզանդական հայազգի կայսրեր Բարսեղ 2-րդ և Կոնստանտին 8-րդի քրոջ՝ Աննայի հետ, քրիստոնեություն է ընդունում։ Վեպի համար հիմք են ծառայել իրական պատմական իրադարձությունները։ Գրքի սյուժեն շատ հետաքրքիր է իր դրամատիկ զարգացումներով և կարդացվում է մեկ շնչով։

title: Պայթյուններ Թուրքիայում և․․․ ոչ միայն
author: Վարդանյան Կարո
description: Embark on a lyrical journey with 'Poems in Turkey and... Not Only,' a poignant collection that transcends geographical and cultural boundaries. This anthology brings together a diverse array of poetic voices, exploring themes of identity, displacement, love, and resilience. While rooted in the experiences of Turkey, the poems resonate universally, offering profound insights into the human condition. Each verse is a window into a soul, a testament to the enduring power of words to connect, heal, and inspire across different landscapes and histories. A compelling read for lovers of poetry and those seeking a deeper understanding of shared human experiences.

title: Շերլոք Հոլմսի նոր արկածները
author: Մարկ Արեն
description: Embark on a thrilling journey with the world's most famous consulting detective in 'The New Adventures of Sherlock Holmes.' This collection of captivating tales brings fresh mysteries and cunning challenges to Holmes and his loyal companion, Dr. Watson. From the foggy streets of London to the darkest corners of the human psyche, each story is a masterclass in deduction, suspense, and intricate plotting. Fans of classic detective fiction will delight in these ingenious cases, as Holmes's unparalleled intellect and keen observation skills are put to the ultimate test, proving that even the most perplexing puzzles are no match for his brilliant mind.

title: Եվ արձագանքեցին լեռները
author: Հոսեյնի Խալեդ
description: This novel by Khaled Hosseini weaves a multi-generational tale of love, sacrifice, and betrayal, beginning in a small Afghan village in 1952. The story centers on the heartbreaking decision of a poor father to sell his young daughter, Pari, to a wealthy couple in Kabul, separating her from her beloved brother, Abdullah. The narrative then expands across decades and continents, following the interconnected lives of various characters whose fates are shaped by this initial act. Through their interwoven stories, Hosseini explores the profound impact of family bonds, the complexities of identity, and the enduring echoes of past choices, creating a deeply emotional and expansive human drama.

title: Ֆարենհայթ 451
author: Բրեդբերի Ռեյ
description: In a dystopian future where books are outlawed and firemen burn any they find, Guy Montag is a fireman who begins to question his role in society. Ray Bradbury's chilling masterpiece, 'Fahrenheit 451,' paints a vivid picture of a world consumed by superficiality and controlled by censorship. As Montag secretly hoards books and seeks knowledge, he embarks on a dangerous journey of self-discovery and rebellion against the oppressive regime. This powerful novel serves as a stark warning about the dangers of intellectual suppression and the importance of critical thought, urging readers to cherish the freedom to read and think for themselves.

title: Հարրի Փոթերը և Գաղտնիքների սենյակը
description: In the second installment of the Harry Potter series, Harry returns to Hogwarts for his second year, only to find himself embroiled in a new mystery. Strange and terrifying events begin to plague the school: students are being petrified, and a cryptic message written in blood warns that the Chamber of Secrets has been opened. Harry, Ron, and Hermione embark on a dangerous quest to uncover the truth behind the attacks, facing giant spiders, ancient prophecies, and a sinister diary that holds the key to Hogwarts' darkest secret. This thrilling adventure delves deeper into the magical world, exploring themes of prejudice, courage, and the enduring power of friendship.

title: Չքնաղ նոր աշխարհ
author: Հաքսլի Օլդոս
description: Embark on a profound journey with 'Չքնաղ նոր աշխարհ' (A New World Unseen), a thought-provoking exploration of uncharted territories, both external and internal. This book challenges conventional perceptions, inviting readers to question the familiar and embrace the unknown. Through vivid narratives and philosophical insights, it paints a picture of a world beyond our immediate grasp, urging us to look deeper, to listen more intently, and to discover the hidden wonders that lie just beneath the surface of everyday life. A compelling read for those seeking intellectual stimulation and a fresh perspective on existence.

title: Ագնես
description: Delve into the poignant and powerful narrative of 'Agnes,' a compelling Armenian novel that explores themes of love, loss, and resilience against the backdrop of historical upheaval. This deeply moving story centers on the life of Agnes, a woman whose strength and spirit are tested by the trials of her time. As she navigates personal tragedies and societal changes, Agnes embodies the enduring human capacity for hope and survival. 'Agnes' is a beautifully crafted work that offers a profound insight into the human condition, resonating with readers who appreciate rich character development and emotionally charged storytelling.

title: Այսպիսին է Վան Գոգը
author: Ռոդըմ Ջորջ
description: An immersive and insightful exploration into the life and art of one of history's most iconic painters, Vincent van Gogh. This book goes beyond the well-known anecdotes, delving into his letters, his struggles, and the profound passion that fueled his revolutionary work. Readers will gain a deeper understanding of the man behind the masterpieces, the emotional landscapes he painted, and the enduring legacy of his unique vision. A must-read for art enthusiasts and anyone fascinated by the creative spirit.

title: Բալզակ.Մի շան պատմություն
author: Լևոն Նես
description: This captivating narrative offers a unique glimpse into the life and mind of the legendary French novelist Honoré de Balzac. More than a mere biography, it's a deeply personal exploration of his creative process, his struggles, and the inspirations behind his monumental works. Readers will be drawn into the world of 19th-century Paris, witnessing the triumphs and tribulations of a literary giant as he grapples with ambition, love, and the relentless pursuit of artistic excellence. A must-read for admirers of Balzac and anyone fascinated by the lives of great writers.

title: Ոչ մի շաբաթ առանց Թումանյանի (փափուկ)
description: Dive into the timeless wisdom and enchanting tales of Hovhannes Toumanian with this abridged collection, 'Not a Week Without Toumanian.' This volume offers a delightful introduction to the beloved Armenian author's most cherished works, perfect for both new readers and long-time admirers. From captivating fables to insightful poems, Toumanian's narratives are rich with cultural heritage, moral lessons, and a profound understanding of the human condition. Experience the magic of Armenian storytelling in a concise and accessible format that promises to entertain and enlighten.

title: Վերք Հայաստանի (Զանգակ)
author: Աբովյան Խաչատուր
description: This title likely refers to a historical or cultural work focusing on 'Upper Armenia,' possibly a specific region or a broader historical concept, published by Zangak. Such a book would delve into the rich history, geography, and cultural heritage of this significant part of the Armenian world. It could explore ancient kingdoms, medieval principalities, or the lives of its people through various historical periods. Readers interested in Armenian history, regional studies, or cultural anthropology would find this work invaluable, offering detailed insights and potentially rare perspectives on a crucial aspect of Armenian identity and legacy.

title: Ոչ մի շաբաթ առանց Մաթևոսյանի (կոշտ)
author: Մաթևոսյան Հրանտ
description: Dive into the masterful storytelling of Hrant Mathevossian with this collection of short stories. Known for his unique narrative style and profound insights into the human condition, Mathevossian transports readers to the heart of Armenian village life, exploring themes of identity, tradition, change, and the intricate relationships between people and their land. Each story is a meticulously crafted gem, offering a glimpse into the souls of his characters and the rich tapestry of Armenian culture. Prepare for a deeply moving and thought-provoking literary journey.

title: Միջակայքում։ Վիպակ
author: Մեհրաբյան Լուսյա
description: Vbipak's 'In the Middle' is a compelling exploration of liminal spaces, both physical and metaphorical. The novel delves into the experiences of characters caught between worlds, cultures, or stages of life, grappling with questions of identity, belonging, and purpose. It's a nuanced portrayal of the human condition, highlighting the complexities of navigating uncertainty and the search for meaning in transitional periods. The narrative invites readers to reflect on their own 'middle' moments, offering a deeply introspective and relatable journey. This book is a must-read for those who appreciate literary fiction that probes the depths of human experience and the intricate dance of self-discovery.

title: Աղաների դարը և հետոն
author: Հովհաննիսյան Ալիս
description: This profound work offers a sweeping examination of a period marked by immense suffering and the subsequent journey towards healing and reconstruction. 'The Age of Agony and Beyond' delves into the historical, social, and psychological impacts of a tumultuous era, exploring how individuals and communities navigated profound challenges. It's a narrative of endurance, resilience, and the human spirit's capacity to overcome adversity. The book provides a critical analysis of the past while also looking forward, offering insights into the processes of recovery and the lessons learned from hardship. A vital read for anyone seeking to understand the cycles of history and the enduring quest for peace.

title: Բացակա պատմվածքը։ Պատմվածքների ժողովածու
author: Տեր-Գուլանյան Մարիամ
description: Dive into a captivating anthology of short stories that explore the depths of human experience. From poignant tales of love and loss to thrilling adventures and insightful reflections on society, 'The Open Book' offers a diverse literary journey. Each narrative is a window into a unique world, inviting readers to ponder life's complexities and the myriad emotions that shape our existence. This collection is a testament to the power of storytelling, promising to entertain, provoke thought, and leave a lasting impression.

title: Նայիր աչքերիս (փափուկ)
author: Վերմիշյան Հերմինե
description: In 'Her Eyes,' a captivating novella, the author masterfully crafts a tale of profound human connection and the unspoken stories held within a gaze. The narrative centers on the enigmatic power of a woman's eyes, which seem to hold the weight of history, love, and sorrow. As the protagonist attempts to unravel the mysteries behind her captivating stare, he embarks on a journey of self-discovery and emotional revelation. This beautifully written story delves into the depths of perception, memory, and the silent language that binds us, leaving readers with a lasting impression of beauty and introspection.

title: Գուներանգ
author: Ավետիսյան Արայիկ
description: Gunarang, meaning 'Color Palette,' is a vibrant collection of poems by the renowned Armenian poet Hovhannes Tumanyan. This anthology showcases Tumanyan's mastery of language and his deep connection to Armenian culture and nature. Readers will find themselves immersed in lyrical verses that paint vivid pictures of rural life, childhood innocence, and the enduring spirit of the Armenian people. From heartwarming tales to poignant reflections, Gunarang offers a rich tapestry of emotions and insights, making it a timeless classic for all who appreciate the beauty of poetry and the soul of Armenia.

title: Գրավաճառը
author: Խաչիկյան Էդուարդ
description: 'Գրավաճառը' (The Bookseller) is a captivating tale that transports readers into the enchanting world of books and the lives intertwined with them. This story likely follows a bookseller, perhaps an eccentric or wise figure, whose shop becomes a sanctuary for stories and a hub for human connection. It explores the magic of literature, the power of narratives to shape lives, and the quiet dramas that unfold within the walls of a beloved bookstore. Expect a heartwarming and thought-provoking journey into the heart of reading and community.

title: Արևմտյան ճակատում նորություն չկա
author: Ռեմարկ Էրիխ Մարիա
description: Embark on a thought-provoking journey with 'No New Thing in the East,' a profound Armenian philosophical work that delves into the cyclical nature of history, human experience, and the timeless pursuit of meaning. This insightful book challenges readers to reconsider their perceptions of progress and change, suggesting that fundamental truths and patterns persist across generations. Through eloquent prose and deep contemplation, the author explores the enduring questions of existence, society, and the individual's place within the grand tapestry of time. A must-read for those who seek intellectual stimulation and a fresh perspective on ancient wisdom.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: Francis Scott Fitzgerald
description: Գրքի առաջին հրատարակությունը (Scribners) 1925 թվականի ապրիլին էր: Չնայած սկզբնական անհաջողություններին, գիրքը մեծ ճանաչում ստացավ Երկրորդ համաշխարհային պատերազմի տարիներին և դարձավ ամերիկյան դպրոցների ուսումնական ծրագրի մի մասը։ Այսօր «Մեծն Գեթսբին» համարվում է դասական գրականության գլուխգործոցներից մեկը և ունի «Ամերիկյան մեծագույն վեպ» կոչումը։

title: Ապրելու ապրիլ
author: Սիմոնյան Էմմա
description: This poignant novel delves into the lives of ordinary people navigating the complexities of love, loss, and societal expectations in a small Armenian town. Through vivid characterizations and evocative prose, the author paints a compelling picture of human resilience and the enduring power of hope amidst adversity. It's a story that resonates with universal themes, exploring the delicate balance between tradition and modernity, and the search for personal freedom in a world often bound by convention. A deeply moving and thought-provoking read that will stay with you long after the final page.

title: The Picture Of Dorian Gray
author: Oscar Wilde
description: The Picture of Dorian Gray is a Gothic and philosophical novel by Oscar Wilde, first published complete in the July 1890 issue of Lippincott’s Monthly Magazine. Fearing the story was indecent, the magazine’s editor deleted roughly five hundred words before publication without Wilde’s knowledge. Despite that censorship, The Picture of Dorian Gray offended the moral sensibilities of British book reviewers, some of whom said that Oscar Wilde merited prosecution for violating the laws guarding public morality. In response, Wilde aggressively defended his novel and art in correspondence with the British press, although he personally made excisions of some of the most controversial material when revising and lengthening the story for book publication the following year.

title: Sister Carry
author: Theodore Dreiser
description:
When a girl leaves her home at eighteen, she does one of two things. Either she falls into saving hands and becomes better, or she rapidly assumes the cosmopolitan standard of virtue and becomes worse. Sister Carrie tells the story of a rudderless but pretty small town girl who comes to the big city filled with vague ambitions. She is used by men and uses them in turn to become a successful Broadway actress, while George Hurstwood, the married man who has run away with her, loses his grip on life and descends into beggary and suicide.

Sister Carrie was the first masterpiece of American naturalism in its grittily factual presentation of the vagaries of urban life and in its ingenuous heroine, who goes unpunished for her transgressions against conventional view of humanity, a memorable cast of characters, and a compelling narrative line. The emotional disintegration of Hurstwood is a much-praised triumph of psychological analysis.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description:
Pride and Prejudice is an 1813 romantic novel by Jane Austen. It charts the emotional development of protagonist Elizabeth Bennet, who learns the error of making hasty judgments and comes to appreciate the difference between the superficial and the essential. The comedy of the writing lies in the depiction of manners, education, marriage, and money during the British Regency period.

​Pride and Prejudice has long fascinated readers, consistently appearing near the top of lists of “most-loved books” among both literary scholars and the general public. It has become one of the most popular novels in English literature, with over 20 million copies sold, and paved the way for many archetypes that abound in modern literature.

title: Երեք հրացանակիրներ
author: Դյումա Ալեքսանդր
