description: Delve into the poignant narratives of 'Erek Hratsanakirner' (Three Riflemen), a collection of stories that explore the lives and experiences of individuals caught in the throes of conflict and change. This book offers a raw and honest look at courage, sacrifice, and the enduring human spirit in challenging times. Each story is meticulously crafted, drawing readers into the emotional landscapes of its characters and shedding light on the profound impact of historical events on personal destinies. A compelling read for those who appreciate historical fiction and powerful human dramas.

title: Jane Eyre
author: Emily Bronte
description:
Անգլիացի գրող Շառլոթ Բրոնթեի «Ջեյն Էյր» նովելն առաջին անգամ հրատարակվել է Քարեր Բելլ գրչանվամբ 1847թ. հոկտեմբերի 16-ին: Ջեյն Էյրը չունի ո՛չ արտակարգ գեղեցկություն, ո՛չ դյութիչ հմայք, ինչի միջոցով իր գեղարվեստական նախորդները ճանապարհ էին հարթում աշխարհում: Փոխարենը, Ջեյնն ապավինում է ջանասիրության և խոհեմության իր առաքինություններին` իրեն դրսևորելով որպես արժանապատիվ և կյանքով լեցուն անհատականություն:

«Ջեյն Էյր»-ի ակնթարթային և տևական հաջողությունը ապացուցեց, որ Բրոնթեի բնազդները ճիշտ էին: Իր ժամանակաշրջանի և հետագա տարիների ընթերցողները իրենց սրտերից ներս ընդունեցին աղքատացած որբ աղջկան` հետևելով նրա ընթացքին՝ անգութ հարազատների խնամակալությունից մինչև դաժանաբարո գիշերօթիկ դպրոց և դաստիարակչուհու դժվարին աշխատանք: Ջեյնի առաջին հանձնարարությունը Թորնֆիլդում, որի հպարտ և հեգնական տերը թաքցնում է մի անպատվաբեր գաղտնիք, գրավում է ընթերցողներին՝ բացահայտելու մարդկային սրտի առեղծվածները:

title: Frankenstein or the Modern Prometheus
author: Mary Shelley
description: Frankenstein or The Modern Prometheus is a novel written by Mary Shelly that tells the story of Victor Frankenstein, a young scientist who creates a hideous, sapient creature in an unorthodox scientific experiment. Shelley started writing the story when she was 18, and the first edition of the novel was published anonymously in London on 1 January 1818, when she was 20. Her name first appeared on the second edition, published in 1823. Frankenstein is infused with elements of the Gothic novel and the Romantic Movement. At the same time, it is an early example of science fiction. It has had a considerable influence in literature and popular culture and spawned a complete genre of horror stories, films and plays. Since the novel’s publication, the name “Frankenstein” has often been used to refer to the monster itself.

title: A Tale of Hayara: Rise of the Phoenix
author: Tamar Isajanyan
description: We are all pawns in the games the gods play' A forsaken prince. A golden era. An infernal fate. The first in a trilogy that tells the tale of a noble family in a reimagined Bronze Age Armenia, 'Rise of the Phoenix' sets the stage for a grand finale!When a prophecy brings a priestess to his humble home, Arme must abandon his tranquil existence to become the nation’s only hope, a celestial warrior tasked with protecting an unborn child carrying an even heavier burden than he.Whispers of invaders threaten the safety of all, testing the bonds of love and the limits of honor, bringing forth the long-forgotten might of the heavens back into the world of mortals. As the flames incinerate all in their path, divided nations and broken families must band together to save the innocent and rise from the ashes of war.

title: Հոբելյանական ընտրանի
author: Թումանյան Հ.
description: No official English translation

title: English classics. Alice's Adventures in Wonderland and Through the Looking Glass
author: Lewis Carroll
description:
«Ալիսի արկածները հրաշքների աշխարհում և հայելու աշխարհում» (հայտնի է կրճատ՝ «Ալիսը հրաշքների աշխարհում» վերնագրով) Լուիս Քերոլի հայտնի վեպն է, որն առաջին անգամ լույս է տեսել 1865թ.: Այն Ալիս անունով մի աղջկա մասին է, որը ճագարի բնի փոսից ընկնում է մի երևակայական աշխարհ՝ բնակեցված արտասովոր, մարդակերպ արարածներով: Պատմությունը լի է տրամաբանական խաղերով. հետաքրքիր է և՛ մեծահասակների, և՛ երեխաների համար:

«Ալիսը հրաշքների աշխարհում» վեպը համարվում է գրական անհեթեթության ժանրի լավագույն օրինակներից: Այն մեծ ազդեցություն է ունեցել ժողովրդական մշակույթի, գրականության և հատկապես ֆենտեզի ժանրի վրա:

title: English classics. Robinson Crusoe
author: Daniel Defoe
description:
Գրքում ներկայացվում է գլխավոր կերպարի (ծննդյան անունն է Ռոբինզոն Քրեցներ) ինքնակենսագրականը՝ մի նավաբեկյալի, որը 28 տարի անցկացնում է Տրինիդադին մոտ գտնվող մի հեռավոր արևադարձային անմարդաբնակ կղզում: Նախքան վերջնականապես փրկվելը` այստեղ նա հանդիպում է մարդակերների, գերիների, խռովարար նավաստիների:

Ամենայն հավանականությամբ, «Ռոբինզոն Կրուզոն» գրելիս Դեֆոն մասամբ հիմնվել է Ալեքսանդր Սելքըրքի իրական կյանքի պատմության վրա: Ալեքսանդր Սելքըրքը շոտլանդացի նավաստի էր, որին, նավապետի հետ ծագած վեճի պատճառով, 1704թ. իր իսկ պահանջով իջեցնում են Խաղաղ օվկիանոսի ափին գտնվող «Մաս-ա-Տիերա» անվամբ անմարդաբնակ կղզի, որտեղ նա մնում է մինչև 1709թ.: 1966թ. այս կղզին, որն այժմ Չիլիի մասն է կազմում, վերանվանվեց «Ռոբինզոն Կրուզո» կղզի: Սակայն Դեֆոն իր վեպը Սելքըրքի պատմությունից անդին է տանում՝ միաձուլելով պուրիտանական հոգևոր ինքնակենսագրականի ավանդույթները և մարդկանց բնույթի ուսումնասիրությունը՝ որպես սոցիալական էակներ:

title: English classics. Treasure Island
author: Robert Louis Stevenson
description:
«Գանձերի կղզին» Ռոբերտ Լուիս Սթիվենսոնի արկածային վեպն է, որը պատմում է ծովահենների և անմարդաբնակ կղզում թաքցված գանձերի մասին: Վեպն ահռելի ազդեցություն է թողել ժողովրդական ընկալման վրա՝ կապված այն ամենի հետ, ինչ վերաբերում է ծովահեններին, «X» նշանով գանձերի քարտեզներին, առագաստանավերին, «Սև նշան»-ին, արևադարձային կղզիներին և թութակն ուսին միոտանի նավաստիներին:
«Գանձերի կղզին» պատմություն է, որտեղ ականատես ենք լինում գլխավոր հերոսի հասունացմանը: Այն նշանակալի է իր միջավայրով, կերպարներով և արկածալի իրադարձություններով: Երբևէ ամենից շատ բերմադրված և էկրանավորված վեպերից է: Առաջին անգամ հրատարակվել է 1883 թ., նոյեմբերի 14-ին:

title: English classics. The Prince and the Pauper
author: Mark Twain
description:
«Արքայազնը և աղքատը» Մարկ Տվենի հանրահայտ վեպն է, որն առաջին անգամ լույս է տեսել 1881թ. Կանադայում և ապա 1882թ.՝ ԱՄՆ-ում: Հեղինակի առաջին փորձն է պատմական գեղարվեստական գրականության ժանրում: Դեպքերը տեղի են ունենում 1537թ. Լոնդոնում՝ երկու պատանիների շուրջ, որոնք ունեն միանման արտաքին տեսք: Մեկի անունը Թոմ Քենթի է, որը աղքատ ընտանիքից է և ունի բռնարար հայր, մյուսը արքայազն Էդվարդն է՝ Հենրիխ VIII-ի որդին:

Վերադառնալով եվրոպական երկրորդ շրջագայությունից՝ Տվենը ուսումնասիրում է Անգլիայի և Ֆրանսիայի պատմությունը: Նա ի սկզբանե մտադրվել էր այս պատմության վերաբերյալ պիես գրել, որի ժամանակաշրջանը կլիներ Վիկտորիանական Անգլիան, սակայն այնուհետև որոշեց այն տեղափոխել ավելի հին ժամանակաշրջան:

Տվենը գիրքը նվիրել է իր դուստրերին՝ Սյուզիին և Կլարային:

title: Սա է իմ ընտրությունը
author: Իսահակյան Ավիկ
description: In a world where every decision shapes destiny, 'This is My Choice' delves into the intricate lives of individuals grappling with pivotal moments. From career crossroads to personal dilemmas, the narrative explores the profound impact of choices, both big and small. Readers will find themselves reflecting on their own paths as they follow characters navigating love, loss, ambition, and sacrifice. This compelling story is a testament to the power of free will and the courage it takes to forge one's own destiny, even when the future remains uncertain.

title: Ավերակներուն մեջ
author: Եսայան Զապել
description: A poignant and evocative novel by Vahan Totovents, 'In the Wilds' delves into the lives of Armenian villagers grappling with the harsh realities of nature and human existence. Set against the backdrop of rural Armenia, the story explores themes of survival, tradition, and the enduring spirit of a community facing adversity. Totovents masterfully crafts a narrative rich in cultural detail and emotional depth, offering readers a window into a world where resilience is paramount and the bonds of family and community are tested by the unforgiving wilderness. This timeless work is a testament to the human capacity for hope and perseverance.

title: Ռանչպարների կանչը
author: Դաշտենց Խաչիկ
description: Jack London's enduring classic, 'The Call of the Wild,' plunges readers into the brutal yet exhilarating world of the Yukon Gold Rush through the eyes of Buck, a magnificent St. Bernard-Scotch Shepherd mix. Stolen from his comfortable life in California, Buck is thrust into the harsh realities of a sled dog's existence, where he must adapt to the law of club and fang. As he navigates treacherous trails and fierce rivalries, Buck's primal instincts awaken, drawing him closer to the wild. This gripping adventure explores themes of survival, instinct versus civilization, and the profound connection between humans and animals, leaving an indelible mark on the reader's imagination.

title: Խենթը
author: Րաֆֆի
description: A powerful and unsettling psychological drama by the renowned Armenian writer Aksel Bakunts. This novella delves into the mind of a man grappling with his sanity, exploring themes of isolation, societal pressure, and the fragile line between genius and madness. Set against a vivid backdrop of rural Armenian life, the story masterfully portrays the internal turmoil of its protagonist, leaving readers to ponder the true nature of reality and perception. A poignant and thought-provoking work that remains a cornerstone of Armenian literature.

title: Ուխտագնացություն արևելք
author: Հեսսե Հ.
description: This historical work delves into the complex geopolitical issues surrounding the decline of the Ottoman Empire in the 19th and early 20th centuries, often referred to as 'The Eastern Question.' It examines the competing interests of European powers, the struggles of various ethnic and religious groups within the empire, and the diplomatic maneuvers that shaped the region. The book provides a detailed analysis of the political, economic, and social factors that contributed to the instability and eventual dissolution of the Ottoman state, offering insights into a pivotal period of global history and its lasting impact on the modern Middle East and Eastern Europe.

title: Տասներկուերորդ գիշեր կամ ինչ որ կամենաք
author: Շեքսպիր Ուիլյամ
description: This Armenian collection of short stories delves into the complexities of human relationships, societal norms, and the often-unseen struggles of everyday life. Through a series of poignant narratives, the author explores themes of love, loss, hope, and disillusionment, offering a mirror to the human condition. Each story is a window into a different world, populated by characters grappling with their destinies and the choices they make. A thought-provoking read that resonates with universal truths.

title: Անասնաֆերմա (նկարազարդումներով)
author: Օրուել Ջորջ
description: Experience the satirical brilliance of 'Anasnaferma' (Animal Farm), George Orwell's timeless allegory, presented here with captivating illustrations. This powerful novella critiques totalitarianism through the story of farm animals who overthrow their human owner, only to fall under the oppressive rule of a pig named Napoleon. The illustrations bring a new dimension to the classic narrative, enhancing its stark portrayal of corruption, propaganda, and the abuse of power. A crucial read for understanding political dynamics and the dangers of unchecked authority, made even more accessible and impactful with its visual storytelling.

title: Ցատկախաղ. Վեպ
author: Կորտասար Խ.
description: Unleash your inner grandmaster with 'Chess. Trap,' a meticulously designed guide for chess enthusiasts looking to elevate their game. This book delves deep into the art of trapping opponents, offering a comprehensive collection of tactical maneuvers, strategic insights, and cunning pitfalls that can turn the tide of any match. From classic traps to modern innovations, each example is thoroughly analyzed, providing clear explanations and practical applications. Whether you're a beginner eager to learn the ropes or an experienced player seeking to refine your arsenal, 'Chess. Trap' is your essential companion for mastering the psychological warfare of chess.

title: Տիեզերական սագա
author: Կարապետյան Արմեն
description: A profound philosophical exploration, this book delves into the intricate tapestry of human thought and existence. Through a series of insightful essays and reflections, the author challenges conventional wisdom, inviting readers to question their assumptions and embrace new perspectives. It's a journey into the mind, examining the nature of consciousness, morality, and the search for meaning in an ever-changing world. This work is a stimulating read for anyone seeking to deepen their understanding of themselves and the complex universe we inhabit.

title: Հավերժական վերադարձ
author: Գրիգորյան Վ.
description: A philosophical journey into the cyclical nature of existence, 'The Eternal Return' challenges readers to confront the profound implications of living the same life, over and over again. Through the eyes of a protagonist haunted by a recurring dream, the novel explores themes of fate, free will, and the search for meaning in an endlessly repeating universe. As the character grapples with the weight of this cosmic truth, they must decide whether to embrace the repetition or strive for a different path. This thought-provoking work invites deep introspection, urging us to consider the choices we make and the legacy we leave behind.

title: Լիճը և ուրիշ պատմվածքներ
author: Բրեդբերի Ռ.
description: This collection of short stories delves into the intricate tapestry of human experience, exploring themes of love, loss, hope, and despair. Each narrative offers a unique glimpse into the lives of diverse characters, from the mundane struggles of everyday existence to extraordinary encounters that challenge perceptions. With poignant prose and insightful observations, the author crafts a world where emotions run deep and the unexpected lurks around every corner. Prepare to be moved, entertained, and provoked as you journey through these compelling tales that resonate with the universal truths of the human heart.

title: ՄԱՀԱՐԻական
description: A powerful and evocative novel, this work plunges into the depths of a society grappling with profound change and personal struggle. Through the eyes of its compelling characters, readers witness the clash between tradition and modernity, the enduring strength of the human spirit, and the often-harsh realities of life. The narrative weaves a rich tapestry of cultural detail and emotional intensity, painting a vivid picture of a world in flux and the individuals striving to find their place within it. It's a story of survival, identity, and the relentless pursuit of hope.

title: Դար կորստյան
author: Գրիգորյան Վարդան
description: In 'The Lost Year,' a gripping historical fiction, readers are transported to a pivotal period shrouded in mystery and forgotten truths. The story follows a determined historian who uncovers a hidden diary, revealing the untold experiences of individuals during a tumultuous year that history books have largely overlooked. As the past slowly unravels, secrets, betrayals, and acts of extraordinary courage come to light, challenging conventional narratives and forcing a re-evaluation of what truly transpired. This meticulously researched and emotionally resonant novel offers a powerful glimpse into a forgotten era, reminding us of the importance of every voice in shaping our understanding of history.

title: Ես, Մուսան և անդունդը
author: Իսրայելյան Վրեժ
description: This enchanting Armenian children's book follows the adventures of Yes, a curious and kind-hearted child, and their loyal companion, Mousan, a wise and playful creature of the forest. Together, they explore the wonders of nature, encounter fascinating animals, and learn valuable lessons about friendship, courage, and respecting the environment. Through vibrant storytelling and heartwarming illustrations, the book encourages young readers to embrace their imagination and discover the magic that lies within the natural world around them. A delightful read for children and parents alike.

title: Կույսի համաստեղություն (բանաստեղծություններ)
author: Սևադա Սամվել
description: This collection of plays, 'The Symphony of Light,' explores the intricate dance between illumination and shadow, hope and despair, within the human experience. Each dramatic work delves into profound philosophical questions, presenting characters grappling with their inner demons, societal pressures, and the search for meaning in a complex world. Through vivid dialogue and compelling narratives, the plays invite audiences to reflect on the nature of perception, the power of truth, and the transformative potential of understanding. It's a thought-provoking journey into the depths of the human psyche, illuminated by the enduring quest for enlightenment.

title: Ագաթանգեղագիտական պրպտումներ
author: Տեր-Պետրոսյան Լ.
description: Embark on a profound intellectual journey with 'Philosophical Meditations,' a collection of insightful reflections on existence, consciousness, and the human condition. This book delves into complex philosophical concepts with clarity and depth, inviting readers to ponder life's fundamental questions. From the nature of reality to the pursuit of happiness, each meditation offers a unique perspective, encouraging critical thinking and self-discovery. Ideal for those seeking intellectual stimulation and a deeper understanding of themselves and the world around them, this work promises to be a thought-provoking and enriching experience.

title: Խենթը
author: Րաֆֆի
description: A powerful and unsettling psychological drama by the renowned Armenian writer Aksel Bakunts. This novella delves into the mind of a man grappling with his sanity, exploring themes of isolation, societal pressure, and the fragile line between genius and madness. Set against a vivid backdrop of rural Armenian life, the story masterfully portrays the internal turmoil of its protagonist, leaving readers to ponder the true nature of reality and perception. A poignant and thought-provoking work that remains a cornerstone of Armenian literature.

title: Ֆաուստ
author: Գյոթե Յոհան Վոլֆգանգ
description: Goethe's monumental tragedy, 'Faust,' delves into the profound philosophical and moral dilemmas of humanity. The brilliant scholar Faust, disillusioned with the limits of knowledge, makes a pact with the demon Mephistopheles, trading his soul for boundless experience and earthly pleasures. This epic poem explores themes of good versus evil, redemption, the pursuit of knowledge, and the eternal struggle between spiritual aspiration and carnal desire. A timeless masterpiece, 'Faust' remains a cornerstone of Western literature, challenging readers to contemplate the very essence of existence and the price of ambition.

title: Շունչ արտաշունչ
author: Կաաս Գևորգ
description: A timeless fable exploring the fundamental differences and surprising similarities between two iconic creatures, 'The Dog and the Wolf' delves into themes of freedom, security, and the choices that define our lives. Through the contrasting experiences of a domesticated dog and a wild wolf, this story offers profound insights into human nature and societal structures. It's a thought-provoking narrative that encourages readers of all ages to reflect on their own values and the paths they choose, reminding us that true happiness often lies in understanding and embracing our authentic selves.

title: Անոն
author: Սարգսյան Անուշ
description: In a dystopian future where privacy is a relic of the past, 'Anon' plunges readers into a world under constant surveillance. Identity is fluid, and anonymity is the ultimate rebellion. The story follows a protagonist who dares to exist outside the system, navigating a treacherous landscape where every move is tracked, and every thought potentially exposed. As they fight to reclaim their individuality, they uncover a dark conspiracy that threatens to erase the very essence of humanity. This gripping thriller is a chilling exploration of technology, freedom, and the enduring human spirit in the face of overwhelming control.

title: Սամվել
author: Րաֆֆի
description: Hovhannes Tumanyan's 'Samuel' is a timeless Armenian epic poem that transports readers to a bygone era of heroism, betrayal, and the struggle for national identity. Set against a backdrop of ancient Armenian history, the narrative follows the valiant Prince Samuel as he navigates political intrigue, personal sacrifice, and the complexities of love and loyalty. Tumanyan's masterful storytelling and poetic language bring to life a world of legendary figures and dramatic events, making 'Samuel' a cornerstone of Armenian literature and a compelling read for anyone interested in historical epics and cultural heritage.

title: Երկար։ Բանաստեղծություններ
author: Եր Կար
description: Dive into 'Long Stories,' a captivating anthology that celebrates the art of extended narrative. This collection features a diverse range of tales, each meticulously crafted to transport readers to different worlds and perspectives. From sprawling historical sagas to intricate psychological dramas, these stories delve deep into the human condition, exploring themes of resilience, transformation, and the complexities of fate. Perfect for those who love to lose themselves in rich, detailed narratives, 'Long Stories' offers a profound and immersive reading experience that will linger long after the final page is turned, showcasing the enduring power of storytelling.

title: Հոգեգրություն․ Եվրոպական մոդեռնիզմի բանաստեղծությունը
description: This insightful work, 'Spirituality: The Genesis of European Modernism,' offers a profound exploration of the spiritual undercurrents that shaped the European modernist movement. It argues that far from being purely secular, modernism was deeply influenced by evolving spiritual ideas, mystical traditions, and a search for meaning in a rapidly changing world. The book examines how artists, writers, and thinkers grappled with questions of faith, transcendence, and the human condition, ultimately forging new forms of expression that redefined art and culture. It's an essential read for anyone interested in the complex interplay between spirituality and artistic innovation.

title: Վերք Հայաստանի, Ողբ հայրենասիրի
author: Աբովյան Խաչատուր
description: This evocative title hints at a deeply personal and patriotic exploration of a specific region of Armenia. Likely a blend of historical narrative, cultural reflection, and heartfelt homage, the book invites readers to discover the beauty, history, and spirit of Upper Armenia. It could delve into local traditions, significant landmarks, the lives of its people, and the emotional connection to the land. This work promises to be a moving tribute to a cherished homeland, offering insights into Armenian identity and the profound bond between people and place.

title: Երկերի լիակատար ժողովածու 15 հատորով. հ.15/2․ Նամակներ (1967-1969)
author: Մահարի Գուրգեն
description: This collection presents 15 selected works from the Armenian Writers' Union, specifically focusing on letters written between 1967 and 1969. It offers a unique glimpse into the intellectual and personal lives of prominent Armenian literary figures during a pivotal period. Readers will discover intimate correspondence, reflections on contemporary events, and insights into the creative processes of these writers. More than just historical documents, these letters provide a rich tapestry of human connection, artistic struggle, and the cultural landscape of Soviet Armenia, making it an invaluable resource for scholars and enthusiasts of Armenian literature.

title: Գողացված ձյունը
author: Զեյթունցի Պերճ
description: A poignant tale that explores themes of loss, memory, and the enduring power of hope. Set against a backdrop of historical upheaval, the story follows a character's journey to reclaim a cherished past and find meaning in a world forever changed. Through vivid imagery and heartfelt prose, 'The Lost Bird' delves into the human spirit's resilience, reminding us that even in the darkest times, the search for beauty and connection can lead to unexpected discoveries. This evocative narrative is a testament to the strength found in remembrance and the quiet courage of moving forward.

title: Մինան ստվերների շրջապատում
author: Ավումե Էդեմ
description: This Armenian novel delves into the intricate lives and relationships within a small community, exploring themes of love, loss, and the enduring human spirit. Set against a backdrop of changing times, the characters grapple with personal struggles and societal expectations, revealing the complexities of their inner worlds. The narrative weaves together individual stories, painting a vivid picture of resilience and the search for meaning amidst life's challenges. It's a poignant exploration of human connection and the subtle forces that shape our destinies.

title: Ինձ պիոններ չնվիրես
author: Նավասարդյան Գոհար
description: This compelling narrative explores the profound impact of unspoken words and unfulfilled desires. Set against a backdrop of personal and societal expectations, the story follows characters grappling with the consequences of their choices and the weight of their secrets. It's a poignant examination of human relationships, the complexities of communication, and the silent battles fought within. The author masterfully crafts a tale that is both intimate and universal, inviting readers to reflect on the power of expression and the hidden truths that shape our lives.

title: Շառլ Ազնավուր. Դարի երգիչը
author: Ազնավուր Շառլ
description: This captivating biography celebrates the extraordinary life and unparalleled career of Charles Aznavour, one of the 20th century's most iconic and beloved performers. From his humble beginnings to global superstardom, the book chronicles his journey as a singer, songwriter, actor, and humanitarian. It delves into the inspirations behind his timeless melodies, his profound impact on music and culture, and the personal struggles and triumphs that shaped his artistry. 'The Song of a Century' offers an intimate look at the man behind the legend, revealing the passion, resilience, and enduring charm that made Aznavour a true global phenomenon.

title: Անտիպ էջեր․ գիրք 1 (Շիրազ)
author: Շիրազ Հովհաննես
description: Embark on a thrilling journey through the vibrant and complex world of 'Antipages,' where reality blurs with the fantastical. This first book, 'Shiraz,' introduces readers to a captivating narrative filled with intrigue, mystery, and unforgettable characters. As secrets unravel and destinies intertwine, the protagonist finds themselves at the heart of a grand adventure that challenges their perceptions and pushes the boundaries of their understanding. Prepare to be immersed in a richly imagined universe that will leave you eagerly anticipating the next installment.

title: Վազող ամպերի հետքերով
author: Մարտիրոսյան Մանե
description: Step into the vibrant world of Martiros Saryan, one of Armenia's most celebrated painters, through this captivating collection. "With a Vase of Flowers" offers a glimpse into the artist's profound connection with nature, his masterful use of color, and his unique ability to infuse everyday objects with extraordinary life. This book is a visual feast, showcasing Saryan's iconic still lifes, landscapes, and portraits, each piece a testament to his innovative spirit and his enduring legacy in modern art. Discover the beauty and depth of Saryan's vision, a journey through color and form that will inspire and delight art lovers.

title: Հայերի հոգին
author: Մարգարյան Սամվել
description: This book delves into the enduring essence of the Armenian spirit, exploring the cultural, historical, and psychological factors that have shaped the Armenian identity. Through a rich tapestry of anecdotes, historical accounts, and philosophical reflections, it uncovers the resilience, creativity, and deep-rooted traditions that define the Armenian people. From ancient legends to modern challenges, 'Armenian Spirit' offers a profound insight into the collective soul of a nation, celebrating its unique heritage and the unwavering strength that has allowed it to persevere through centuries of adversity and triumph.

title: Գունավորիր ջրով․ Առակներ (Խնկո Ապեր)
description: Immerse yourself in the wisdom and charm of 'Colorful Drops - Parables,' a collection of insightful tales by Khinko Aper. These parables, rich in metaphor and moral lessons, offer profound reflections on life, human nature, and the world around us. Each 'drop' of wisdom is presented with simplicity and elegance, making complex ideas accessible and memorable. Perfect for readers of all ages, this book provides a gentle yet powerful guide to understanding universal truths and fostering personal growth. A timeless treasure of Armenian storytelling.

title: Մեծ վախը լեռներում
author: Ռամյու Շառլ Ֆերդինանդ
description: This poignant novel delves into the profound silence that envelops the Armenian mountains, a silence that holds both beauty and the echoes of history. Through the eyes of its characters, the book explores themes of memory, loss, and the enduring spirit of a people deeply connected to their land. It's a meditative journey into the heart of Armenia, where the landscape itself becomes a character, whispering tales of resilience and the quiet strength found in solitude. A powerful exploration of cultural identity and the weight of the past.

title: Անպարտելիները
author: Ֆոլքներ Ուիլյամ
description: Step into a world of extraordinary courage and unwavering determination with 'The Invincibles.' This gripping narrative chronicles the lives of individuals who defy all odds, facing insurmountable challenges with an unbreakable spirit. From epic battles against injustice to personal triumphs over adversity, each story is a testament to the resilience of the human spirit. Discover the secrets behind their indomitable will and the profound impact they leave on their communities and the world. 'The Invincibles' is an inspiring collection that celebrates heroism in its purest form, reminding us that true strength lies within.

title: Հովազաձորի գերիները
author: Անանյան Վախթանգ
description: Dive into the legendary world of 'The Heroes of Hovazadzor,' an epic Armenian tale of bravery, sacrifice, and the enduring spirit of a people. Set in the mystical valley of Hovazadzor, this story recounts the valiant deeds of its protectors against formidable foes. Filled with rich cultural details, ancient traditions, and unforgettable characters, it explores themes of loyalty, freedom, and the power of unity in the face of adversity. This captivating narrative is a testament to the strength of the human spirit and a celebration of Armenian heritage.

title: Quatrains
author: Hovhannes Tumanyan
description:
This small book presents Hovhannes Toumanian’s quatrains written during the last years of his life. In many ways they became the sum of the paths taken by the poet, condensing in a few lines the entire course of
human life, which has no beginning and no end. The book is intended for a wide audience.

title: Selected works
author: Hovhannes Tumanyan
description:
Hovhannes Toumanian “SELECTED WORKS”
The present collection contains a wide miscellany of Hovhannes Toumanian’s poetry and prose writings selected carefully and wisely. It brings together poems, quatrains, narrative poems, short stories, tales, legends, ballads and articles. The volume includes well-known translations as well as captivating up-to-date interpretations providing a perfect introduction to one of the foremost figures of Armenian literature of all times.

title: Երկերի լիակատար ժողովածու 10 հատորով, Հ4 Պոեմներ
author: Թումանյան Հովհաննես
description: This fourth volume in a series of selected works presents another captivating collection of 10 Armenian poems. Delve deeper into the rich poetic tradition of Armenia, discovering new voices and revisiting beloved classics. Each poem is a testament to the enduring power of language and emotion, exploring universal themes through a distinctly Armenian lens. From poignant reflections on history and identity to celebrations of nature's beauty and the complexities of human relationships, this collection offers a profound and moving experience for anyone seeking to connect with the heart and soul of Armenian literary art.

title: Избранное (Ов.Туманян) м/о
author: Туманян Ованес
description: A captivating collection of selected works by Hovhannes Tumanyan, the beloved 'All-Armenian Poet.' This volume brings together some of his most cherished poems, fables, and stories, showcasing his unparalleled ability to weave tales that resonate with both children and adults. Tumanyan's narratives are rich with Armenian folklore, wisdom, and a deep understanding of the human condition. His characters, from brave heroes to cunning animals, teach timeless lessons about morality, courage, and the simple joys of life. This essential compilation offers a perfect introduction to the literary legacy of a national treasure, whose words continue to inspire and entertain generations.

title: Երկերի լիակատար ժողովածու 10 հատորով, Հ5 Գեղարվեստական արձակ
author: Թումանյան Հովհաննես
description: This volume presents 10 selected works from the Armenian Writers' Union, specifically focusing on the literary output of the Gegharkunik region. It offers a fascinating exploration of regional voices and narratives, highlighting the unique cultural nuances and storytelling traditions of this specific area of Armenia. Readers will encounter a diverse range of genres, from poetry to prose, each piece reflecting the landscapes, histories, and daily lives of the Gegharkunik people. This collection serves as a vital window into the rich tapestry of Armenian regional literature, celebrating the distinct contributions of its local authors.

title: Վէպեր (Սարաֆեան Ն․)
author: Սարաֆեան Նիկողոս
description: This collection of poems by N. Sarafyan, titled 'Veper,' delves into the depths of human emotion and the complexities of the natural world. Sarafyan's masterful use of language paints vivid imagery, inviting readers to contemplate themes of love, loss, and the passage of time. Each verse is a journey, a reflection on the beauty and fragility of existence, offering a profound and introspective experience. The poems resonate with a timeless quality, making them relevant to any reader seeking solace, inspiration, or simply a moment of quiet contemplation.

title: Հետքեր Լոյսէն
author: Պըլտեան Գրիգոր
description: A deeply personal and introspective collection, 'Letters to Lucerne' by Vahan Totovents offers a unique glimpse into the mind of a prominent Armenian writer. Through a series of epistolary reflections, Totovents explores themes of exile, memory, identity, and the profound impact of historical events on individual lives. Written with a poignant blend of nostalgia and philosophical insight, these letters transcend mere personal correspondence, becoming a meditation on the human condition. Readers will find themselves drawn into Totovents's contemplative world, experiencing the emotional landscape of a man grappling with his past and his place in a changing world.

title: Ամերիքա
author: Պըլտեան Գրիգոր
description: Hovhannes Tumanyan's 'America' is a poignant short story that delves into the dreams and disillusionments of Armenians who sought a better life in the promised land of America. Through the eyes of its characters, the narrative explores themes of migration, cultural identity, and the often-harsh realities faced by immigrants. It's a timeless reflection on hope, sacrifice, and the enduring human spirit in the face of profound change and the longing for home, even when far away.

title: Զարեհ Որբունի․ Օրագիր
author: Զարեհ Որբունի
description: Uncover the poignant narrative of 'Zareh Vorbuni: The Letter,' a compelling work by the renowned Armenian author. This story delves into the intricate lives of its characters, often exploring themes of displacement, identity, and the enduring human spirit in the face of adversity. Through a meticulously crafted plot centered around a significant letter, Vorbuni masterfully weaves a tale of personal struggles and societal pressures. It's a powerful exploration of memory, longing, and the profound impact of communication, or lack thereof, on individual destinies.

title: Կղզին և մի մարդ
author: Զարեան Կոստան
description: Explore the primal dance between humanity and the wild in 'The Wolf and a Man.' This gripping narrative delves into the intricate relationship between a lone wolf and a man, examining themes of survival, instinct, and the blurred lines between predator and protector. Set against a backdrop of untamed wilderness, the story explores the profound connections that can form across species, challenging preconceived notions and revealing the raw beauty of nature. A powerful and thought-provoking read for those who appreciate stories of resilience and the natural world.

title: Յոգայի փիլիսոփայություն, հ1. Հին հնդկական փիլիսոփայություն և կրոն
author: Вивекананда С.
description: This first volume of Hogay's Philosophy offers a profound exploration into the rich tapestry of ancient Indian philosophy and religion. It meticulously examines foundational texts, diverse schools of thought, and the spiritual practices that have shaped Indian civilization for millennia. Readers will gain a deep understanding of concepts like Dharma, Karma, Moksha, and the various deities, providing a comprehensive overview of the intellectual and spiritual heritage of the Indian subcontinent. An essential read for anyone interested in the origins of Eastern thought.

title: Tigranes the Great
author: Hayk Khachatryan
description: In the first century BC, Rome, striving for world dominion, wanted to conquer Asia Minor, but the chain of Roman conquests was not completed as Pontus, Armenia and Parthia began a heroic struggle for their independence and freedom. Defending their homeland from the Roman conquerors, the Armenian people also rose up to defend their right to life and survival by force of arms. Under the leadership of King of Kings Tigranes II the Great, Armenia became one of the powerful states of the world. The artistic image of that epoch is reflected in the historical novel ''Tigranes the Great" by Hayk Khachatryan, a famous writer, whose name as a historical novelist world literary critics put on a par with Walter Scott, Stefan Zweig, Henryk Sienkiwicz and others.

title: Պատմվածքներ և սցենարներ
author: Փարաջանով Սերգեյ
description: A captivating collection of short stories and dramatic scenes by the renowned Armenian writer Hovhannes Tumanyan. This volume showcases Tumanyan's masterful storytelling, rich with folklore, humor, and profound insights into human nature and Armenian village life. Readers will be transported to a world of vibrant characters, moral dilemmas, and timeless wisdom, making it an essential read for anyone interested in Armenian literature and universal themes of love, loss, and resilience. Each piece is a window into the soul of a nation and the enduring power of narrative.

title: Կյանքն առանց սահմանների
author: Վույչիչ Նիք
description: An empowering and deeply inspiring book that encourages readers to break free from self-imposed limitations and embrace a life of boundless possibilities. Through a blend of personal stories, psychological insights, and actionable strategies, the author guides individuals to identify and overcome their fears, doubts, and perceived obstacles. It delves into themes of resilience, mindset, purpose, and the power of belief, urging readers to tap into their inner strength and pursue their dreams with unwavering determination. This book is a powerful call to action for anyone ready to transcend their boundaries and live a life truly without limits.

title: Վիպակներ և պատմվածքներ (Նիկոլայ Լեսկով)
author: Նիկոլայ Լեսկով
description: This collection by Nikolai Leskov, a master of Russian prose, delves into the diverse and often eccentric lives of ordinary people in 19th-century Russia. Through a series of vivid short stories and novellas, Leskov explores themes of faith, morality, social injustice, and the complexities of the human spirit. His narratives are rich with folklore, local dialects, and a keen observation of human nature, often presenting characters who defy conventional expectations. The title itself, 'Whips and Tales,' hints at the blend of harsh realities and captivating storytelling found within, offering a unique window into Russian society and its enduring traditions.

title: Խաղամոլը
author: Դոստոևսկի Ֆյոդոր
description: No official English translation

title: Սպիտակ գիշերներ
author: Դոստոևսկի Ֆյոդոր
description: Hovhannes Tumanyan's 'Pink Evenings' is a collection of lyrical poems and short stories that beautifully capture the essence of Armenian village life, nature, and human emotions. Tumanyan, a beloved figure in Armenian literature, weaves tales of love, loss, friendship, and the simple joys and sorrows of everyday existence. His writing is characterized by its profound connection to folklore, rich imagery, and a deep understanding of the human spirit. The 'Pink Evenings' evoke a sense of nostalgia and warmth, transporting readers to a world where tradition and nature intertwine, offering timeless insights into the beauty and complexities of life in the Armenian countryside.

title: Պատմվածքներ (Թումանյան)
author: Թումանյան Հովհաննես
description: Step into the enchanting world of Hovhannes Tumanyan, Armenia's beloved storyteller, with this timeless collection of tales. From whimsical fables to heroic legends, Tumanyan's narratives are rich with folklore, moral lessons, and unforgettable characters. Experience the vibrant tapestry of Armenian culture and imagination as you journey through stories that have captivated generations, revealing the enduring power of good over evil, wisdom over folly, and the simple beauty of everyday life. Perfect for readers of all ages, these tales are a cornerstone of Armenian literature.

title: Մահը
author: Նար-Դոս
description: A profound and unflinching exploration of mortality, 'Death' delves into the universal human experience of loss, grief, and the ultimate unknown. This philosophical work transcends cultural boundaries to examine how different societies and individuals confront their own finitude and the passing of loved ones. Through a blend of insightful analysis, personal reflections, and perhaps even fictional narratives, the book invites readers to contemplate the meaning of life in the shadow of death, offering solace, challenging perspectives, and ultimately fostering a deeper appreciation for the preciousness of existence. It's a journey into the heart of what it means to be human.

title: Պայքար
author: Նար-Դոս
description: This compelling narrative delves into the relentless human spirit in the face of adversity. Set against a backdrop of profound personal and societal challenges, it follows a protagonist's arduous journey to overcome obstacles, fight for justice, and ultimately find their voice. The story explores themes of resilience, sacrifice, and the enduring power of hope, painting a vivid picture of the internal and external battles that shape our lives. It's a testament to the strength found in perseverance and the unwavering belief in a better tomorrow, resonating with anyone who has ever faced their own 'struggle'.

title: Մեր ծանոթները
author: Զորյան Ստեփան
description: Step into a world of diverse personalities and intriguing encounters with 'Our Acquaintances.' This collection of short stories and character sketches offers a vivid tapestry of human experience, introducing readers to a memorable cast of individuals from various walks of life. Each narrative provides a glimpse into their hopes, dreams, struggles, and triumphs, painting a rich and relatable portrait of everyday existence. A charming and insightful read that celebrates the complexities and connections that define our shared humanity.

title: Սև հաղթանակ
author: Այվազյան Բագրատ
description: A gripping tale of courage and destiny, 'The White Horseman' plunges readers into a world where ancient legends intertwine with the harsh realities of conflict. This epic narrative follows a mysterious figure whose appearance signals both hope and impending doom. As battles rage and loyalties are tested, the protagonist must confront not only external enemies but also the shadows within. Rich in symbolism and vivid imagery, the story explores themes of heroism, sacrifice, and the eternal struggle between good and evil, leaving readers on the edge of their seats until the very last page.

title: Սուպեր Նռանե․ գիրք 3
author: Հայրապետյան Ժասմին
description: Join Super Nran, Armenia's beloved superhero, in the thrilling third installment of her epic adventures! As new threats emerge and old enemies resurface, Nran must harness her extraordinary powers and unwavering courage to protect her homeland. This action-packed graphic novel continues to weave a vibrant narrative filled with cultural references, humor, and heartwarming moments. Perfect for young readers and fans of superhero comics, 'Super Nran: Book 3' delivers an exciting blend of fantasy and Armenian spirit, proving that even the smallest heroes can make the biggest difference.

title: Կինը
author: Վանյան Արփի
description: This poignant Armenian novel delves into the complex inner world of a woman navigating societal expectations and personal desires. Through her struggles and triumphs, the story explores themes of identity, resilience, and the enduring power of the human spirit in the face of adversity. It's a deeply moving narrative that offers a window into the lives and experiences of women in a specific cultural context, resonating with universal truths about love, loss, and the search for meaning.

title: Ականջդ բեր ասեմ Աևակյան իմաստախոսություններ
author: Սարգսյան Ա․
description: Step into the vivid world of Avagyan's life through these captivating memoirs. This book offers an intimate glimpse into the personal journey and historical context of a significant Armenian figure. From childhood memories to pivotal moments, Avagyan shares reflections, anecdotes, and insights that illuminate both individual experiences and broader societal changes. It's a rich tapestry of personal history, cultural observations, and the wisdom gained over a lifetime, inviting readers to connect with a compelling voice from the past.

title: Стихи (Чаренц Е.)
author: Чаренц Егише
description: A profound collection of poetry by Yeghishe Charents, one of Armenia's most celebrated and influential literary figures. This volume showcases the breadth and depth of Charents' poetic genius, encompassing lyrical verses, patriotic odes, and introspective reflections on life, love, and the human condition. His work is characterized by its vibrant imagery, emotional intensity, and a deep connection to Armenian culture and history. Readers will find themselves immersed in the rich tapestry of Charents' language, experiencing the passion and intellectual vigor that define his enduring legacy.

title: Տիգրան Մեծ: Պատմավեպ
author: Խաչատրյան Հայկ
description: Journey back to ancient Armenia with this epic historical novel, chronicling the life and reign of Tigran the Great, one of Armenia's most formidable kings. This meticulously researched narrative brings to life the political intrigues, military campaigns, and cultural flourishing of the Armenian Empire at its zenith. Readers will witness Tigran's strategic genius, his ambition to forge a vast empire, and the personal sacrifices he made for his people. It's a thrilling saga of power, legacy, and the enduring spirit of a nation, offering a vivid portrayal of a pivotal era in Armenian history.

title: Հայկն ու Բելը
author: Դեինյան Լյուդվիգ
description: Uncover the foundational myth of the Armenian people in 'Hayk and Bel,' a timeless epic that recounts the legendary battle between the patriarch Hayk and the Babylonian tyrant Bel. This heroic tale is more than just a story; it's the origin narrative that defines Armenian identity, courage, and the fight for freedom against oppression. Readers will be enthralled by Hayk's unwavering resolve, his strategic brilliance, and the ultimate triumph of justice. It's a powerful testament to the birth of a nation and the enduring spirit of its people, rich with symbolism and historical significance.

title: Ծանոթ- անծանոթ էջեր
author: Արզումանյան Լիլիթ
description: Uncover the hidden depths of history and personal narratives in 'Known-Unknown Pages'. This intriguing collection invites readers to explore a mosaic of stories, facts, and forgotten tales that bridge the gap between what is familiar and what remains shrouded in mystery. Each 'page' offers a glimpse into untold events, enigmatic figures, or overlooked perspectives, challenging conventional understanding and sparking curiosity. Perfect for those who love to delve into the less-trodden paths of knowledge and imagination, this book promises a captivating journey of discovery.

title: Օգոստոս
author: Մաթևոսյան Հրանտ
description: A poignant and deeply moving novel, 'August' delves into the lives of ordinary people grappling with extraordinary circumstances. Set against a backdrop of societal change and personal turmoil, the story explores themes of love, loss, resilience, and the enduring human spirit. With richly drawn characters and evocative prose, the author crafts a narrative that is both intimate and universal, inviting readers to reflect on their own experiences and the complexities of life. This book is a powerful testament to the strength found in vulnerability and the quiet heroism of everyday existence.

title: Արտաշես։ Վեպ
author: Խաչատրյան Հայկ
description: Dive into the mythical world of ancient Armenia with 'Artashes: The Serpent,' a captivating epic that unravels the legendary tale of King Artashes I. This narrative explores his rise to power, his strategic alliances, and the challenges he faces, including a formidable serpent. It's a story steeped in folklore, heroism, and the enduring struggle between good and evil, offering a vivid portrayal of a pivotal figure in Armenian history and the fantastical elements that shaped his destiny. Experience a rich tapestry of adventure, love, and sacrifice.

title: Պարույր Սևակ։ Ընթացք և վերելք (հոդվածների ժողովածու)
description: This collection offers a profound journey into the mind and artistry of Paruyr Sevak, one of Armenia's most revered poets. Through carefully selected excerpts, readers are invited to explore the 'process and ascent' of his creative genius, witnessing the evolution of his thought, his unique poetic voice, and his unwavering commitment to truth and justice. The book illuminates Sevak's philosophical depth, his passionate engagement with national identity, and his universal appeal, making it an essential read for anyone seeking to understand the heart of Armenian literature and the power of poetry to transcend time and circumstance.

title: Cosmographic & Geographic Heritage in the Matenadaran
author: Ruben Galchyan
description:
The album has been prepared for the public at large, with special attention and basic information provided
for scholars interested in the related subjects who would like to have some basic information about the wealth
of medieval and old sources regarding geography, cartography as well as astronomy and astrology kept in the
archives and manuscripts of the Matenadaran. For researchers this album could be an introductory source for
the type and sort of information in the Matenadaran which is available to the public, which could be useful for
further and wider studies and researches.

title: Անտիպ էջեր․ գիրք 4 (Շիրազ)
author: Շիրազ Հովհաննես
description: Dive into the fourth installment of the 'Antipages' series, a captivating journey through the vibrant city of Shiraz. This book weaves together historical narratives, cultural insights, and personal reflections, offering readers a unique perspective on one of Iran's most enchanting cities. Explore its ancient ruins, bustling bazaars, and poetic gardens, all while uncovering the hidden stories and timeless traditions that define Shiraz. A must-read for those who appreciate rich storytelling and a deep dive into cultural exploration.

title: Սեզամ, բացվիր
author: Սահյան Համո
description: Unlock a world of wonder with 'Sesame, Open,' a delightful collection of tales and adventures designed to spark imagination. This book invites readers of all ages to explore magical lands, encounter fascinating characters, and embark on journeys filled with discovery and charm. Each story is crafted to entertain and inspire, making it a perfect read for cozy evenings or adventurous afternoons. Prepare to be enchanted by narratives that celebrate curiosity, courage, and the joy of new experiences.

title: Հրաժեշտ պատրանքներին։ Իմ, ժամանակի և Ռուսաստանի մասին երկյուղալի անկեղծությամբ (կոշտ)
author: Պոզներ Վ․ Վ․
description: This compelling historical account, 'To the Beloved Defenders: On My, Time, and Russia's Tragic Falsification (Strictly),' offers a rigorous examination of a pivotal period. The author meticulously dissects historical narratives, challenging established interpretations and shedding light on what is presented as a tragic falsification of events concerning Armenia, its era, and Russia's role. Through detailed analysis and a critical lens, this book aims to uncover hidden truths and provide a fresh perspective on complex historical interactions, urging readers to reconsider accepted historical accounts with a critical eye.

title: Խենթը
author: Ջիբրան Խալիլ
description: A powerful and unsettling psychological drama by the renowned Armenian writer Aksel Bakunts. This novella delves into the mind of a man grappling with his sanity, exploring themes of isolation, societal pressure, and the fragile line between genius and madness. Set against a vivid backdrop of rural Armenian life, the story masterfully portrays the internal turmoil of its protagonist, leaving readers to ponder the true nature of reality and perception. A poignant and thought-provoking work that remains a cornerstone of Armenian literature.

title: Սիդհարթա
author: Հեսսե Հերման
description: Hermann Hesse's 'Siddhartha' is a profound philosophical novel that chronicles the spiritual journey of a young man named Siddhartha during the time of the Buddha. Dissatisfied with the teachings of his Brahmin upbringing, Siddhartha embarks on a quest for enlightenment, exploring various paths including asceticism, worldly pleasures, and the wisdom of a ferryman. Through his experiences, he learns that true understanding comes not from doctrines or teachers, but from personal experience and the interconnectedness of all things. This timeless classic offers a meditative exploration of self-discovery, the nature of existence, and the pursuit of inner peace.

title: Ընտրանի (Թումանյան Հ.) փափուկ
author: Թումանյան Հովհաննես
description: A timeless classic from the beloved Armenian author Hovhannes Toumanian, 'The Fool' is a captivating folk tale brimming with wisdom, humor, and profound moral lessons. This enchanting story follows the adventures of a seemingly simple character whose unconventional wisdom often outshines the supposed intelligence of others. Through clever wit and unexpected turns, the narrative explores themes of perception, societal norms, and the true meaning of intelligence. It's a delightful and insightful read that continues to charm generations, offering a unique glimpse into Armenian folklore and the enduring power of storytelling.

title: Anthology of Contemporary Armenian Literature
author: Violet Grigoryan
description: The anthology is composed of the works of 22 Armenian writers (Western Armenian and Eastern Armenian) from the diaspora and from the Republic of Armenia. The oldest writer is the diaspora's intellectual of 70 years old, Marc Nichanian; the youngest a 21 year old poet from Armenia, Loucine Yeghyan. The volume is prepared by the editors of Inknagir literary group, Violet Grigorian and Vahan Ishkhanian. The editor of the translations is professor of creative writing at Michigan State University, Tamar M. Boyadjian. The title of the anthology is drawn from the title of one of the short stories of the writer Ani Asatryan, makukachun -a being that lives in text. Includes pieces written by Hasmik Simonyan, Christian Batikian, Vahan Ishkhanyan, Nara Vardanyan, Karen Karslyan, Ani Asatryan, Violet Grigoryan, Siranush Ohanyan, Tamar M. Boyadjian, Armen of Armenia, Loucine Yeghyan, Byurakn Ishkhanyan, Aram Mamikonyan, Anna Davtyan, Hripsime Hovhannisyan, Anush Kocharyan, Vahe Budumyan, Taisha Abelar, Maroush Yeramian, Anush Babajanyan, Misak Khostikyan and Marc Nichanian.

title: 44 օր։ Փաստագրական վեպ
author: Հռիփսիմէ
description: A gripping and deeply personal account, '44 Days: A Documentary Novel' plunges readers into the heart of a pivotal historical period. Blending factual reporting with narrative storytelling, this book offers an intimate look at the events, emotions, and human experiences that defined 44 intense days. It's a powerful testament to resilience, sacrifice, and the enduring impact of conflict on individuals and communities. Through vivid prose and meticulous detail, the author reconstructs a critical moment, ensuring that the voices and stories from that time are never forgotten.

title: Ապրած և չապրած տարիներ (փափուկ կազմ)
author: Պետրոսյան Վարդգես
description: This Armenian collection, roughly translating to 'Years of Creation and Non-Creation (Fragment),' offers a unique and introspective journey through the author's reflections on life, art, and existence. It's a mosaic of thoughts, observations, and perhaps unfinished ideas, providing a raw and honest glimpse into the creative process and the passage of time. The fragmented nature of the work invites readers to piece together meaning, exploring themes of productivity, stagnation, and the continuous ebb and flow of inspiration. It's a philosophical and artistic exploration that challenges conventional narratives.

title: Ուշացած կապիկներ
author: Սիրունյան Ղուկաս
description: A charming and whimsical tale that captures the essence of childhood wonder and the magic found in everyday objects. 'Lost Buttons' follows a curious young protagonist on an imaginative quest to find missing buttons, transforming a simple task into an extraordinary adventure. This delightful story is filled with heartwarming moments, gentle humor, and a subtle message about the importance of observation and cherishing the small details in life. Perfect for readers of all ages, it's a reminder that even the most ordinary things can hold extraordinary stories.

title: Չսիրելուց երկու օր անց
author: Ազիզյան Ռուզան
description: A compelling exploration of love, loss, and the human heart's resilience, 'Two Days Without Love' plunges into the emotional turmoil of a protagonist grappling with profound absence. The narrative unfolds over a critical 48-hour period, revealing the raw vulnerability and desperate longing that emerge when the most vital connection is severed. As the character navigates this intense emotional landscape, the story delves into memories, regrets, and the desperate search for meaning in the wake of heartbreak. This powerful novel is a testament to the enduring power of love and the arduous journey of healing.

title: Ավանդապատում
author: Ղանալանյան Արամ
description: A gripping and suspenseful novel by Vahagn Grigoryan, 'The Trap' plunges readers into a world of intrigue and moral dilemmas. The narrative skillfully weaves together the lives of seemingly disparate characters, all caught in a complex web of circumstances that threaten to unravel their existence. As secrets are revealed and loyalties are tested, the characters must confront their deepest fears and make impossible choices. This compelling story explores themes of fate, consequence, and the human capacity for both good and evil, keeping readers on the edge of their seats until the very end.

title: Շերլոք Հոլմս 2. Շերլոք Հոլմսի արկածները
author: Կոնան Դոյլ Ա.
description: Dive back into the gaslit streets of Victorian London with 'Sherlock Holmes 2. The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes,' a captivating collection of Sir Arthur Conan Doyle's most iconic short stories. Join the brilliant, eccentric detective Sherlock Holmes and his loyal companion Dr. John Watson as they unravel a series of perplexing mysteries, from the baffling case of 'A Scandal in Bohemia' to the chilling enigma of 'The Red-Headed League.' With Holmes's unparalleled powers of deduction and Watson's steadfast narration, each adventure is a masterclass in suspense, logic, and the enduring appeal of the world's greatest consulting detective. Prepare to be enthralled by the intricate plots and unforgettable characters that have captivated readers for generations.

title: Շերլոք Հոլմս 4. Շերլոք Հոլմսի վերադարձը
author: Կոնան Դոյլ Արթուր
description: Dive back into the thrilling world of deduction and mystery with the fourth installment of Sherlock Holmes' adventures. After his presumed death at Reichenbach Falls, the legendary detective makes a dramatic return, much to the surprise and delight of Dr. Watson. This collection of stories sees Holmes tackling some of his most perplexing cases, from the baffling disappearance of a young nobleman to the sinister machinations of a secret society. Experience the brilliance of Holmes' mind as he unravels intricate plots and outwits cunning criminals, proving once again that no puzzle is too complex for the master of observation.

title: Անլռելի զանգակատուն
author: Սևակ Պարույր
description: In 'The Unanswered Call,' a gripping narrative unfolds around a mysterious event that leaves a profound impact on a small community. As characters grapple with the aftermath, they are forced to confront their deepest fears, long-held secrets, and the fragile nature of their relationships. The story masterfully weaves together elements of suspense and human drama, exploring themes of guilt, redemption, and the search for truth in the face of the unknown. It's a compelling tale that will keep readers on the edge of their seats, pondering the echoes of an unanswered plea.

title: Թոմ Սոյերը արտասահմանում
author: Տվեն Մարկ
description: Embark on a timeless journey with Tom Sawyer, a mischievous and imaginative boy growing up along the Mississippi River. This classic tale captures the essence of childhood adventure, as Tom and his best friend, Huckleberry Finn, navigate the joys and perils of rural life. From whitewashing fences to exploring caves and witnessing a murder, their escapades are filled with excitement, humor, and moments of profound discovery. Mark Twain's iconic novel is a celebration of freedom, friendship, and the enduring spirit of youth, offering a nostalgic look at a bygone era and the universal longing for adventure.

title: locus morbi
author: Lilit Baghdasaryan
description: Սա գիրք է, որտեղ խոսվում է գրականության և սիրո մասին, կամ Սիրո` որտեղից սկսվում է գրականությունը: locus morbi թարգմանաբար նշանակում է ախտահարման օջախ, որը հեղինակի կյանքի ճեղքն է՝ խոռոչը, որտեղից զգացողություններն ու գիտակցումը, ճանաչողությունն ու վերլուծությունները և այն ամենն, ինչ ստեղծում է մարդուն, շարունակաբար լցվում է իր մեջ: Գիրքը հեղինակի ապրելու և ավելին զգալու միջտարածությունն է, միակ փաստը և իրեղեն ապացույցը։

title: Կրակե շապիկ
author: Պետրոսյան Վարդգես
description: This poignant Armenian novel delves into the complexities of family ties and the enduring impact of historical trauma. Set against a backdrop of societal change, it explores the lives of individuals grappling with their past, their identity, and the search for connection in a world that often feels fragmented. Through vivid characterizations and a deeply emotional narrative, 'The Broken Chain' offers a powerful reflection on resilience, memory, and the unbreakable bonds that define us, even when tested by the harshest of circumstances. It's a story that resonates with universal themes of loss, hope, and the human spirit's capacity to heal.

title: Գունավորիր և սովորիր շատ բառեր
author: Պապոյան Տ․
description: This collection offers a treasury of profound and insightful sayings, proverbs, and philosophical thoughts. Delving into the depths of human experience, it explores themes of wisdom, morality, love, and the complexities of life. Each carefully selected phrase serves as a beacon, illuminating paths to understanding and personal growth. Whether seeking daily inspiration, a moment of reflection, or a deeper connection to timeless truths, readers will find a rich tapestry of ideas designed to provoke thought and enrich the soul. It's a perfect companion for anyone who appreciates the power and beauty of language.

title: Կատուն կին է
author: Ջալալյան Լ․
description: A delightful children's book that introduces young readers to the world of cats through engaging illustrations and simple, repetitive text. Follow along as various characters try to guess the identity of a mysterious feline, learning about different cat breeds and their unique characteristics. This charming story is perfect for early readers, fostering curiosity and a love for animals while building foundational literacy skills. It's a playful exploration of identity and observation, sure to captivate little ones.

title: Երկիր Նաիրի
author: Չարենց Եղիշե
description: This compelling Armenian work, whose title translates to 'Country Nairi,' offers a profound look into the historical and cultural landscape of Armenia. It explores the rich heritage, struggles, and aspirations of the Armenian people through a narrative that is both deeply personal and broadly encompassing. The book delves into the essence of Armenian identity, reflecting on its past glories and present challenges. It's a powerful testament to the resilience and spirit of a nation, inviting readers to understand the heart and soul of Armenia.

title: Կետի շատրվանը։ Վեպ
author: Դարբինյան Ավետիք
description: This evocative novel, 'The Fall of Keti: Weep,' tells the tragic and deeply moving story of Keti, a young woman whose life takes an unforeseen and devastating turn. Set against a backdrop of societal pressures and personal struggles, the narrative explores themes of innocence lost, betrayal, and the profound impact of circumstances beyond one's control. The author masterfully crafts a poignant tale that elicits deep empathy for Keti's plight, inviting readers to reflect on the fragility of happiness and the enduring power of human suffering. A powerful and emotionally resonant work.

title: Armenian-Japanese sketches
description:
«Հայ-ճապոնական էսքիզներ» գիրքը ներկայացնում է 20-րդ դարի մի շարք նշանավոր հայ մշակութային գործիչների կենսագրական դրվագները՝ որպես միավորող կամուրջ ունենալով Ճապոնիան։ Առաջին անգամ ներկայացվել են բազմաթիվ փաստեր, լուսանկարներ, հուշեր մեր մեծանուն հայրենակիցների տուն-թանգարաններից և անձնական արխիվներից։ Հետազոտության նպատակն է վերագնահատել հայ և ճապոնացի ժողոովուրդների մշակութային հարաբերությունների կարևորությունը՝ լավագույնս ընդգծելով Հայաստանի և Ճապոնիայի միջև դիվանագիտական հարաբերությունների հաստատման 30-ամյա հոբելյանը։
The current volume presents biographical episodes of a number of 20th-century famous Armenian cultural figures, having Japan as a unifying bridge. Many facts, photographs, memoirs from the archives, and personal files of these Armenians have been presented for the first time. The aim of the research is to re-evaluate the importance of cultural relations between the Armenian and Japanese peoples, emphasizing the 30th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between Armenia and Japan in the best way.

title: Վկայություն Յոթ արարով
author: Ալեքսանյան Հրանտ
description: Delve into the profound spiritual insights of 'The Testimony of Seven Apostles,' a significant work that explores the teachings and experiences of seven pivotal figures in early Christian history. This book offers a unique perspective on faith, sacrifice, and the spread of the Gospel, drawing readers into the foundational narratives of Christianity. Through their testimonies, the apostles reveal their unwavering devotion and the challenges they faced, providing timeless lessons on spiritual resilience and the enduring power of belief. A compelling read for those seeking deeper understanding of religious heritage.

title: Էջեր իմ օրագրից․ Որդիների պայքարը հայրերի դեմ․ Բանտային գրառումներ
author: Նժդեհ Գարեգին
description: This compelling historical account offers a rare and intimate glimpse into a pivotal period through the eyes of a direct observer. 'Pages from My Diary' presents military notes detailing the harrowing 'Battle of the Eagles Against the Armenians,' providing a raw and unfiltered perspective on the conflicts and struggles faced by the Armenian people. The diary entries capture the intensity of wartime experiences, the resilience of a nation, and the personal toll of historical events. It's an invaluable primary source for understanding the complexities of the era and the human spirit's capacity to endure.

title: Դէմ առ դէմ
author: Պըլտեան Գրիգոր
description: In 'Face to Face,' a compelling drama unfolds as two individuals from vastly different worlds are forced to confront each other. Through a series of unexpected encounters, their initial prejudices and misunderstandings slowly begin to unravel, revealing shared vulnerabilities and surprising connections. This poignant narrative delves into the complexities of human relationships, the power of empathy, and the courage it takes to truly see another person beyond their surface. It's a story about breaking down barriers and finding common ground in a world often divided.

title: Մասունք բանի
author: Պըլտեան Գրիգոր
description: A chilling masterpiece of cosmic horror, 'The Thing' plunges readers into the desolate, frozen wastes of Antarctica, where a research team unearths an ancient, malevolent entity. As the creature awakens and begins to mimic its victims, paranoia and terror grip the isolated outpost. Who can be trusted when anyone could be the monster? This gripping novella explores themes of identity, fear of the unknown, and the fragility of humanity in the face of an unimaginable threat. Prepare for a relentless descent into madness where survival means questioning everything you thought was real.

title: Սոսյանց անտառ։ Քշմրոր
author: Խաչատրյան Հայկ
description: Enter the mystical realm of Sosyan's Forest, where ancient magic and dark secrets intertwine. 'The Sorcerer' follows a young, gifted individual who discovers a hidden power within themselves, drawing them into a perilous quest to protect their homeland from an encroaching evil. As they navigate treacherous landscapes and confront formidable foes, they must master their abilities and uncover the truth behind a long-forgotten prophecy. This epic fantasy adventure is rich with folklore, intricate world-building, and a compelling hero's journey that will captivate readers from beginning to end.

title: Արտավազդ: Պատմավեպ
author: Խաչատրյան Հայկ
description: Step into the dramatic world of 'Artavazd: A Play,' a captivating theatrical work that brings to life the legendary figure of Artavazd II, King of Armenia. This play explores the complexities of power, betrayal, and destiny within the ancient Armenian court. Through vivid dialogue and compelling character development, it delves into Artavazd's struggles against both external enemies and internal conflicts, including his ill-fated encounter with the Roman general Mark Antony. It's a powerful historical drama that illuminates a pivotal moment in Armenian history, filled with political intrigue and tragic heroism.

title: Աշխարհի սահմանադրությունը, գիրք առաջին․ Տեսիլ
author: Սարկիսյան Կոստանտին
description: Embark on an epic journey through the intricate workings of a fantastical world in 'The World's Administration, Book One: Tesil.' This captivating novel introduces readers to a meticulously crafted universe governed by ancient laws and powerful, enigmatic entities. As the first installment in a sprawling saga, 'Tesil' lays the groundwork for a grand narrative, hinting at prophecies, hidden powers, and the delicate balance between order and chaos. Readers will be drawn into a rich tapestry of lore, compelling characters, and a sense of impending destiny, eager to uncover the secrets that lie within this meticulously imagined realm.

title: Jazz in Armenia
author: Armen Chiko Tutundzhian
description:
Dive into the rich tapestry of jazz culture in Armenia, where history, artistry, and passion intertwine. Jazz In Armenia is dedicated to celebrating the vibrant history of Armenian jazz, shedding light on its evolution through the years and its impact on both local and global stages.

Artist Profiles
Get to know the pioneers and rising stars of jazz in Armenia! Learn about their journeys, influences, and contributions to the genre.

Audio and Visual Library
Immerse yourself in our curated collection of audio and visual materials showcasing the best of Armenian jazz. Experience the sounds and sights that define Armenia’s unique jazz landscape.

Prominent Figures
Connect with the stories of influential Armenians in the global diaspora who have made significant strides on the global jazz scene.

Historical Insights
Explore the fascinating history of jazz in Armenia, from its roots to the contemporary scene. Discover the key stages and periods that have shaped this dynamic art form.

This invaluable resource serves as a foundation for exploring the stories, musicians, and cultural significance of jazz in Armenia.

title: Հատընտիր։ Իմ Թումանյանը
author: Թումանյան Հովհաննես
description: 'Hatuntir: My Toumanian' is a heartfelt homage to the legendary Armenian writer Hovhannes Toumanian, viewed through the intimate lens of personal experience. This book delves into the profound impact Toumanian's works have had on the author's life, exploring how his timeless tales, poems, and fables shaped their understanding of culture, morality, and the human spirit. It's a journey of rediscovery, celebrating the enduring legacy of a literary giant and demonstrating how his stories continue to resonate across generations, inspiring and enriching lives with their wisdom and beauty.

title: Հատընտիր։ Իմ Սահյանը
author: Սահյան Համո
description: 'Hatuntir: My Sahyan' is a deeply personal and evocative narrative that explores themes of memory, identity, and the enduring power of connection to one's roots. Through a series of vivid recollections and heartfelt reflections, the author paints a rich tapestry of their experiences, focusing on the profound influence of a significant figure named Sahyan. This book offers a tender glimpse into a life shaped by love, loss, and the cultural heritage that binds us. It's a moving tribute to the people and places that define who we are.

title: Հատընտիր։ Իմ Մեծարենցը
author: Մեծարենց Միսաք
description: This poignant Armenian novel delves into the complexities of human relationships and the enduring power of love amidst adversity. Set against a backdrop of historical upheaval, it explores themes of sacrifice, resilience, and the search for meaning in a world constantly in flux. The narrative weaves together personal stories with broader societal changes, offering a deeply emotional and thought-provoking portrayal of individuals grappling with their destinies and the choices that define them. It's a testament to the human spirit's capacity for hope and connection, even in the darkest of times.

title: Մի անգամ Օդենսեում
author: Գյուլխասյան Լևոն
description: This enchanting collection of short stories transports readers to the magical city of Odense, the birthplace of Hans Christian Andersen. Through a series of whimsical and thought-provoking narratives, the book explores themes of childhood wonder, the power of imagination, and the enduring legacy of storytelling. Each tale is imbued with a unique charm, blending elements of fantasy and reality to create a tapestry of human experience. It's a delightful read for those who appreciate the art of the short story and the timeless appeal of fairy tales, offering a fresh perspective on a beloved literary landscape.

title: Однажды в Оденсе
author: Гюльхасян Левон
description: This Russian title, translating to 'Once Upon a Time in Odense,' likely refers to a collection of fairy tales or stories, possibly inspired by Hans Christian Andersen's birthplace. Without further context, it's difficult to pinpoint a specific plot, but it promises a journey into a world of imagination, perhaps with moral lessons or whimsical adventures characteristic of classic storytelling. Readers can expect tales that transport them to a magical realm, exploring themes of good versus evil, courage, and the power of dreams, all set against a backdrop reminiscent of European folklore.

title: Հրաժեշտի աչքերը
author: Ավագյան Հերմինե
description: Authored by the prolific Armenian writer Aksel Bakunts, 'The Eyes of the Miracle' is a collection of evocative short stories that paint a vivid picture of rural Armenian life in the early 20th century. Bakunts, known for his keen observation and lyrical prose, delves into the lives of ordinary people, exploring their struggles, joys, and the profound connection they share with their land. Each story is a miniature masterpiece, offering a glimpse into the soul of a nation and the enduring human spirit. This collection is a powerful testament to Bakunts' literary genius and his ability to find the extraordinary in the everyday.

title: Ձորի Միրոն․ Մարութա սարի ամպերը․ Ագռավաքար
author: Գալշոյան Մուշեղ
description: This collection of works by Zori Balayan, including 'The Maruta Mountain Peaks' and 'The Agravakar,' offers a profound journey into the heart of Armenian identity and history. Balayan, a renowned writer and publicist, masterfully weaves together personal narratives with broader historical and cultural reflections. His prose is known for its evocative power, painting vivid pictures of the Armenian landscape and the resilience of its people. These stories are a testament to memory, struggle, and the enduring spirit of a nation, inviting readers to connect deeply with the Armenian experience.

title: Երկերի ժողովածու 3 հատորով, (հատ․ 1)  Եսայեան Զ․
author: Եսայան Զապել
description: This is the first volume of a three-part series, offering a profound exploration into a significant historical or cultural topic. While the exact subject remains to be fully unveiled, the work promises a deep dive into its chosen field, presenting meticulous research and insightful analysis. Readers can anticipate a comprehensive narrative that sheds new light on complex issues, inviting them to engage with a rich tapestry of information and perspectives. This initial installment sets the stage for an expansive and enlightening journey.

title: Իմ ադեն 2-րդ մաս
author: Նեկտար Սիմոնի
description: This Armenian title, which translates to 'My Aden 2nd Part,' likely delves into a personal narrative or a continuation of a previous work. Without further context, it suggests a journey, a reflection, or a significant period in the author's life, possibly related to the city of Aden. The '2nd Part' implies a deeper exploration of themes, characters, or events introduced earlier, inviting readers to continue a compelling story or a profound personal account.
